70 
71 #define RMUTEX_NAME_TDES_TOPOP "TDES_TOPOP"
72 
73 #define MVCC_OLDEST_ACTIVE_BUFFER_LENGTH 300
74 
75 /* bit area sizes expressed in bits */
76 #define MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS 64
77 #define MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED 0xffffffffffffffffULL
78 #define MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_COMMITTED 1
79 #define MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE 0
80 
81 /* bit area size after cleanup */
82 #define MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_AFTER_FULL_CLEANUP 16
83 
84 /* maximum size - 500 UINT64 */
85 #define MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_ELEMENTS 500
86 
87 /* maximum size - 32000 bits */
88 #define MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS 32000
89 
90 #define MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS(count_bits) (((count_bits) + 63) >> 6)
91 #define MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_BYTES(count_bits) ((((count_bits) + 63) >> 6) << 3)
92 #define MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES(count_elements) ((count_elements) << 3)
93 #define MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS(count_elements) ((count_elements) << 6)
94 
95 #define NUM_ASSIGNED_TRAN_INDICES log_Gl.trantable.num_assigned_indices
96 #define NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES log_Gl.trantable.num_total_indices
97 
98 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
99 #define pthread_mutex_init(a, b)
100 #define pthread_mutex_destroy(a)
101 #define pthread_mutex_lock(a) 0
102 #define pthread_mutex_trylock(a) 0
103 #define pthread_mutex_unlock(a)
104 #endif /* not SERVER_MODE */
105 
106 static const int LOG_MAX_NUM_CONTIGUOUS_TDES = INT_MAX / sizeof (LOG_TDES);
107 static const float LOG_EXPAND_TRANTABLE_RATIO = 1.25; /* Increase table by 25% */
108 static const int LOG_TOPOPS_STACK_INCREMENT = 3; /* No more than 3 nested top system operations */
109 static const char *log_Client_id_unknown_string = "(unknown)";
110 static BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL log_Client_credential = {
111  BOOT_CLIENT_SYSTEM_INTERNAL, /* client_type */
112  NULL, /* client_info */
113  NULL, /* db_name */
114  NULL, /* db_user */
115  NULL, /* db_password */
116  (char *) "(system)", /* program_name */
117  NULL, /* login_name */
118  NULL, /* host_name */
119  NULL, /* preferred_hosts */
120  0, /* connect_order */
121  -1 /* process_id */
122 };

124 static const unsigned int LOGTB_RETRY_SLAM_MAX_TIMES = 10;
125 
126 static int logtb_expand_trantable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int num_new_indices);
127 static int logtb_allocate_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid, TRAN_STATE state,
128  const BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL * client_credential, TRAN_STATE * current_state,
129  int wait_msecs, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation);

132 static void logtb_initialize_trantable (TRANTABLE * trantable_p);
133 static int logtb_initialize_system_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);
134 static void logtb_set_number_of_assigned_tran_indices (int num_trans);
135 static void logtb_increment_number_of_assigned_tran_indices ();
136 static void logtb_decrement_number_of_assigned_tran_indices ();
137 static void logtb_set_number_of_total_tran_indices (int num_total_trans);
138 static void logtb_set_loose_end_tdes (LOG_TDES * tdes);
139 static bool logtb_is_interrupted_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes, bool clear, bool * continue_checking);
140 static void logtb_dump_tdes_distribute_transaction (FILE * out_fp, int global_tran_id, LOG_2PC_COORDINATOR * coord);
141 static void logtb_dump_top_operations (FILE * out_fp, LOG_TOPOPS_STACK * topops_p);
142 static void logtb_dump_tdes (FILE * out_fp, LOG_TDES * tdes);
143 static void logtb_set_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes, const BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL * client_credential,
144  int wait_msecs, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation);
145 static int logtb_initialize_mvcctable (void);
146 static void logtb_finalize_mvcctable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);
147 static void logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid (UINT64 * bit_area, int bit_area_length, MVCCID bit_area_start_mvccid,
148  MVCCID * long_tran_mvccids, unsigned int long_tran_mvccids_length,
149  MVCCID * lowest_active_mvccid);
150 static void logtb_get_highest_completed_mvccid (UINT64 * bit_area, int bit_area_length, MVCCID bit_area_start_mvccid,
151  MVCCID * highest_completed_mvccid);
152 static int logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot_data (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);

154 static void logtb_tran_free_update_stats (LOG_TRAN_UPDATE_STATS * log_upd_stats);
155 static void logtb_tran_clear_update_stats (LOG_TRAN_UPDATE_STATS * log_upd_stats);
156 static unsigned int logtb_tran_btid_hash_func (const void *key, const unsigned int ht_size);
157 static int logtb_tran_btid_hash_cmp_func (const void *key1, const void *key2);
158 static LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *logtb_tran_create_class_cos (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const OID * class_oid);
159 static LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *logtb_tran_create_btid_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const BTID * btid);
160 static int logtb_tran_update_delta_hash_func (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, void *data, void *args);
161 static int logtb_tran_update_all_global_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);
162 static int logtb_tran_load_global_stats_func (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, void *data, void *args);
163 static int logtb_tran_reset_cos_func (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, void *data, void *args);
164 static int logtb_load_global_statistics_to_tran (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p);
165 static int logtb_create_unique_stats_from_repr (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, OID * class_oid);
166 static GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *logtb_get_global_unique_stats_entry (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid,
167  bool load_at_creation);
168 static void *logtb_global_unique_stat_alloc (void);
169 static int logtb_global_unique_stat_free (void *unique_stat);
170 static int logtb_global_unique_stat_init (void *unique_stat);
171 static int logtb_global_unique_stat_key_copy (void *src, void *dest);
172 static void logtb_free_tran_mvcc_info (LOG_TDES * tdes);
173 static int logtb_allocate_snapshot_data (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCC_SNAPSHOT * snapshot);
174 
175 static int logtb_assign_subtransaction_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCC_INFO * curr_mvcc_info, MVCCID mvcc_subid);
176 
177 static int logtb_check_kill_tran_auth (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_id, bool * has_authorization);
178 static void logtb_find_thread_entry_mapfunc (THREAD_ENTRY & thread_ref, bool & stop_mapper, int tran_index,
179  bool except_me, REFPTR (THREAD_ENTRY, found_ptr));
180 
181 /*
182  * logtb_realloc_topops_stack - realloc stack of top system operations
183  *
184  * return: stack or NULL
185  *
186  * tdes(in): State structure of transaction to realloc stack
187  * num_elms(in):
188  *
189  * Note: Realloc the current transaction top system operation stack by
190  * the given number of entries.
191  */
192 void *
193 logtb_realloc_topops_stack (LOG_TDES * tdes, int num_elms)
194 {
195  size_t size;
196  void *newptr;
197 
198  if (num_elms < LOG_TOPOPS_STACK_INCREMENT)
199  {
200  num_elms = LOG_TOPOPS_STACK_INCREMENT;
201  }
202 
203  size = tdes->topops.max + num_elms;
204  size = size * sizeof (*tdes->topops.stack);
205 
206  newptr = (LOG_TOPOPS_ADDRESSES *) realloc (tdes->topops.stack, size);
207  if (newptr != NULL)
208  {
209  tdes->topops.stack = (LOG_TOPOPS_ADDRESSES *) newptr;
210  if (tdes->topops.max == 0)
211  {
212  tdes->topops.last = -1;
213  }
214  tdes->topops.max += num_elms;
215  }
216  else
217  {
218  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
219  return NULL;
220  }
221  return tdes->topops.stack;
222 }
223 
224 /*
225  * logtb_allocate_tdes_area -
226  *
227  * return:
228  *
229  * num_indices(in):
230  *
231  * Note:
232  */
233 static LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA *
234 logtb_allocate_tdes_area (int num_indices)
235 {
236  LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA *area; /* Contiguous area for new transaction indices */
237  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
238  int i, tran_index;
239  size_t area_size;
240 
241  /*
242  * Allocate an area for the transaction descriptors, set the address of
243  * each transaction descriptor, and keep the address of the area for
244  * deallocation purposes at shutdown time.
245  */
246  area_size = num_indices * sizeof (LOG_TDES) + sizeof (LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA);
247  area = (LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA *) malloc (area_size);
248  if (area == NULL)
249  {
250  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, area_size);
251  return NULL;
252  }
253 
254  area->tdesarea = ((LOG_TDES *) ((char *) area + sizeof (LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA)));
255  area->next = log_Gl.trantable.area;
256 
257  /*
258  * Initialize every newly created transaction descriptor index
259  */
260  for (i = 0, tran_index = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i < num_indices; tran_index++, i++)
261  {
262  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[tran_index] = &area->tdesarea[i];
263  logtb_initialize_tdes (tdes, i);
264  }
265 
266  return area;
267 }
268 
269 /*
270  * logtb_expand_trantable - expand the transaction table
271  *
272  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
273  *
274  * num_new_indices(in): Number of indices of expansion.
275  * (i.e., threads/clients of execution)
276  *
277  * Note: Expand the transaction table with the number of given indices.
278  */
279 static int
280 logtb_expand_trantable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int num_new_indices)
281 {
282  LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA *area; /* Contiguous area for new transaction indices */
283  int total_indices; /* Total number of transaction indices */
284  int i;
285  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
286  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table;
287 
288 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
289  /*
290  * When second time this function invoked during normal processing,
291  * just return.
292  */
293  total_indices = MAX_NTRANS;
294  if (log_Gl.rcv_phase == LOG_RESTARTED && total_indices <= NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES)
295  {
296  return NO_ERROR;
297  }
298 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
299 
300  while (num_new_indices > LOG_MAX_NUM_CONTIGUOUS_TDES)
301  {
302  error_code = logtb_expand_trantable (thread_p, LOG_MAX_NUM_CONTIGUOUS_TDES);
303  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
304  {
305  goto error;
306  }
307  num_new_indices -= LOG_MAX_NUM_CONTIGUOUS_TDES;
308  }
309 
310  if (num_new_indices <= 0)
311  {
312  return NO_ERROR;
313  }
314 
315 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
316  if (log_Gl.rcv_phase != LOG_RESTARTED)
317  {
318  total_indices = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES + num_new_indices;
319  }
320 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
321  total_indices = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES + num_new_indices;
322 #endif
323 
324  /*
325  * NOTE that this realloc is OK since we are in a critical section.
326  * Nobody should have pointer to transaction table
327  */
328  i = total_indices * sizeof (*log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes);
329  log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes = (LOG_TDES **) realloc (log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes, i);
330  if (log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes == NULL)
331  {
332  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) i);
333  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
334  goto error;
335  }
336 
337  area = logtb_allocate_tdes_area (num_new_indices);
338  if (area == NULL)
339  {
340  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
341  goto error;
342  }
343 
344  /*
345  * Notify other modules of new number of transaction indices
346  */
347 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
348  error_code = wfg_alloc_nodes (thread_p, total_indices);
349  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
350  {
351  free_and_init (area);
352  goto error;
353  }
354 #endif
355 
356  /* reallocate transaction_lowest_active_mvccids, if already initialized */
357  mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
358  if (mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids != NULL)
359  {
360  mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids =
361  (MVCCID *) realloc ((void *) mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids, total_indices * sizeof (MVCCID));
362  if (mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids == NULL)
363  {
364  free_and_init (area);
365  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
366  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, total_indices * sizeof (MVCCID));
367 
368  goto error;
369  }
370  }
371 
372  if (qmgr_allocate_tran_entries (thread_p, total_indices) != NO_ERROR)
373  {
374  free_and_init (area);
375  error_code = ER_FAILED;
376  goto error;
377  }
378 
379  log_Gl.trantable.area = area;
380  log_Gl.trantable.hint_free_index = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES;
381  logtb_set_number_of_total_tran_indices (total_indices);
382 
383  return error_code;
384 
385  /* **** */
386 error:
387  return error_code;
388 }
389 
390 /*
391  * logtb_define_trantable - define the transaction table
392  *
393  * return: nothing
394  *
395  * num_expected_tran_indices(in): Number of expected concurrent transactions
396  * (i.e., threads/clients of execution)
397  * num_expected_locks(in): Number of expected locks
398  *
399  * Note: Define the transaction table which is used to support the
400  * number of expected transactions.
401  */
402 void
403 logtb_define_trantable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int num_expected_tran_indices, int num_expected_locks)
404 {
405  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
406 
407  LOG_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
408  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
409 
410  if (logpb_is_pool_initialized ())
411  {
412  logpb_finalize_pool (thread_p);
413  }
414 
415  (void) logtb_define_trantable_log_latch (thread_p, num_expected_tran_indices);
416 
417  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
418 
419  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
420  LOG_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
421 }
422 
423 /*
424  * logtb_define_trantable_log_latch - define the transaction table
425  *
426  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER status otherwise
427  *
428  * num_expected_tran_indices(in): Number of expected concurrent transactions
429  * (i.e., threads/clients of execution)
430  * num_expected_locks(in): Number of expected locks
431  *
432  * Note: This function is only called by the log manager when the log
433  * latch has already been acquired. (See logtb_define_trantable for
434  * other uses).
435  */
436 int
437 logtb_define_trantable_log_latch (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int num_expected_tran_indices)
438 {
439  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
440 
441  assert (LOG_CS_OWN_WRITE_MODE (thread_p));
442 
443  /*
444  * for XA support: there is prepared transaction after recovery.
445  * so, can not recreate transaction description
446  * table after recovery.
447  *
448  * Total number of transaction descriptor is set to the value of
449  * MAX_NTRANS
450  */
451  num_expected_tran_indices = MAX (num_expected_tran_indices, MAX_NTRANS);
452 
453  num_expected_tran_indices = MAX (num_expected_tran_indices, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX + 1);
454 
455  /* If there is an already defined table, free such a table */
456  if (log_Gl.trantable.area != NULL)
457  {
458  logtb_undefine_trantable (thread_p);
459  }
460  else
461  {
462  /* Initialize the transaction table as empty */
463  logtb_initialize_trantable (&log_Gl.trantable);
464  }
465 
466  /*
467  * Create an area to keep the number of desired transaction descriptors
468  */
469 
470  error_code = logtb_expand_trantable (thread_p, num_expected_tran_indices);
471  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
472  {
473  /*
474  * Unable to create transaction table to hold the desired number
475  * of indices. Probably, a lot of indices were requested.
476  * try again with defaults.
477  */
478  if (log_Gl.trantable.area != NULL)
479  {
480  logtb_undefine_trantable (thread_p);
481  }
482 
483 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
484  if (num_expected_tran_indices <= LOG_ESTIMATE_NACTIVE_TRANS || log_Gl.rcv_phase == LOG_RESTARTED)
485 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
486  if (num_expected_tran_indices <= LOG_ESTIMATE_NACTIVE_TRANS)
487 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
488  {
489  /* Out of memory */
490  logpb_fatal_error (thread_p, true, ARG_FILE_LINE, "log_def_trantable");
491  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
492  }
493  else
494  {
495  error_code = logtb_define_trantable_log_latch (thread_p, LOG_ESTIMATE_NACTIVE_TRANS);
496  return error_code;
497  }
498  }
499 
500  logtb_set_number_of_assigned_tran_indices (1); /* sys tran */
501 
502  /*
503  * Assign the first entry for the system transaction. System transaction
504  * has an infinite timeout
505  */
506  error_code = logtb_initialize_system_tdes (thread_p);
507  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
508  {
509  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_UNKNOWN_TRANINDEX, 1, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
510  logpb_fatal_error (thread_p, true, ARG_FILE_LINE, "log_def_trantable");
511  return error_code;
512  }
513 
514  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
515 
516  error_code = logtb_initialize_mvcctable ();
517  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
518  {
519  goto error;
520  }
521 
522  /* Initialize the lock manager and the page buffer pool */
523  error_code = lock_initialize ();
524  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
525  {
526  goto error;
527  }
528  error_code = pgbuf_initialize ();
529  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
530  {
531  goto error;
532  }
533  error_code = file_manager_init ();
534  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
535  {
536  goto error;
537  }
538  return error_code;
539 
540 error:
541  logtb_undefine_trantable (thread_p);
542  logpb_fatal_error (thread_p, true, ARG_FILE_LINE, "log_def_trantable");
543 
544  return error_code;
545 }
546 
547 /*
548  * logtb_initialize_trantable -
549  *
550  * return: nothing
551  *
552  * trantable_p(in/out):
553  *
554  * Note: .
555  */
556 static void
557 logtb_initialize_trantable (TRANTABLE * trantable_p)
558 {
559  trantable_p->num_total_indices = 0;
560  trantable_p->num_assigned_indices = 1;
561  trantable_p->num_coord_loose_end_indices = 0;
562  trantable_p->num_prepared_loose_end_indices = 0;
563  trantable_p->hint_free_index = 0;
564  trantable_p->num_interrupts = 0;
565  trantable_p->area = NULL;
566  trantable_p->all_tdes = NULL;
567 }
568 
569 /*
570  * logtb_initialize_system_tdes -
571  *
572  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER status otherwise
573  *
574  * Note: .
575  */
576 static int
577 logtb_initialize_system_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
578 {
579  LOG_TDES *tdes;
580 
581  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
582  if (tdes == NULL)
583  {
584  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_UNKNOWN_TRANINDEX, 1, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
585  logpb_fatal_error (thread_p, true, ARG_FILE_LINE, "log_initialize_system_tdes");
586  return ER_LOG_UNKNOWN_TRANINDEX;
587  }
588 
589  logtb_clear_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
590  tdes->tran_index = LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX;
591  tdes->trid = LOG_SYSTEM_TRANID;
592  MVCC_CLEAR_MVCC_INFO (&tdes->mvccinfo);
593  tdes->isloose_end = true;
594  tdes->wait_msecs = TRAN_LOCK_INFINITE_WAIT;
595  tdes->isolation = TRAN_DEFAULT_ISOLATION_LEVEL ();
596  tdes->client_id = -1;
597  logtb_set_client_ids_all (&tdes->client, -1, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, -1);
598  tdes->query_timeout = 0;
599  tdes->tran_abort_reason = TRAN_NORMAL;
600  tdes->block_global_oldest_active_until_commit = false;
601 
602  return NO_ERROR;
603 }
604 
605 /*
606  * logtb_initialize_vacuum_thread_tdes () - Allocate a transaction descriptor for vacuum threads to use when starting
607  * system operations.
608  *
609  * return : Void.
610  * tdes (in) : Transaction descriptor.
611  * trid (in) : Transaction identifier.
612  */
613 void
614 logtb_initialize_vacuum_thread_tdes (LOG_TDES * tdes, TRANID trid)
615 {
616  /* Check trid is a valid vacuum worker TRANID. */
617  assert (LOG_IS_VACUUM_THREAD_TRANID (trid));
618 
619  /* Initialize transaction descriptor. */
620  logtb_initialize_tdes (tdes, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
621 
622  /* Set TRANID. */
623  tdes->trid = trid;
624 
625  /* Set transaction state to active. */
626  tdes->state = TRAN_ACTIVE;
627 }
628 
629 /*
630  * logtb_undefine_trantable - undefine the transaction table
631  *
632  * return: nothing
633  *
634  * Note: Undefine and free the transaction table space.
635  */
636 void
637 logtb_undefine_trantable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
638 {
639  LOG_ADDR_TDESAREA *area;
640  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
641  int i;
642 
643  logtb_finalize_mvcctable (thread_p);
644  lock_finalize ();
645  pgbuf_finalize ();
646  file_manager_final ();
647 
648  if (log_Gl.trantable.area != NULL)
649  {
650  /*
651  * If any one of the transaction indices has coordinator info,
652  * free this area
653  */
654  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
655  {
656  /*
657  * If there is any memory allocated in the transaction descriptor,
658  * release it
659  */
660  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
661  if (tdes != NULL)
662  {
663 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
664  assert (tdes->tran_index == i);
665 #endif
666 
667  logtb_finalize_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
668  }
669  }
670 
671 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
672  wfg_free_nodes (thread_p);
673 #endif
674 
675  if (log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes != NULL)
676  {
677  free_and_init (log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes);
678  }
679 
680  area = log_Gl.trantable.area;
681  while (area != NULL)
682  {
683  log_Gl.trantable.area = area->next;
684  free_and_init (area);
685  area = log_Gl.trantable.area;
686  }
687  }
688 
689  logtb_initialize_trantable (&log_Gl.trantable);
690 }
691 
692 /*
693  * logtb_get_number_assigned_tran_indices - find number of transaction indices
694  *
695  * return: number of transaction indices
696  *
697  */
698 int
699 logtb_get_number_assigned_tran_indices (void)
700 {
701  /* Do not use TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER()/TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT(), Estimated value is sufficient for the caller */
702  return NUM_ASSIGNED_TRAN_INDICES;
703 }
704 
705 /*
706  * logtb_set_number_of_assigned_tran_indices - set the number of tran indices
707  *
708  * return: nothing
709  * num_trans(in): the number of assigned tran indices
710  *
711  * Note: Callers have to call this function in the 'TR_TABLE' critical section.
712  */
713 static void
714 logtb_set_number_of_assigned_tran_indices (int num_trans)
715 {
716  log_Gl.trantable.num_assigned_indices = num_trans;
717 }
718 
719 /*
720  * logtb_increment_number_of_assigned_tran_indices -
721  * increment the number of tran indices
722  *
723  * return: nothing
724  *
725  * Note: Callers have to call this function in the 'TR_TABLE' critical section.
726  */
727 static void
728 logtb_increment_number_of_assigned_tran_indices (void)
729 {
730  log_Gl.trantable.num_assigned_indices++;
731 }
732 
733 /*
734  * logtb_decrement_number_of_assigned_tran_indices -
735  * decrement the number of tran indices
736  *
737  * return: nothing
738  *
739  * Note: Callers have to call this function in the 'TR_TABLE' critical section.
740  */
741 static void
742 logtb_decrement_number_of_assigned_tran_indices (void)
743 {
744  log_Gl.trantable.num_assigned_indices--;
745 }
746 
747 /*
748  * logtb_get_number_of_total_tran_indices - find number of total transaction
749  * indices
750  *
751  * return: nothing
752  *
753  * Note: Find number of total transaction indices in the transaction
754  * table. Note that some of this indices may have not been
755  * assigned. See logtb_get_number_assigned_tran_indices.
756  */
757 int
758 logtb_get_number_of_total_tran_indices (void)
759 {
760  return log_Gl.trantable.num_total_indices;
761 }
762 
763 /*
764  * logtb_set_number_of_total_tran_indices - set the number of total tran indices
765  *
766  * return: nothing
767  * num_trans(in): the number of total tran indices
768  *
769  * Note: Callers have to call this function in the 'TR_TABLE' critical section.
770  */
771 static void
772 logtb_set_number_of_total_tran_indices (int num_total_trans)
773 {
774  log_Gl.trantable.num_total_indices = num_total_trans;
775 }
776 
777 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
778 /*
779  * logtb_am_i_sole_tran - Check if no other transactions are running
780  *
781  * return: If true, return as did TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER()
782  * but not TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT()
783  *
784  * Note: Check if no other transactions are running, that is, i am a
785  * sole transaction. If you get true by this function, you
786  * should call logtb_i_am_not_sole_tran() to exit the critical
787  * section (TR_TABLE_CS_EIXT())
788  */
789 bool
790 logtb_am_i_sole_tran (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
791 {
792  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
793 
794  if (NUM_ASSIGNED_TRAN_INDICES <= 2)
795  {
796  return true;
797  }
798 
799  return false;
800 }
801 
802 /*
803  * logtb_i_am_not_sole_tran -
804  *
805  * return:
806  *
807  * NOTE:
808  */
809 void
810 logtb_i_am_not_sole_tran (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
811 {
812  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
813 }
814 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
815 
816 bool
817 logtb_am_i_dba_client (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
818 {
819  const char *db_user;
820 
821  db_user = logtb_find_current_client_name (thread_p);
822  return (db_user != NULL && !strcasecmp (db_user, "DBA"));
823 }
824 
825 /*
826  * logtb_assign_tran_index - assign a transaction index for a sequence of
827  * transactions (thread of execution.. a client)
828  *
829  * return: transaction index
830  *
831  * trid(in): Transaction identifier or NULL_TRANID
832  * state(in): Transaction state (Usually active)
833  * client_prog_name(in): Name of the client program or NULL
834  * client_user_name(in): Name of the client user or NULL
835  * client_host_name(in): Name of the client host or NULL
836  * client_process_id(in): Identifier of the process of the host where the
837  * client transaction runs.
838  * current_state(in/out): Set as a side effect to state of transaction, when
839  * a valid pointer is given.
840  * wait_msecs(in): Wait for at least this number of milliseconds to acquire a
841  * lock. Negative value is infinite
842  * isolation(in): Isolation level. One of the following:
843  * TRAN_SERIALIZABLE
844  * TRAN_REPEATABLE_READ
845  * TRAN_READ_COMMITTED
846  *
847  * Note:Assign a transaction index for a sequence of transactions
848  * (i.e., a client) and initialize the state structure for the
849  * first transaction in the sequence. If trid is equal to
850  * NULL_TRANID, a transaction is assigned to the assigned
851  * structure and the transaction is declared active; otherwise,
852  * the given transaction with the given state is assigned to the
853  * index.
854  *
855  * This function must be called when a client is restarted.
856  */
857 int
858 logtb_assign_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid, TRAN_STATE state,
859  const BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL * client_credential, TRAN_STATE * current_state, int wait_msecs,
860  TRAN_ISOLATION isolation)
861 {
862  int tran_index; /* The allocated transaction index */
863 
864 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
865  if (thread_p == NULL)
866  {
867  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
868  }
869 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
870 
871  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
872 
873  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
874  tran_index =
875  logtb_allocate_tran_index (thread_p, trid, state, client_credential, current_state, wait_msecs, isolation);
876  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
877 
878  if (tran_index != NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
879  {
880  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, tran_index);
881  }
882  else
883  {
884  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
885  }
886 
887  return tran_index;
888 }
889 
890 /*
891  * logtb_set_tdes -
892  *
893  * return:
894  *
895  * tdes(in/out): Transaction descriptor
896  * client_prog_name(in): the name of the client program
897  * client_host_name(in): the name of the client host
898  * client_user_name(in): the name of the client user
899  * client_process_id(in): the process id of the client
900  * wait_msecs(in): Wait for at least this number of milliseconds to acquire a lock.
901  * isolation(in): Isolation level
902  */
903 static void
904 logtb_set_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes, const BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL * client_credential,
905  int wait_msecs, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation)
906 {
907 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
908  CSS_CONN_ENTRY *conn;
909 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
910 
911  if (client_credential == NULL)
912  {
913  client_credential = &log_Client_credential;
914  }
915  logtb_set_client_ids_all (&tdes->client, client_credential->client_type, client_credential->client_info,
916  client_credential->db_user, client_credential->program_name, client_credential->login_name,
917  client_credential->host_name, client_credential->process_id);
918 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
919  if (thread_p == NULL)
920  {
921  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
922  }
923 
924  conn = thread_p->conn_entry;
925  if (conn != NULL)
926  {
927  tdes->client_id = conn->client_id;
928  }
929  else
930  {
931  tdes->client_id = -1;
932  }
933 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
934  tdes->client_id = -1;
935 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
936  tdes->wait_msecs = wait_msecs;
937  tdes->isolation = isolation;
938  tdes->isloose_end = false;
939  tdes->interrupt = false;
940  tdes->topops.stack = NULL;
941  tdes->topops.max = 0;
942  tdes->topops.last = -1;
943  tdes->modified_class_list = NULL;
944  tdes->num_transient_classnames = 0;
945  tdes->first_save_entry = NULL;
946  RB_INIT (&tdes->lob_locator_root);
947 }
948 
949 /*
950  * logtb_allocate_tran_index - allocate a transaction index for a sequence of
951  * transactions (thread of execution.. a client)
952  *
953  * return: tran_index or NULL_TRAN_INDEX
954  *
955  * trid(in): Transaction identifier or NULL_TRANID
956  * state(in): Transaction state (Usually active)
957  * client_prog_name(in): Name of the client program or NULL
958  * client_user_name(in): Name of the client user or NULL
959  * client_host_name(in): Name of the client host or NULL
960  * client_process_id(in): Identifier of the process of the host where the
961  * client transaction runs.
962  * current_state(in/out): Set as a side effect to state of transaction, when
963  * a valid pointer is given.
964  * wait_msecs(in): Wait for at least this number of milliseconds to acquire a
965  * lock. That is, wait this much before the transaction
966  * is timed out. Negative value is infinite.
967  * isolation(in): Isolation level. One of the following:
968  * TRAN_SERIALIZABLE
969  * TRAN_REPEATABLE_READ
970  * TRAN_READ_COMMITTED
971  *
972  * Note:Allocate a transaction index for a sequence of transactions
973  * (i.e., a client) and initialize the state structure for the
974  * first transaction in the sequence. If trid is equal to
975  * NULL_TRANID, a transaction is assigned to the assigned
976  * structure and the transaction is declared active; otherwise,
977  * the given transaction with the given state is assigned to the
978  * index. If the given client user has a dangling entry due to
979  * client loose ends, this index is attached to it.
980  *
981  * This function is only called by the log manager when the log
982  * latch has already been acquired. (See logtb_assign_tran_index)
983  */
984 static int
985 logtb_allocate_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid, TRAN_STATE state,
986  const BOOT_CLIENT_CREDENTIAL * client_credential, TRAN_STATE * current_state, int wait_msecs,
987  TRAN_ISOLATION isolation)
988 {
989  int i;
990  int visited_loop_start_pos;
991  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
992  int tran_index; /* The assigned index */
993  int save_tran_index; /* Save as a good index to assign */
994 
995 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
996  if (thread_p == NULL)
997  {
998  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
999  }
1000 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1001 
1002  save_tran_index = tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1003 
1004  /* Is there any free index ? */
1005  if (NUM_ASSIGNED_TRAN_INDICES >= NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES)
1006  {
1007 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1008  /* When normal processing, we never expand trantable */
1009  if (log_Gl.rcv_phase == LOG_RESTARTED && NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES > 0)
1010  {
1011  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TM_TOO_MANY_CLIENTS, 1, NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES - 1);
1012  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1013  }
1014 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1015 
1016  i = (int) (((float) NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * LOG_EXPAND_TRANTABLE_RATIO) + 0.5);
1017  if (logtb_expand_trantable (thread_p, i) != NO_ERROR)
1018  {
1019  /* Out of memory or something like that */
1020  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1021  }
1022  }
1023 
1024  /*
1025  * Note that we could have found the entry already and it may be stored in
1026  * tran_index.
1027  */
1028  for (i = log_Gl.trantable.hint_free_index, visited_loop_start_pos = 0;
1029  tran_index == NULL_TRAN_INDEX && visited_loop_start_pos < 2; i = (i + 1) % NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES)
1030  {
1031  if (log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i]->trid == NULL_TRANID)
1032  {
1033  tran_index = i;
1034  }
1035  if (i == log_Gl.trantable.hint_free_index)
1036  {
1037  visited_loop_start_pos++;
1038  }
1039  }
1040 
1041  if (tran_index != NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
1042  {
1043  log_Gl.trantable.hint_free_index = (tran_index + 1) % NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES;
1044 
1045  logtb_increment_number_of_assigned_tran_indices ();
1046 
1047  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
1048  if (tdes == NULL)
1049  {
1050  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_UNKNOWN_TRANINDEX, 1, tran_index);
1051  return NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1052  }
1053 
1054  tdes->tran_index = tran_index;
1055  logtb_clear_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
1056  logtb_set_tdes (thread_p, tdes, client_credential, wait_msecs, isolation);
1057 
1058  if (trid == NULL_TRANID)
1059  {
1060  /* Assign a new transaction identifier for the new index */
1061  logtb_get_new_tran_id (thread_p, tdes);
1062  state = TRAN_ACTIVE;
1063  }
1064  else
1065  {
1066  tdes->trid = trid;
1067  tdes->state = state;
1068  }
1069 
1070  if (current_state)
1071  {
1072  *current_state = state;
1073  }
1074 
1075  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, tran_index);
1076 
1077  tdes->tran_abort_reason = TRAN_NORMAL;
1078  }
1079 
1080  return tran_index;
1081 }
1082 
1083 /*
1084  * logtb_initialize_mvcctable - initialize MVCC table
1085  *
1086  * return: error code
1087  */
1088 static int
1089 logtb_initialize_mvcctable (void)
1090 {
1091  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
1092  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
1093  int size, i, size2;
1094  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status, *trans_status_history;
1095 
1096  current_trans_status = &mvcc_table->current_trans_status;
1097  current_trans_status->bit_area = NULL;
1098  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids = NULL;
1099 
1100  mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = NULL;
1101  mvcc_table->trans_status_history = NULL;
1102 
1103  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_ELEMENTS);
1104  current_trans_status->bit_area = (UINT64 *) malloc (size);
1105  if (current_trans_status->bit_area == NULL)
1106  {
1107  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1108  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
1109  goto exit_on_error;
1110  }
1111  memset ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area, MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE, size);
1112  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid = MVCCID_FIRST;
1113  current_trans_status->bit_area_length = 0;
1114  size = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (MVCCID);
1115  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids = (MVCCID *) malloc (size);
1116  if (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids == NULL)
1117  {
1118  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1119  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
1120  goto exit_on_error;
1121  }
1122  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length = 0;
1123  current_trans_status->version = 0;
1124  current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid = MVCCID_FIRST;
1125 
1126  mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = (MVCCID *) malloc (size);
1127  if (mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids == NULL)
1128  {
1129  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1130  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
1131  goto exit_on_error;
1132  }
1133  memset ((void *) mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids, MVCCID_NULL,
1134  NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (MVCCID));
1135 
1136  size = TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE * sizeof (MVCC_TRANS_STATUS);
1137  /* MVCC mvcc_table_queue */
1138  mvcc_table->trans_status_history = (MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *) malloc (size);
1139  if (mvcc_table->trans_status_history == NULL)
1140  {
1141  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1142  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
1143  goto exit_on_error;
1144  }
1145 
1146  for (i = 0; i < TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE; i++)
1147  {
1148  trans_status_history = mvcc_table->trans_status_history + i;
1149  trans_status_history->bit_area = NULL;
1150  trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids = NULL;
1151  }
1152 
1153  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_ELEMENTS);
1154  size2 = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (MVCCID);
1155  for (i = 0; i < TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE; i++)
1156  {
1157  trans_status_history = mvcc_table->trans_status_history + i;
1158  trans_status_history->bit_area = (UINT64 *) malloc (size);
1159  if (trans_status_history->bit_area == NULL)
1160  {
1161  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1162  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
1163  goto exit_on_error;
1164  }
1165 
1166  memset ((void *) trans_status_history->bit_area, MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE, size);
1167  trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid = MVCCID_FIRST;
1168  trans_status_history->bit_area_length = 0;
1169 
1170  trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids = (MVCCID *) malloc (size2);
1171  if (trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids == NULL)
1172  {
1173  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1174  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size2);
1175  goto exit_on_error;
1176  }
1177  trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length = 0;
1178  trans_status_history->version = 0;
1179  trans_status_history->lowest_active_mvccid = MVCCID_FIRST;
1180  }
1181  mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position = 0;
1182 
1183 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
1184  pthread_mutex_init (&mvcc_table->new_mvccid_lock, NULL);
1185 #endif
1186  pthread_mutex_init (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex, NULL);
1187 
1188  return NO_ERROR;
1189 
1190 exit_on_error:
1191 
1192  current_trans_status = &mvcc_table->current_trans_status;
1193  if (current_trans_status->bit_area != NULL)
1194  {
1195  free ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area);
1196  current_trans_status->bit_area = NULL;
1197  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid = MVCCID_NULL;
1198  current_trans_status->bit_area_length = 0;
1199  }
1200 
1201  if (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids != NULL)
1202  {
1203  free ((void *) current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids);
1204  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids = NULL;
1205  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length = 0;
1206  }
1207 
1208  if (mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids != NULL)
1209  {
1210  free ((void *) mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids);
1211  mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = NULL;
1212  }
1213 
1214  current_trans_status = &log_Gl.mvcc_table.current_trans_status;
1215  if (log_Gl.mvcc_table.trans_status_history != NULL)
1216  {
1217  for (i = 0; i < TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE; i++)
1218  {
1219  trans_status_history = mvcc_table->trans_status_history + i;
1220  if (trans_status_history->bit_area != NULL)
1221  {
1222  free ((void *) trans_status_history->bit_area);
1223  trans_status_history->bit_area = NULL;
1224  }
1225  if (trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids != NULL)
1226  {
1227  free ((void *) trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids);
1228  trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids = NULL;
1229  }
1230  }
1231 
1232  free ((void *) mvcc_table->trans_status_history);
1233  mvcc_table->trans_status_history = NULL;
1234  }
1235 
1236  return error_code;
1237 }
1238 
1239 /*
1240  * logtb_finalize_mvcctable - cleanup MVCC table
1241  *
1242  * return: error code
1243  *
1244  * thread_p(in): thread entry
1245  */
1246 static void
1247 logtb_finalize_mvcctable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
1248 {
1249  int i;
1250  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
1251  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status, *trans_status_history;
1252 
1253  current_trans_status = &log_Gl.mvcc_table.current_trans_status;
1254  if (current_trans_status->bit_area != NULL)
1255  {
1256  free ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area);
1257  current_trans_status->bit_area = NULL;
1258  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid = MVCCID_NULL;
1259  current_trans_status->bit_area_length = 0;
1260  }
1261 
1262  if (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids != NULL)
1263  {
1264  free ((void *) current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids);
1265  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids = NULL;
1266  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length = 0;
1267  }
1268 
1269  if (mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids)
1270  {
1271  free ((void *) mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids);
1272  mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = NULL;
1273  }
1274 
1275  if (mvcc_table->trans_status_history != NULL)
1276  {
1277  for (i = 0; i < TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE; i++)
1278  {
1279  trans_status_history = mvcc_table->trans_status_history + i;
1280  if (trans_status_history->bit_area != NULL)
1281  {
1282  free ((void *) trans_status_history->bit_area);
1283  trans_status_history->bit_area = NULL;
1284  }
1285  if (trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids != NULL)
1286  {
1287  free ((void *) trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids);
1288  trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids = NULL;
1289  }
1290  }
1291 
1292  free ((void *) mvcc_table->trans_status_history);
1293  mvcc_table->trans_status_history = NULL;
1294  }
1295 
1296 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
1297  pthread_mutex_destroy (&mvcc_table->new_mvccid_lock);
1298 #endif
1299  pthread_mutex_destroy (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
1300 }
1301 
1302 int
1303 logtb_is_tran_modification_disabled (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
1304 {
1305  LOG_TDES *tdes;
1306  int tran_index;
1307 
1308  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
1309  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
1310 
1311  if (tdes == NULL)
1312  {
1313  return db_Disable_modifications;
1314  }
1315 
1316  return tdes->disable_modifications;
1317 }
1318 
1319 /*
1320  * logtb_rv_find_allocate_tran_index - find/alloc a transaction during the recovery
1321  * analysis process
1322  *
1323  * return: The transaction descriptor
1324  *
1325  * trid(in): The desired transaction identifier
1326  * log_lsa(in): Log address where the transaction was seen in the log
1327  *
1328  * Note: Find or allocate the transaction descriptor for the given
1329  * transaction identifier. If the descriptor was allocated, it is
1330  * assumed that this is the first time the transaction is seen.
1331  * Thus, the head of the transaction in the log is located at the
1332  * givel location (i.e., log_lsa.pageid, log_offset).
1333  * This function should be called only by the recovery process
1334  * (the analysis phase).
1335  */
1336 LOG_TDES *
1337 logtb_rv_find_allocate_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid, const LOG_LSA * log_lsa)
1338 {
1339  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
1340  int tran_index;
1341  VACUUM_WORKER *worker;
1342 
1343  if (LOG_IS_VACUUM_THREAD_TRANID (trid))
1344  {
1345  /* This must be the log of a vacuum worker system operation. Use vacuum worker transaction descriptor. */
1346  worker = vacuum_rv_get_worker_by_trid (thread_p, trid);
1347  /* Set worker state to recovery. */
1348  worker->state = VACUUM_WORKER_STATE_RECOVERY;
1349 
1350  vacuum_er_log (VACUUM_ER_LOG_RECOVERY | VACUUM_ER_LOG_TOPOPS,
1351  "Log entry (%lld, %d) belongs to vacuum worker "
1352  "tdes. tdes->trid=%d, tdes->tail_lsa=(%lld, %d). ", (long long int) log_lsa->pageid,
1353  (int) log_lsa->offset, worker->tdes->trid, (long long int) worker->tdes->tail_lsa.pageid,
1354  (int) worker->tdes->tail_lsa.offset);
1355 
1356  return worker->tdes;
1357  }
1358 
1359  /*
1360  * If this is the first time, the transaction is seen. Assign a new
1361  * index to describe it and assume that the transaction was active
1362  * at the time of the crash, and thus it will be unilaterally aborted
1363  */
1364  tran_index = logtb_find_tran_index (thread_p, trid);
1365  if (tran_index == NULL_TRAN_INDEX)
1366  {
1367  /* Define the index */
1368  tran_index =
1369  logtb_allocate_tran_index (thread_p, trid, TRAN_UNACTIVE_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED, NULL, NULL,
1370  TRAN_LOCK_INFINITE_WAIT, TRAN_SERIALIZABLE);
1371  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
1372  if (tran_index == NULL_TRAN_INDEX || tdes == NULL)
1373  {
1374  /*
1375  * Unable to assign a transaction index. The recovery process
1376  * cannot continue
1377  */
1378  logpb_fatal_error (thread_p, true, ARG_FILE_LINE, "log_recovery_find_or_alloc");
1379  return NULL;
1380  }
1381  else
1382  {
1383  LSA_COPY (&tdes->head_lsa, log_lsa);
1384  }
1385  }
1386  else
1387  {
1388  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
1389  }
1390 
1391  return tdes;
1392 }
1393 
1394 /*
1395  * logtb_rv_assign_mvccid_for_undo_recovery () - Assign an MVCCID for
1396  * transactions that need to
1397  * undo at recovery.
1398  *
1399  * return : Void.
1400  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
1401  * mvccid (in) : Assigned MVCCID.
1402  */
1403 void
1404 logtb_rv_assign_mvccid_for_undo_recovery (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCCID mvccid)
1405 {
1406  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_CURRENT_TDES (thread_p);
1407 
1408  assert (tdes != NULL);
1409  assert (MVCCID_IS_VALID (mvccid));
1410 
1411  tdes->mvccinfo.id = mvccid;
1412 }
1413 
1414 /*
1415  * logtb_release_tran_index - return an assigned transaction index
1416  *
1417  * return: nothing
1418  *
1419  * tran_index(in): Transaction index
1420  *
1421  * Note: Return a transaction index which was used for a sequence of
1422  * transactions (i.e., a client).
1423  *
1424  * This function must be called when a client is shutdown (i.e.,
1425  * unregistered).
1426  */
1427 void
1428 logtb_release_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index)
1429 {
1430  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
1431 
1432  qmgr_clear_trans_wakeup (thread_p, tran_index, true, false);
1433  heap_chnguess_clear (thread_p, tran_index);
1434 
1435  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
1436  if (tran_index != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX && tdes != NULL)
1437  {
1438  MVCC_CLEAR_MVCC_INFO (&tdes->mvccinfo);
1439  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
1440 
1441  /*
1442  * Free the top system operation stack since the transaction entry may
1443  * not be freed (i.e., left as loose end distributed transaction)
1444  */
1445  if (tdes->topops.max != 0)
1446  {
1447  free_and_init (tdes->topops.stack);
1448  tdes->topops.max = 0;
1449  tdes->topops.last = -1;
1450  }
1451 
1452  if (LOG_ISTRAN_2PC_PREPARE (tdes))
1453  {
1454  tdes->isloose_end = true;
1455  log_Gl.trantable.num_prepared_loose_end_indices++;
1456  }
1457  else
1458  {
1459  if (LOG_ISTRAN_2PC_INFORMING_PARTICIPANTS (tdes))
1460  {
1461  tdes->isloose_end = true;
1462  log_Gl.trantable.num_coord_loose_end_indices++;
1463  }
1464  else
1465  {
1466  logtb_free_tran_index (thread_p, tran_index);
1467  logtb_set_client_ids_all (&tdes->client, BOOT_CLIENT_UNKNOWN, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, -1);
1468  }
1469  }
1470 
1471  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
1472  }
1473 }
1474 
1475 /*
1476  * logtb_free_tran_index - free a transaction index
1477  *
1478  * return: nothing
1479  *
1480  * tran_index(in): Transaction index
1481  *
1482  * Note: Free a transaction index which was used for a sequence of
1483  * transactions (i.e., a client).
1484  *
1485  * This function is only called by the log manager when the log
1486  * latch has already been acquired. (See logtb_release_tran_index
1487  * for other cases).
1488  */
1489 void
1490 logtb_free_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index)
1491 {
1492  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
1493  int log_tran_index;
1494 
1495 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
1496  if (thread_p == NULL)
1497  {
1498  thread_p = thread_get_thread_entry_info ();
1499  }
1500 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
1501 
1502  log_tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
1503 
1504  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
1505  if (tran_index > NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES || tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID)
1506  {
1507 #if defined(CUBRID_DEBUG)
1508  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "log_free_tran_index: Unknown index = %d. Operation is ignored", tran_index);
1509 #endif /* CUBRID_DEBUG */
1510  return;
1511  }
1512 
1513  logtb_clear_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
1514  if (tdes->repl_records)
1515  {
1516  free_and_init (tdes->repl_records);
1517  }
1518  tdes->num_repl_records = 0;
1519  if (tdes->topops.max != 0)
1520  {
1521  free_and_init (tdes->topops.stack);
1522  tdes->topops.max = 0;
1523  tdes->topops.last = -1;
1524  }
1525 
1526  if (tran_index != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
1527  {
1528  tdes->trid = NULL_TRANID;
1529  tdes->client_id = -1;
1530 
1531  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
1532  logtb_decrement_number_of_assigned_tran_indices ();
1533  if (log_Gl.trantable.hint_free_index > tran_index)
1534  {
1535  log_Gl.trantable.hint_free_index = tran_index;
1536  }
1537  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
1538 
1539  if (log_tran_index == tran_index)
1540  {
1541  if (!LOG_ISRESTARTED ())
1542  {
1543  log_tran_index = LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX;
1544  }
1545  else
1546  {
1547  log_tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
1548  }
1549 
1550  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, log_tran_index);
1551  }
1552  }
1553 }
1554 
1555 /*
1556  * logtb_free_tran_index_with_undo_lsa - free tranindex with lsa
1557  *
1558  * return: nothing
1559  *
1560  * undo_lsa(in): Undo log sequence address
1561  *
1562  * Note: Remove the transaction index associated with the undo LSA.
1563  * This function execute a sequential search on the transaction
1564  * table to find out the transaction with such lsa. This
1565  * sequential scan is OK since this function is only called when
1566  * a system error happens, which in principle never happen.
1567  */
1568 void
1569 logtb_free_tran_index_with_undo_lsa (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const LOG_LSA * undo_lsa)
1570 {
1571  int i;
1572  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
1573 
1574  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
1575 
1576  if (undo_lsa != NULL && !LSA_ISNULL (undo_lsa))
1577  {
1578  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
1579  {
1580  if (i != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
1581  {
1582  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
1583  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && tdes->state == TRAN_UNACTIVE_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED
1584  && LSA_EQ (undo_lsa, &tdes->undo_nxlsa))
1585  {
1586  logtb_free_tran_index (thread_p, i);
1587  }
1588  }
1589  }
1590  }
1591 
1592  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
1593 }
1594 
1595 /*
1596  * logtb_dump_tdes -
1597  *
1598  * return: nothing
1599  *
1600  * tdes(in):
1601  *
1602  * Note:
1603  */
1604 static void
1605 logtb_dump_tdes (FILE * out_fp, LOG_TDES * tdes)
1606 {
1607  fprintf (out_fp,
1608  "Tran_index = %2d, Trid = %d,\n State = %s,\n Isolation = %s,\n"
1609  " Wait_msecs = %d, isloose_end = %d,\n Head_lsa = %lld|%d, Tail_lsa = %lld|%d,"
1610  " Postpone_lsa = %lld|%d,\n SaveLSA = %lld|%d, UndoNextLSA = %lld|%d,\n"
1611  " Client_User: (Type = %d, User = %s, Program = %s, Login = %s, Host = %s, Pid = %d)\n",
1612  tdes->tran_index, tdes->trid, log_state_string (tdes->state), log_isolation_string (tdes->isolation),
1613  tdes->wait_msecs, tdes->isloose_end, (long long int) tdes->head_lsa.pageid, (int) tdes->head_lsa.offset,
1614  (long long int) tdes->tail_lsa.pageid, (int) tdes->tail_lsa.offset, (long long int) tdes->posp_nxlsa.pageid,
1615  (int) tdes->posp_nxlsa.offset, (long long int) tdes->savept_lsa.pageid, (int) tdes->savept_lsa.offset,
1616  (long long int) tdes->undo_nxlsa.pageid, (int) tdes->undo_nxlsa.offset, tdes->client.client_type,
1617  tdes->client.db_user, tdes->client.program_name, tdes->client.login_name, tdes->client.host_name,
1618  tdes->client.process_id);
1619 
1620  if (tdes->topops.max != 0 && tdes->topops.last >= 0)
1621  {
1622  logtb_dump_top_operations (out_fp, &tdes->topops);
1623  }
1624 
1625  if (tdes->gtrid != LOG_2PC_NULL_GTRID || tdes->coord != NULL)
1626  {
1627  logtb_dump_tdes_distribute_transaction (out_fp, tdes->gtrid, tdes->coord);
1628  }
1629 }
1630 
1631 /*
1632  * logtb_dump_top_operations -
1633  *
1634  * return: nothing
1635  *
1636  * tdes(in):
1637  *
1638  * Note:
1639  */
1640 static void
1641 logtb_dump_top_operations (FILE * out_fp, LOG_TOPOPS_STACK * topops_p)
1642 {
1643  int i;
1644 
1645  fprintf (out_fp, " Active top system operations for tran:\n");
1646  for (i = topops_p->last; i >= 0; i--)
1647  {
1648  fprintf (out_fp, " Head = %lld|%d, Posp_Head = %lld|%d\n",
1649  LSA_AS_ARGS (&topops_p->stack[i].lastparent_lsa), LSA_AS_ARGS (&topops_p->stack[i].posp_lsa));
1650  }
1651 }
1652 
1653 /*
1654  * logtb_dump_tdes_distribute_transaction -
1655  *
1656  * return: nothing
1657  *
1658  * tdes(in):
1659  *
1660  * Note:
1661  */
1662 static void
1663 logtb_dump_tdes_distribute_transaction (FILE * out_fp, int global_tran_id, LOG_2PC_COORDINATOR * coord)
1664 {
1665  int i;
1666  char *particp_id; /* Participant identifier */
1667 
1668  /* This is a distributed transaction */
1669  if (coord != NULL)
1670  {
1671  fprintf (out_fp, " COORDINATOR SITE(or NESTED PARTICIPANT SITE)");
1672  }
1673  else
1674  {
1675  fprintf (out_fp, " PARTICIPANT SITE");
1676  }
1677 
1678  fprintf (out_fp, " of global tranid = %d\n", global_tran_id);
1679 
1680  if (coord != NULL)
1681  {
1682  fprintf (out_fp, " Num_participants = %d, Partids = ", coord->num_particps);
1683  for (i = 0; i < coord->num_particps; i++)
1684  {
1685  particp_id = ((char *) coord->block_particps_ids + i * coord->particp_id_length);
1686  if (i == 0)
1687  {
1688  fprintf (out_fp, " %s", log_2pc_sprintf_particp (particp_id));
1689  }
1690  else
1691  {
1692  fprintf (out_fp, ", %s", log_2pc_sprintf_particp (particp_id));
1693  }
1694  }
1695  fprintf (out_fp, "\n");
1696 
1697  if (coord->ack_received)
1698  {
1699  fprintf (out_fp, " Acknowledgement vector =");
1700  for (i = 0; i < coord->num_particps; i++)
1701  {
1702  if (i == 0)
1703  {
1704  fprintf (out_fp, " %d", coord->ack_received[i]);
1705  }
1706  else
1707  {
1708  fprintf (out_fp, ", %d", coord->ack_received[i]);
1709  }
1710  }
1711  }
1712  fprintf (out_fp, "\n");
1713  }
1714 }
1715 
1716 /*
1717  * xlogtb_dump_trantable - dump the transaction table
1718  *
1719  * return: nothing
1720  *
1721  * Note: Dump the transaction state table.
1722  * This function is used for debugging purposes.
1723  */
1724 void
1725 xlogtb_dump_trantable (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, FILE * out_fp)
1726 {
1727  int i;
1728  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
1729 
1730  fprintf (out_fp, "\n ** DUMPING TABLE OF ACTIVE TRANSACTIONS **\n");
1731 
1732  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
1733 
1734  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
1735  {
1736  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
1737  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID)
1738  {
1739  fprintf (out_fp, "Tran_index = %2d... Free transaction index\n", i);
1740  }
1741  else
1742  {
1743  logtb_dump_tdes (out_fp, tdes);
1744  }
1745  }
1746 
1747  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
1748 
1749  fprintf (out_fp, "\n");
1750 }
1751 
1752 /*
1753  * logtb_free_tran_mvcc_info - free transaction MVCC info
1754  *
1755  * return: nothing..
1756  *
1757  * tdes(in/out): Transaction descriptor
1758  */
1759 static void
1760 logtb_free_tran_mvcc_info (LOG_TDES * tdes)
1761 {
1762  MVCC_INFO *curr_mvcc_info = &tdes->mvccinfo;
1763 
1764  if (curr_mvcc_info->snapshot.long_tran_mvccids != NULL)
1765  {
1766  free_and_init (curr_mvcc_info->snapshot.long_tran_mvccids);
1767  curr_mvcc_info->snapshot.long_tran_mvccids_length = 0;
1768  }
1769 
1770  if (curr_mvcc_info->snapshot.bit_area != NULL)
1771  {
1772  free_and_init (curr_mvcc_info->snapshot.bit_area);
1773  curr_mvcc_info->snapshot.bit_area_length = 0;
1774  }
1775 
1776  if (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids != NULL)
1777  {
1778  free_and_init (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids);
1779  curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids = 0;
1780  }
1781 }
1782 
1783 /*
1784  * logtb_allocate_snapshot_data - allocate snapshot data if not allocated yet
1785  *
1786  * return: error code
1787  *
1788  * thread_p(in): thread entry
1789  * snapshot(in): The snapshot
1790  */
1791 int
1792 logtb_allocate_snapshot_data (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCC_SNAPSHOT * snapshot)
1793 {
1794  int size;
1795  assert (snapshot != NULL);
1796 
1797  if (snapshot->long_tran_mvccids == NULL)
1798  {
1799  /* allocate only once */
1800  size = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * OR_MVCCID_SIZE;
1801 
1802  snapshot->long_tran_mvccids = (MVCCID *) malloc (size);
1803  if (snapshot->long_tran_mvccids == NULL)
1804  {
1805  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) size);
1806  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1807  }
1808  }
1809 
1810  if (snapshot->bit_area == NULL)
1811  {
1812  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_ELEMENTS);
1813  snapshot->bit_area = (UINT64 *) malloc (size);
1814  if (snapshot->bit_area == NULL)
1815  {
1816  free_and_init (snapshot->long_tran_mvccids);
1817  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) size);
1818  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1819  }
1820  }
1821 
1822  return NO_ERROR;
1823 }
1824 
1825 
1826 /*
1827  * logtb_clear_tdes - clear the transaction descriptor
1828  *
1829  * return: nothing..
1830  *
1831  * tdes(in/out): Transaction descriptor
1832  */
1833 void
1834 logtb_clear_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes)
1835 {
1836  int i, j;
1837  DB_VALUE *dbval;
1838  HL_HEAPID save_heap_id;
1839 
1840  tdes->isloose_end = false;
1841  tdes->state = TRAN_ACTIVE;
1842  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->head_lsa);
1843  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->tail_lsa);
1844  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->undo_nxlsa);
1845  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->posp_nxlsa);
1846  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->savept_lsa);
1847  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->topop_lsa);
1848  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->tail_topresult_lsa);
1849  tdes->topops.last = -1;
1850  tdes->gtrid = LOG_2PC_NULL_GTRID;
1851  tdes->gtrinfo.info_length = 0;
1852  if (tdes->gtrinfo.info_data != NULL)
1853  {
1854  free_and_init (tdes->gtrinfo.info_data);
1855  }
1856  if (tdes->coord != NULL)
1857  {
1858  log_2pc_free_coord_info (tdes);
1859  }
1860  if (tdes->tran_unique_stats != NULL)
1861  {
1862  free_and_init (tdes->tran_unique_stats);
1863  tdes->num_unique_btrees = 0;
1864  tdes->max_unique_btrees = 0;
1865  }
1866  if (tdes->interrupt == (int) true)
1867  {
1868  tdes->interrupt = false;
1869 #if defined (HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
1870  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts, -1);
1871 #else
1872  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
1873  log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts--;
1874  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
1875 #endif
1876  }
1877  tdes->modified_class_list = NULL;
1878 
1879  for (i = 0; i < tdes->cur_repl_record; i++)
1880  {
1881  if (tdes->repl_records[i].repl_data)
1882  {
1883  free_and_init (tdes->repl_records[i].repl_data);
1884  }
1885  }
1886 
1887  save_heap_id = db_change_private_heap (thread_p, 0);
1888  for (i = 0; i < tdes->num_exec_queries && i < MAX_NUM_EXEC_QUERY_HISTORY; i++)
1889  {
1890  if (tdes->bind_history[i].vals == NULL)
1891  {
1892  continue;
1893  }
1894 
1895  dbval = tdes->bind_history[i].vals;
1896  for (j = 0; j < tdes->bind_history[i].size; j++)
1897  {
1898  db_value_clear (dbval);
1899  dbval++;
1900  }
1901 
1902  db_private_free_and_init (thread_p, tdes->bind_history[i].vals);
1903  tdes->bind_history[i].size = 0;
1904  }
1905  (void) db_change_private_heap (thread_p, save_heap_id);
1906 
1907  tdes->cur_repl_record = 0;
1908  tdes->append_repl_recidx = -1;
1909  tdes->fl_mark_repl_recidx = -1;
1910  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->repl_insert_lsa);
1911  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->repl_update_lsa);
1912  tdes->first_save_entry = NULL;
1913  tdes->query_timeout = 0;
1914  tdes->query_start_time = 0;
1915  tdes->tran_start_time = 0;
1916  XASL_ID_SET_NULL (&tdes->xasl_id);
1917  tdes->waiting_for_res = NULL;
1918  tdes->tran_abort_reason = TRAN_NORMAL;
1919  tdes->num_exec_queries = 0;
1920  tdes->suppress_replication = 0;
1921 
1922  logtb_tran_clear_update_stats (&tdes->log_upd_stats);
1923 
1924  assert (tdes->mvccinfo.id == MVCCID_NULL);
1925 
1926  if (BOOT_WRITE_ON_STANDY_CLIENT_TYPE (tdes->client.client_type))
1927  {
1928  tdes->disable_modifications = 0;
1929  }
1930  else
1931  {
1932  tdes->disable_modifications = db_Disable_modifications;
1933  }
1934  tdes->has_deadlock_priority = false;
1935 
1936  tdes->num_log_records_written = 0;
1937 
1938  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->rcv.tran_start_postpone_lsa);
1939  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->rcv.sysop_start_postpone_lsa);
1940  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->rcv.atomic_sysop_start_lsa);
1941 }
1942 
1943 /*
1944  * logtb_initialize_tdes - initialize the transaction descriptor
1945  *
1946  * return: nothing..
1947  *
1948  * tdes(in/out): Transaction descriptor
1949  * tran_index(in): Transaction index
1950  */
1951 static void
1952 logtb_initialize_tdes (LOG_TDES * tdes, int tran_index)
1953 {
1954  int i, r;
1955 
1956  tdes->tran_index = tran_index;
1957  tdes->trid = NULL_TRANID;
1958  tdes->isloose_end = false;
1959  tdes->coord = NULL;
1960  tdes->client_id = -1;
1961  tdes->client.client_type = BOOT_CLIENT_UNKNOWN;
1962  tdes->gtrid = LOG_2PC_NULL_GTRID;
1963  tdes->gtrinfo.info_length = 0;
1964  tdes->gtrinfo.info_data = NULL;
1965  tdes->interrupt = false;
1966  tdes->wait_msecs = TRAN_LOCK_INFINITE_WAIT;
1967  tdes->isolation = TRAN_SERIALIZABLE;
1968  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->head_lsa);
1969  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->tail_lsa);
1970  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->undo_nxlsa);
1971  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->posp_nxlsa);
1972  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->savept_lsa);
1973  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->topop_lsa);
1974  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->tail_topresult_lsa);
1975 
1976  r = rmutex_initialize (&tdes->rmutex_topop, RMUTEX_NAME_TDES_TOPOP);
1977  assert (r == NO_ERROR);
1978 
1979  tdes->topops.stack = NULL;
1980  tdes->topops.last = -1;
1981  tdes->topops.max = 0;
1982  tdes->num_unique_btrees = 0;
1983  tdes->max_unique_btrees = 0;
1984  tdes->tran_unique_stats = NULL;
1985  tdes->num_transient_classnames = 0;
1986  tdes->num_repl_records = 0;
1987  tdes->cur_repl_record = 0;
1988  tdes->append_repl_recidx = -1;
1989  tdes->fl_mark_repl_recidx = -1;
1990  tdes->repl_records = NULL;
1991  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->repl_insert_lsa);
1992  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->repl_update_lsa);
1993  tdes->first_save_entry = NULL;
1994  tdes->suppress_replication = 0;
1995  RB_INIT (&tdes->lob_locator_root);
1996  tdes->query_timeout = 0;
1997  tdes->query_start_time = 0;
1998  tdes->tran_start_time = 0;
1999  XASL_ID_SET_NULL (&tdes->xasl_id);
2000  tdes->waiting_for_res = NULL;
2001  tdes->disable_modifications = db_Disable_modifications;
2002  tdes->tran_abort_reason = TRAN_NORMAL;
2003  tdes->num_exec_queries = 0;
2004 
2005  for (i = 0; i < MAX_NUM_EXEC_QUERY_HISTORY; i++)
2006  {
2007  tdes->bind_history[i].size = 0;
2008  tdes->bind_history[i].vals = NULL;
2009  }
2010  tdes->has_deadlock_priority = false;
2011 
2012  tdes->num_log_records_written = 0;
2013 
2014  MVCC_INIT_MVCC_INFO (&tdes->mvccinfo);
2015 
2016  tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_count = 0;
2017  tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_first_chunk = NULL;
2018  tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk = NULL;
2019  tdes->log_upd_stats.classes_cos_hash = NULL;
2020 
2021  tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_count = 0;
2022  tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_first_chunk = NULL;
2023  tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk = NULL;
2024  tdes->log_upd_stats.unique_stats_hash = NULL;
2025 
2026  tdes->log_upd_stats.unique_stats_hash =
2027  mht_create ("Tran_unique_stats", 101, logtb_tran_btid_hash_func, logtb_tran_btid_hash_cmp_func);
2028  tdes->log_upd_stats.classes_cos_hash = mht_create ("Tran_classes_cos", 101, oid_hash, oid_compare_equals);
2029 
2030  logtb_set_client_ids_all (&tdes->client, BOOT_CLIENT_UNKNOWN, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, -1);
2031  tdes->block_global_oldest_active_until_commit = false;
2032  tdes->modified_class_list = NULL;
2033 
2034  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->rcv.tran_start_postpone_lsa);
2035  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->rcv.sysop_start_postpone_lsa);
2036  LSA_SET_NULL (&tdes->rcv.atomic_sysop_start_lsa);
2037 }
2038 
2039 /*
2040  * logtb_finalize_tdes - finalize the transaction descriptor
2041  *
2042  * return: nothing.
2043  *
2044  * thread_p(in):
2045  * tdes(in/out): Transaction descriptor
2046  */
2047 void
2048 logtb_finalize_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes)
2049 {
2050  int r;
2051 
2052  logtb_clear_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
2053  logtb_free_tran_mvcc_info (tdes);
2054  logtb_tran_free_update_stats (&tdes->log_upd_stats);
2055 
2056  r = rmutex_finalize (&tdes->rmutex_topop);
2057  assert (r == NO_ERROR);
2058 
2059  if (tdes->topops.max != 0)
2060  {
2061  free_and_init (tdes->topops.stack);
2062  tdes->topops.max = 0;
2063  tdes->topops.last = -1;
2064  }
2065 }
2066 
2067 /*
2068  * logtb_get_new_tran_id - assign a new transaction identifier
2069  *
2070  * return: tranid
2071  *
2072  * tdes(in/out): Transaction descriptor
2073  */
2074 int
2075 logtb_get_new_tran_id (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes)
2076 {
2077 #if defined (HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
2078  int trid, next_trid;
2079 
2080  logtb_clear_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
2081 
2082  do
2083  {
2084  trid = VOLATILE_ACCESS (log_Gl.hdr.next_trid, int);
2085 
2086  next_trid = trid + 1;
2087  if (next_trid < 0)
2088  {
2089  /* an overflow happened. starts with its base */
2090  next_trid = LOG_SYSTEM_TRANID + 1;
2091  }
2092 
2093  /* Need to check (trid < LOG_SYSTEM_TRANID + 1) for robustness. If log_Gl.hdr.next_trid was reset to 0 (see
2094  * log_rv_analysis_log_end), this prevents us from correctly generating trids. */
2095  }
2096  while (!ATOMIC_CAS_32 (&log_Gl.hdr.next_trid, trid, next_trid) || (trid < LOG_SYSTEM_TRANID + 1));
2097 
2098  assert (LOG_SYSTEM_TRANID + 1 <= trid && trid <= DB_INT32_MAX);
2099 
2100  tdes->trid = trid;
2101  return trid;
2102 #else
2103  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
2104 
2105  logtb_clear_tdes (thread_p, tdes);
2106 
2107  tdes->trid = log_Gl.hdr.next_trid++;
2108  /* check overflow */
2109  if (tdes->trid < 0)
2110  {
2111  tdes->trid = LOG_SYSTEM_TRANID + 1;
2112  /* set MVCC next id to null */
2113  log_Gl.hdr.next_trid = tdes->trid + 1;
2114  }
2115 
2116  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2117 
2118  return tdes->trid;
2119 #endif
2120 }
2121 
2122 /*
2123  * logtb_find_tran_index - find index of transaction
2124  *
2125  * return: tran index
2126  *
2127  * trid(in): Transaction identifier
2128  *
2129  * Note: Find the index of a transaction. This function execute a
2130  * sequential search in the transaction table to find out the
2131  * transaction index. The function bypasses the search if the
2132  * trid belongs to the current transaction.
2133  *
2134  * The assumption of this function is that the transaction table
2135  * is not very big and that most of the time the search is
2136  * avoided. if this assumption becomes false, we may need to
2137  * define a hash table from trid to tdes to speed up the
2138  * search.
2139  */
2140 int
2141 logtb_find_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid)
2142 {
2143  int i;
2144  int tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX; /* The transaction index */
2145  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2146 
2147  /* Avoid searching as much as possible */
2148  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
2149  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2150  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid != trid)
2151  {
2152  tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
2153 
2154  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
2155  /* Search the transaction table for such transaction */
2156  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
2157  {
2158  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2159  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && tdes->trid == trid)
2160  {
2161  tran_index = i;
2162  break;
2163  }
2164  }
2165  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2166  }
2167 
2168  return tran_index;
2169 }
2170 
2171 #if defined (ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
2172 /*
2173  * logtb_find_tran_index_host_pid - find index of transaction
2174  *
2175  * return: tran index
2176  *
2177  * host_name(in): Name of host machine
2178  * process_id(in): Process id of client
2179  *
2180  * Note: Find the index of a transaction. This function executes a
2181  * sequential search in the transaction table to find out the
2182  * transaction index given only the host machine and process id.
2183  *
2184  * The assumption of this function is that the transaction table
2185  * is not very big and that most of the time the search is
2186  * avoided. It is currently only being used during client
2187  * restart to insure that no badly behaving clients manage to
2188  * have two open connections at the same time.
2189  */
2190 int
2191 logtb_find_tran_index_host_pid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *host_name, int process_id)
2192 {
2193  int i;
2194  int tran_index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX; /* The transaction index */
2195  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2196 
2197  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
2198  /* Search the transaction table for such transaction */
2199  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
2200  {
2201  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2202  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && tdes->client.process_id == process_id
2203  && strcmp (tdes->client.host_name, host_name) == 0)
2204  {
2205  tran_index = i;
2206  break;
2207  }
2208  }
2209  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2210 
2211  return tran_index;
2212 }
2213 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
2214 
2215 /*
2216  * logtb_find_tranid - find TRANID of transaction index
2217  *
2218  * return: TRANID
2219  *
2220  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2221  */
2222 TRANID
2223 logtb_find_tranid (int tran_index)
2224 {
2225  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2226  TRANID trid = NULL_TRANID; /* Transaction index */
2227 
2228  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2229  if (tdes != NULL)
2230  {
2231  trid = tdes->trid;
2232  }
2233  return trid;
2234 }
2235 
2236 /*
2237  * logtb_find_current_tranid - find current transaction identifier
2238  *
2239  * return: TRANID
2240  */
2241 TRANID
2242 logtb_find_current_tranid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2243 {
2244  return logtb_find_tranid (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
2245 }
2246 
2247 /*
2248  * logtb_set_client_ids_all - Set client identifications
2249  *
2250  * return: nothing..
2251  *
2252  * client(in/out): The client block
2253  * client_type(in):
2254  * client_info(in):
2255  * db_user(in):
2256  * program_name(in):
2257  * login_name(in):
2258  * host_name(in):
2259  * process_id(in):
2260  *
2261  * NOTE: Set client identifications.
2262  */
2263 void
2264 logtb_set_client_ids_all (LOG_CLIENTIDS * client, int client_type, const char *client_info, const char *db_user,
2265  const char *program_name, const char *login_name, const char *host_name, int process_id)
2266 {
2267  client->client_type = client_type;
2268  strncpy (client->client_info, (client_info) ? client_info : "", DB_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH);
2269  client->client_info[DB_MAX_IDENTIFIER_LENGTH] = '\0';
2270  strncpy (client->db_user, (db_user) ? db_user : log_Client_id_unknown_string, LOG_USERNAME_MAX - 1);
2271  client->db_user[LOG_USERNAME_MAX - 1] = '\0';
2272  if (program_name == NULL || basename_r (program_name, client->program_name, PATH_MAX) < 0)
2273  {
2274  strncpy (client->program_name, log_Client_id_unknown_string, PATH_MAX);
2275  }
2276  client->program_name[PATH_MAX] = '\0';
2277  strncpy (client->login_name, (login_name) ? login_name : log_Client_id_unknown_string, L_cuserid);
2278  client->login_name[L_cuserid] = '\0';
2279  strncpy (client->host_name, (host_name) ? host_name : log_Client_id_unknown_string, MAXHOSTNAMELEN);
2280  client->host_name[MAXHOSTNAMELEN] = '\0';
2281  client->process_id = process_id;
2282  client->is_user_active = false;
2283 }
2284 
2285 #if defined (ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
2286 /*
2287  * logtb_count_clients_with_type - count number of transaction indices
2288  * with client type
2289  * return: number of clients
2290  */
2291 int
2292 logtb_count_clients_with_type (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int client_type)
2293 {
2294  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2295  int i, count;
2296 
2297  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
2298 
2299  count = 0;
2300  for (i = 0; i < log_Gl.trantable.num_total_indices; i++)
2301  {
2302  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2303  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2304  {
2305  if (tdes->client.client_type == client_type)
2306  {
2307  count++;
2308  }
2309  }
2310  }
2311  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2312  return count;
2313 }
2314 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
2315 
2316 /*
2317  * logtb_count_clients - count number of transaction indices
2318  * return: number of clients
2319  */
2320 int
2321 logtb_count_clients (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2322 {
2323  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2324  int i, count;
2325 
2326  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
2327 
2328  count = 0;
2329  for (i = 0; i < log_Gl.trantable.num_total_indices; i++)
2330  {
2331  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2332  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2333  {
2334  if (BOOT_NORMAL_CLIENT_TYPE (tdes->client.client_type))
2335  {
2336  count++;
2337  }
2338  }
2339  }
2340  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2341  return count;
2342 }
2343 
2344 /*
2345  * logtb_count_not_allowed_clients_in_maintenance_mode -
2346  * count number of transaction indices
2347  * connection not allowed client in maintenancemode.
2348  * return: number of clients
2349  */
2350 int
2351 logtb_count_not_allowed_clients_in_maintenance_mode (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2352 {
2353  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2354  int i, count;
2355 
2356  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
2357 
2358  count = 0;
2359  for (i = 0; i < log_Gl.trantable.num_total_indices; i++)
2360  {
2361  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2362  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2363  {
2364  if (!BOOT_IS_ALLOWED_CLIENT_TYPE_IN_MT_MODE (tdes->client.host_name, boot_Host_name,
2365  tdes->client.client_type))
2366  {
2367  count++;
2368  }
2369  }
2370  }
2371  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2372  return count;
2373 }
2374 
2375 /*
2376  * logtb_find_client_type - find client type of transaction index
2377  *
2378  * return: client type
2379  *
2380  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2381  */
2382 int
2383 logtb_find_client_type (int tran_index)
2384 {
2385  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2386 
2387  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2388  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2389  {
2390  return tdes->client.client_type;
2391  }
2392  return -1;
2393 }
2394 
2395 /*
2396  * logtb_find_client_name - find client name of transaction index
2397  *
2398  * return: client name
2399  *
2400  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2401  */
2402 char *
2403 logtb_find_client_name (int tran_index)
2404 {
2405  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2406 
2407  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2408  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2409  {
2410  return tdes->client.db_user;
2411  }
2412  return NULL;
2413 }
2414 
2415 /*
2416  * logtb_set_user_name - set client name of transaction index
2417  *
2418  * return:
2419  *
2420  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2421  * user_name(in):
2422  */
2423 void
2424 logtb_set_user_name (int tran_index, const char *user_name)
2425 {
2426  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2427 
2428  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2429  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2430  {
2431  strncpy (tdes->client.db_user, (user_name) ? user_name : log_Client_id_unknown_string,
2432  sizeof (tdes->client.db_user) - 1);
2433  }
2434  return;
2435 }
2436 
2437 /*
2438  * logtb_set_current_user_name - set client name of current transaction
2439  *
2440  * return:
2441  */
2442 void
2443 logtb_set_current_user_name (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *user_name)
2444 {
2445  logtb_set_user_name (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p), user_name);
2446 }
2447 
2448 /*
2449  * logtb_set_current_user_active() - set active state of current user
2450  *
2451  * return:
2452  * thread_p(in):
2453  * is_user_active(in):
2454  */
2455 void
2456 logtb_set_current_user_active (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool is_user_active)
2457 {
2458  int tran_index;
2459  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2460 
2461  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
2462  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2463 
2464  tdes->client.is_user_active = is_user_active;
2465 }
2466 
2467 /*
2468  * logtb_find_client_hostname - find client hostname of transaction index
2469  *
2470  * return: client hostname
2471  *
2472  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2473  */
2474 char *
2475 logtb_find_client_hostname (int tran_index)
2476 {
2477  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2478 
2479  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2480  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
2481  {
2482  return tdes->client.host_name;
2483  }
2484  return NULL;
2485 }
2486 
2487 /*
2488  * logtb_find_client_name_host_pid - find client identifiers(user_name,
2489  * host_name, host_pid) OF TRANSACTION INDEX
2490  *
2491  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
2492  *
2493  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2494  * client_prog_name(out): Name of the client program
2495  * client_user_name(out): Name of the client user
2496  * client_host_name(out): Name of the client host
2497  * client_pid(out): Identifier of the process of the host where the client
2498  * client transaction runs.
2499  *
2500  * Note: Find the client user name, host name, and process identifier
2501  * associated with the given transaction index.
2502  *
2503  * The above pointers are valid until the client is unregister.
2504  */
2505 int
2506 logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (int tran_index, char **client_prog_name, char **client_user_name,
2507  char **client_host_name, int *client_pid)
2508 {
2509  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2510 
2511  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2512 
2513  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID)
2514  {
2515  *client_prog_name = (char *) log_Client_id_unknown_string;
2516  *client_user_name = (char *) log_Client_id_unknown_string;
2517  *client_host_name = (char *) log_Client_id_unknown_string;
2518  *client_pid = -1;
2519  return ER_FAILED;
2520  }
2521 
2522  *client_prog_name = tdes->client.program_name;
2523  *client_user_name = tdes->client.db_user;
2524  *client_host_name = tdes->client.host_name;
2525  *client_pid = tdes->client.process_id;
2526 
2527  return NO_ERROR;
2528 }
2529 
2530 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
2531 /* logtb_find_client_tran_name_host_pid - same as logtb_find_client_name_host_pid, but also gets tran_index.
2532  */
2533 int
2534 logtb_find_client_tran_name_host_pid (int &tran_index, char **client_prog_name, char **client_user_name,
2535  char **client_host_name, int *client_pid)
2536 {
2537  tran_index = logtb_get_current_tran_index ();
2538  return logtb_find_client_name_host_pid (tran_index, client_prog_name, client_user_name, client_host_name, client_pid);
2539 }
2540 #endif // SERVER_MODE
2541 
2542 /*
2543  * logtb_find_client_ids - find client identifiers OF TRANSACTION INDEX
2544  *
2545  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER_ status otherwise
2546  *
2547  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2548  * client_info(out): pointer to LOG_CLIENTIDS structure
2549  *
2550  */
2551 int
2552 logtb_get_client_ids (int tran_index, LOG_CLIENTIDS * client_info)
2553 {
2554  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2555 
2556  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2557  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID)
2558  {
2559  return ER_FAILED;
2560  }
2561 
2562  *client_info = tdes->client;
2563 
2564  return NO_ERROR;
2565 }
2566 
2567 /*
2568  * xlogtb_get_pack_tran_table - return transaction info stored on transaction table
2569  *
2570  * return: NO_ERROR if all OK, ER status otherwise
2571  *
2572  * buffer_p(in/out): returned buffer poitner
2573  * size_p(in/out): returned buffer size
2574  *
2575  * Note: This is a support function which is used mainly for the
