2576  * killtran utility. It returns a variety of client information
2577  * of transactions. This will be displayed by killtran so that
2578  * the user can select which transaction id needs to be aborted.
2579  *
2580  * The buffer is allocated using malloc and must be freed by the
2581  * caller.
2582  */
2583 int
2584 xlogtb_get_pack_tran_table (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, char **buffer_p, int *size_p, int include_query_exec_info)
2585 {
2586  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
2587  int num_clients = 0, num_clients_packed = 0;
2588  int i;
2589  int size;
2590  char *buffer, *ptr;
2591  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2592  int num_total_indices;
2593 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2594  INT64 current_msec = 0;
2595  TRAN_QUERY_EXEC_INFO *query_exec_info = NULL;
2596  XASL_CACHE_ENTRY *ent = NULL;
2597 #endif
2598 
2599  /* Note, we'll be in a critical section while we gather the data but the section ends as soon as we return the data.
2600  * This means that the transaction table can change after the information is used. */
2601 
2602  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
2603 
2604  num_total_indices = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES;
2605 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2606  if (include_query_exec_info)
2607  {
2608  query_exec_info = (TRAN_QUERY_EXEC_INFO *) calloc (num_total_indices, sizeof (TRAN_QUERY_EXEC_INFO));
2609 
2610  if (query_exec_info == NULL)
2611  {
2612  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
2613  goto error;
2614  }
2615 
2616  current_msec = log_get_clock_msec ();
2617  }
2618 #endif
2619 
2620  size = OR_INT_SIZE; /* Number of client transactions */
2621 
2622  /* Find size of needed buffer */
2623  for (i = 0; i < num_total_indices; i++)
2624  {
2625  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2626  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID || tdes->tran_index == LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
2627  {
2628  /* The index is not assigned or is system transaction (no-client) */
2629  continue;
2630  }
2631 
2632  size += (3 * OR_INT_SIZE /* tran index + tran state + process id */
2633  + OR_INT_SIZE + DB_ALIGN (sizeof (tdes->client.db_user), INT_ALIGNMENT)
2634  + OR_INT_SIZE + DB_ALIGN (sizeof (tdes->client.program_name), INT_ALIGNMENT)
2635  + OR_INT_SIZE + DB_ALIGN (sizeof (tdes->client.login_name), INT_ALIGNMENT)
2636  + OR_INT_SIZE + DB_ALIGN (sizeof (tdes->client.host_name), INT_ALIGNMENT));
2637 
2638 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2639  if (include_query_exec_info)
2640  {
2641  if (tdes->query_start_time > 0)
2642  {
2643  query_exec_info[i].query_time = (float) (current_msec - tdes->query_start_time) / 1000.0f;
2644  }
2645 
2646  if (tdes->tran_start_time > 0)
2647  {
2648  query_exec_info[i].tran_time = (float) (current_msec - tdes->tran_start_time) / 1000.0f;
2649  }
2650 
2651  lock_get_lock_holder_tran_index (thread_p, &query_exec_info[i].wait_for_tran_index_string, tdes->tran_index,
2652  tdes->waiting_for_res);
2653 
2654  if (!XASL_ID_IS_NULL (&tdes->xasl_id))
2655  {
2656  /* retrieve query statement in the xasl_cache entry */
2657  error_code = xcache_find_sha1 (thread_p, &tdes->xasl_id.sha1, XASL_CACHE_SEARCH_GENERIC, &ent, NULL);
2658  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
2659  {
2660  ASSERT_ERROR ();
2661  goto error;
2662  }
2663 
2664  /* entry can be NULL, if xasl cache entry is deleted */
2665  if (ent != NULL)
2666  {
2667  if (ent->sql_info.sql_hash_text != NULL)
2668  {
2669  char *sql = ent->sql_info.sql_hash_text;
2670 
2671  if (qmgr_get_sql_id (thread_p, &query_exec_info[i].sql_id, sql, (int) strlen (sql)) != NO_ERROR)
2672  {
2673  goto error;
2674  }
2675 
2676  if (ent->sql_info.sql_user_text != NULL)
2677  {
2678  sql = ent->sql_info.sql_user_text;
2679  }
2680 
2681  /* copy query string */
2682  query_exec_info[i].query_stmt = strdup (sql);
2683  if (query_exec_info[i].query_stmt == NULL)
2684  {
2685  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
2686  goto error;
2687  }
2688  }
2689  xcache_unfix (thread_p, ent);
2690  ent = NULL;
2691  }
2692 
2693  /* structure copy */
2694  XASL_ID_COPY (&query_exec_info[i].xasl_id, &tdes->xasl_id);
2695  }
2696  else
2697  {
2698  XASL_ID_SET_NULL (&query_exec_info[i].xasl_id);
2699  }
2700 
2701  size += (2 * OR_FLOAT_SIZE /* query time + tran time */
2702  + or_packed_string_length (query_exec_info[i].wait_for_tran_index_string, NULL)
2703  + or_packed_string_length (query_exec_info[i].query_stmt, NULL)
2704  + or_packed_string_length (query_exec_info[i].sql_id, NULL) + OR_XASL_ID_SIZE);
2705  }
2706 #endif
2707  num_clients++;
2708  }
2709 
2710  /* Now allocate the area and pack the information */
2711  buffer = (char *) malloc (size);
2712  if (buffer == NULL)
2713  {
2714  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, (size_t) size);
2715  error_code = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
2716  goto error;
2717  }
2718 
2719  ptr = buffer;
2720  ptr = or_pack_int (ptr, num_clients);
2721 
2722  /* Find size of needed buffer */
2723  for (i = 0; i < num_total_indices; i++)
2724  {
2725  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
2726  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID || tdes->tran_index == LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
2727  {
2728  /* The index is not assigned or is system transaction (no-client) */
2729  continue;
2730  }
2731 
2732  ptr = or_pack_int (ptr, tdes->tran_index);
2733  ptr = or_pack_int (ptr, tdes->state);
2734  ptr = or_pack_int (ptr, tdes->client.process_id);
2735  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, tdes->client.db_user);
2736  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, tdes->client.program_name);
2737  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, tdes->client.login_name);
2738  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, tdes->client.host_name);
2739 
2740 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2741  if (include_query_exec_info)
2742  {
2743  ptr = or_pack_float (ptr, query_exec_info[i].query_time);
2744  ptr = or_pack_float (ptr, query_exec_info[i].tran_time);
2745  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, query_exec_info[i].wait_for_tran_index_string);
2746  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, query_exec_info[i].query_stmt);
2747  ptr = or_pack_string (ptr, query_exec_info[i].sql_id);
2748  OR_PACK_XASL_ID (ptr, &query_exec_info[i].xasl_id);
2749  }
2750 #endif
2751 
2752  num_clients_packed++;
2753  assert (num_clients_packed <= num_clients);
2754  assert (ptr <= buffer + size);
2755  }
2756 
2757  assert (num_clients_packed == num_clients);
2758  assert (num_total_indices == NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES);
2759  assert (ptr <= buffer + size);
2760 
2761  *buffer_p = buffer;
2762  *size_p = CAST_BUFLEN (ptr - buffer);
2763 
2764 error:
2765  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
2766 
2767 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
2768  if (query_exec_info != NULL)
2769  {
2770  for (i = 0; i < num_total_indices; i++)
2771  {
2772  if (query_exec_info[i].wait_for_tran_index_string)
2773  {
2774  free_and_init (query_exec_info[i].wait_for_tran_index_string);
2775  }
2776  if (query_exec_info[i].query_stmt)
2777  {
2778  free_and_init (query_exec_info[i].query_stmt);
2779  }
2780  if (query_exec_info[i].sql_id)
2781  {
2782  free_and_init (query_exec_info[i].sql_id);
2783  }
2784  }
2785  free_and_init (query_exec_info);
2786  }
2787 
2788  if (ent != NULL)
2789  {
2790  xcache_unfix (thread_p, ent);
2791  }
2792 #endif
2793 
2794  return error_code;
2795 }
2796 
2797 /*
2798  * logtb_find_current_client_type - find client type of current transaction
2799  *
2800  * return: client type
2801  */
2802 int
2803 logtb_find_current_client_type (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2804 {
2805  return logtb_find_client_type (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
2806 }
2807 
2808 /*
2809  * logtb_find_current_client_name - find client name of current transaction
2810  *
2811  * return: client name
2812  */
2813 char *
2814 logtb_find_current_client_name (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2815 {
2816  return logtb_find_client_name (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
2817 }
2818 
2819 /*
2820  * logtb_find_current_client_hostname - find client hostname of current transaction
2821  *
2822  * return: client hostname
2823  */
2824 char *
2825 logtb_find_current_client_hostname (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2826 {
2827  return logtb_find_client_hostname (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
2828 }
2829 
2830 /*
2831  * logtb_find_current_tran_lsa - find current transaction log sequence address
2832  *
2833  * return: LOG_LSA *
2834  */
2835 LOG_LSA *
2836 logtb_find_current_tran_lsa (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
2837 {
2838  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2839 
2840  tdes = LOG_FIND_CURRENT_TDES (thread_p);
2841  return ((tdes != NULL) ? &tdes->tail_lsa : NULL);
2842 }
2843 
2844 /*
2845  * logtb_find_state - find the state of the transaction
2846  *
2847  * return: TRAN_STATE
2848  *
2849  * tran_index(in): transaction index
2850  */
2851 TRAN_STATE
2852 logtb_find_state (int tran_index)
2853 {
2854  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2855 
2856  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2857  if (tdes != NULL)
2858  {
2859  return tdes->state;
2860  }
2861  else
2862  {
2863  return TRAN_UNACTIVE_UNKNOWN;
2864  }
2865 }
2866 
2867 /*
2868  * xlogtb_reset_wait_msecs - reset future waiting times
2869  *
2870  * return: The old wait_msecs.
2871  *
2872  * wait_msecs(in): Wait for at least this number of milliseconds to acquire a lock
2873  * before the transaction is timed out.
2874  * A negative value (e.g., -1) means wait forever until a lock
2875  * is granted or transaction is selected as a victim of a
2876  * deadlock.
2877  * A value of zero means do not wait at all, timeout immediately
2878  * (in milliseconds)
2879  *
2880  * Note:Reset the default waiting time for the current transaction index(client).
2881  */
2882 int
2883 xlogtb_reset_wait_msecs (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int wait_msecs)
2884 {
2885  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2886  int old_wait_msecs; /* The old waiting time to be returned */
2887  int tran_index;
2888 
2889  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
2890  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2891  if (tdes == NULL)
2892  {
2893  er_set (ER_FATAL_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_LOG_UNKNOWN_TRANINDEX, 1, tran_index);
2894  return -1;
2895  }
2896 
2897  old_wait_msecs = tdes->wait_msecs;
2898  tdes->wait_msecs = wait_msecs;
2899 
2900  return old_wait_msecs;
2901 }
2902 
2903 /*
2904  * logtb_find_wait_msecs - find waiting times for given transaction
2905  *
2906  * return: wait_msecs...
2907  *
2908  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2909  */
2910 int
2911 logtb_find_wait_msecs (int tran_index)
2912 {
2913  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2914 
2915  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2916  if (tdes != NULL)
2917  {
2918  return tdes->wait_msecs;
2919  }
2920  else
2921  {
2922  assert (false);
2923  return 0;
2924  }
2925 }
2926 
2927 /*
2928  * logtb_find_interrupt -
2929  *
2930  * return :
2931  *
2932  * tran_index(in):
2933  * interrupt(out):
2934  *
2935  */
2936 int
2937 logtb_find_interrupt (int tran_index, bool * interrupt)
2938 {
2939  LOG_TDES *tdes;
2940 
2941  assert (interrupt);
2942 
2943  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2944  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID)
2945  {
2946  return ER_FAILED;
2947  }
2948  else
2949  {
2950  *interrupt = tdes->interrupt ? true : false;
2951  }
2952 
2953  return NO_ERROR;
2954 }
2955 
2956 /*
2957  * logtb_find_log_records_count - find log records count for given transaction
2958  *
2959  * return: num_log_records_written...
2960  *
2961  * tran_index(in): Index of transaction
2962  */
2963 int
2964 logtb_find_log_records_count (int tran_index)
2965 {
2966  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
2967 
2968  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
2969  if (tdes != NULL)
2970  {
2971  return tdes->num_log_records_written;
2972  }
2973  else
2974  {
2975  return 0;
2976  }
2977 }
2978 
2979 /*
2980  * xlogtb_reset_isolation - reset consistency of transaction
2981  *
2982  * return: error code.
2983  *
2984  * isolation(in): New Isolation level. One of the following:
2985  * TRAN_SERIALIZABLE
2986  * TRAN_REPEATABLE_READ
2987  * TRAN_READ_COMMITTED
2988  *
2989  * Note:Reset the default isolation level for the current transaction index (client).
2990  *
2991  * Note/Warning: This function must be called when the current transaction has
2992  * not been done any work (i.e, just after restart, commit, or
2993  * abort), otherwise, its isolation behaviour will be undefined.
2994  */
2995 int
2996 xlogtb_reset_isolation (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRAN_ISOLATION isolation)
2997 {
2998  TRAN_ISOLATION old_isolation;
2999  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
3000  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3001  int tran_index;
3002 
3003  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3004  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3005 
3006  if (IS_VALID_ISOLATION_LEVEL (isolation) && tdes != NULL)
3007  {
3008  old_isolation = tdes->isolation;
3009  tdes->isolation = isolation;
3010  }
3011  else
3012  {
3013  er_set (ER_SYNTAX_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MVCC_LOG_INVALID_ISOLATION_LEVEL, 0);
3014  error_code = ER_MVCC_LOG_INVALID_ISOLATION_LEVEL;
3015  }
3016 
3017  return error_code;
3018 }
3019 
3020 /*
3021  * logtb_find_isolation - find the isolation level for given trans
3022  *
3023  * return: isolation
3024  *
3025  * tran_index(in):Index of transaction
3026  */
3027 TRAN_ISOLATION
3028 logtb_find_isolation (int tran_index)
3029 {
3030  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3031 
3032  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3033  if (tdes != NULL)
3034  {
3035  return tdes->isolation;
3036  }
3037  else
3038  {
3039  return TRAN_UNKNOWN_ISOLATION;
3040  }
3041 }
3042 
3043 /*
3044  * logtb_find_current_isolation - find the isolation level for current
3045  * transaction
3046  *
3047  * return: isolation...
3048  *
3049  * Note: Find the isolation level for the current transaction
3050  */
3051 TRAN_ISOLATION
3052 logtb_find_current_isolation (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3053 {
3054  int tran_index;
3055 
3056  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3057  return logtb_find_isolation (tran_index);
3058 }
3059 
3060 /*
3061  * xlogtb_set_interrupt - indicate interrupt to a future caller of current
3062  * transaction
3063  *
3064  * return: nothing
3065  *
3066  * set(in): true for set and false for clear
3067  *
3068  * Note: Set the interrupt falg for the current execution, so that the
3069  * next caller obtains an interrupt.
3070  */
3071 void
3072 xlogtb_set_interrupt (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int set)
3073 {
3074  logtb_set_tran_index_interrupt (thread_p, LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p), set);
3075 }
3076 
3077 /*
3078  * logtb_set_tran_index_interrupt - indicate interrupt to a future caller for an
3079  * specific transaction index
3080  *
3081  * return: false is returned when the tran_index is not associated
3082  * with a transaction
3083  *
3084  * tran_index(in): Transaction index
3085  * set(in): true for set and false for clear
3086  *
3087  * Note:Set the interrupt flag for the execution of the given transaction,
3088  * so that the next caller obtains an interrupt.
3089  */
3090 bool
3091 logtb_set_tran_index_interrupt (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, bool set)
3092 {
3093  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3094 
3095  if (tran_index == LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
3096  {
3097  assert (false);
3098  return false;
3099  }
3100 
3101  if (log_Gl.trantable.area != NULL)
3102  {
3103  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3104  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
3105  {
3106  if (tdes->interrupt != (int) set)
3107  {
3108 #if defined (HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
3109  tdes->interrupt = (int) set;
3110  if (set == true)
3111  {
3112  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts, 1);
3113  }
3114  else
3115  {
3116  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts, -1);
3117  }
3118 #else
3119  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
3120 
3121  tdes->interrupt = set;
3122  if (set == true)
3123  {
3124  log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts++;
3125  }
3126  else
3127  {
3128  log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts--;
3129  }
3130 
3131  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
3132 #endif
3133  }
3134 
3135  if (set == true)
3136  {
3137  pgbuf_force_to_check_for_interrupts ();
3138  er_set (ER_NOTIFICATION_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INTERRUPTING, 1, tran_index);
3139  perfmon_inc_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_TRAN_NUM_INTERRUPTS);
3140  }
3141 
3142  return true;
3143  }
3144  }
3145 
3146  return false;
3147 }
3148 
3149 /*
3150  * logtb_is_interrupted_tdes -
3151  *
3152  * return:
3153  *
3154  * tdes(in/out):
3155  * clear(in/out):
3156  * continue_checking(out):
3157  *
3158  * Note:
3159  */
3160 static bool
3161 logtb_is_interrupted_tdes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes, bool clear, bool * continue_checking)
3162 {
3163  bool interrupt;
3164  INT64 now;
3165 #if !defined(SERVER_MODE)
3166  struct timeval tv;
3167 
3168 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
3169  /* vacuum threads should not be interruptible (unless this is still recovery). */
3170  assert (!BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED () || !VACUUM_IS_THREAD_VACUUM (thread_p));
3171 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
3172 
3173  interrupt = tdes->interrupt;
3174  if (!LOG_ISTRAN_ACTIVE (tdes))
3175  {
3176  interrupt = false;
3177 
3178  if (log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts > 0)
3179  {
3180  *continue_checking = true;
3181  }
3182  else
3183  {
3184  *continue_checking = false;
3185  }
3186  }
3187  else if (interrupt == true && clear == true)
3188  {
3189  tdes->interrupt = false;
3190 
3191 #if !defined (HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
3192  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
3193  log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts--;
3194 #else
3195  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts, -1);
3196 #endif
3197 
3198  if (log_Gl.trantable.num_interrupts > 0)
3199  {
3200  *continue_checking = true;
3201  }
3202  else
3203  {
3204  *continue_checking = false;
3205  }
3206 
3207 #if !defined (HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
3208  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
3209 #endif
3210  }
3211  else if (interrupt == false && tdes->query_timeout > 0)
3212  {
3213  /* In order to prevent performance degradation, we use log_Clock_msec set by thread_log_clock_thread instead of
3214  * calling gettimeofday here if the system supports atomic built-ins. */
3215 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
3216  now = log_get_clock_msec ();
3217 #else /* SERVER_MODE */
3218  gettimeofday (&tv, NULL);
3219  now = (tv.tv_sec * 1000LL) + (tv.tv_usec / 1000LL);
3220 #endif /* !SERVER_MODE */
3221  if (tdes->query_timeout < now)
3222  {
3223  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
3224  "logtb_is_interrupted_tdes: timeout %lld milliseconds delayed (expected=%lld, now=%lld)",
3225  now - tdes->query_timeout, tdes->query_timeout, now);
3226  interrupt = true;
3227  }
3228  }
3229  return interrupt;
3230 }
3231 
3232 /*
3233  * logtb_is_interrupted - find if execution must be stopped due to
3234  * an interrupt (^C)
3235  *
3236  * return:
3237  *
3238  * clear(in): true if the interrupt should be cleared.
3239  * continue_checking(in): Set as a side effect to true if there are more
3240  * interrupts to check or to false if there are not
3241  * more interrupts.
3242  *
3243  * Note: Find if the current execution must be stopped due to an interrupt (^C). If clear is true, the interruption flag
3244  * is cleared; This is the expected case, once someone is notified, we do not have to keep the flag on.
3245  *
3246  * If the transaction is not active, false is returned. For example, in the middle of an undo action, the
3247  * transaction will not be interrupted. The recovery manager will interrupt the transaction at the end of the undo
3248  * action... in this case the transaction will be partially aborted.
3249  */
3250 bool
3251 logtb_is_interrupted (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool clear, bool * continue_checking)
3252 {
3253  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3254  int tran_index;
3255 
3256  if (log_Gl.trantable.area == NULL)
3257  {
3258  return false;
3259  }
3260  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3261  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3262  if (tdes == NULL)
3263  {
3264  return false;
3265  }
3266 
3267  return logtb_is_interrupted_tdes (thread_p, tdes, clear, continue_checking);
3268 }
3269 
3270 /*
3271  * logtb_is_interrupted_tran - find if the execution of the given transaction
3272  * must be stopped due to an interrupt (^C)
3273  *
3274  * return:
3275  *
3276  * clear(in): true if the interrupt should be cleared.
3277  * continue_checking(in): Set as a side effect to true if there are more
3278  * interrupts to check or to false if there are not
3279  * more interrupts.
3280  * tran_index(in):
3281  *
3282  * Note: Find if the execution of the given transaction must be stopped due to an interrupt (^C). If clear is true, the
3283  * interruption flag is cleared; This is the expected case, once someone is notified, we do not have to keep the
3284  * flag on.
3285  * This function is called to see if a transaction that is waiting (e.g., suspended on a lock) on an event must
3286  * be interrupted.
3287  */
3288 bool
3289 logtb_is_interrupted_tran (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, bool clear, bool * continue_checking, int tran_index)
3290 {
3291  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3292 
3293  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3294  if (log_Gl.trantable.area == NULL || tdes == NULL)
3295  {
3296  return false;
3297  }
3298 
3299  return logtb_is_interrupted_tdes (thread_p, tdes, clear, continue_checking);
3300 }
3301 
3302 /*
3303  * xlogtb_set_suppress_repl_on_transaction - set or unset suppress_replication flag
3304  * on transaction descriptor
3305  *
3306  * return: nothing
3307  *
3308  * set(in): non-zero to set, zero to unset
3309  */
3310 void
3311 xlogtb_set_suppress_repl_on_transaction (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int set)
3312 {
3313  logtb_set_suppress_repl_on_transaction (thread_p, LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p), set);
3314 }
3315 
3316 /*
3317  * logtb_set_suppress_repl_on_transaction - set or unset suppress_replication flag
3318  * on transaction descriptor
3319  *
3320  * return: false is returned when the tran_index is not associated
3321  * with a transaction
3322  *
3323  * tran_index(in): Transaction index
3324  * set(in): non-zero to set, zero to unset
3325  */
3326 bool
3327 logtb_set_suppress_repl_on_transaction (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index, int set)
3328 {
3329  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3330 
3331  if (log_Gl.trantable.area != NULL)
3332  {
3333  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3334  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
3335  {
3336  if (tdes->suppress_replication != set)
3337  {
3338  tdes->suppress_replication = set;
3339  }
3340  return true;
3341  }
3342  }
3343  return false;
3344 }
3345 
3346 
3347 /*
3348  * logtb_is_active - is transaction active ?
3349  *
3350  * return:
3351  *
3352  * trid(in): Transaction identifier
3353  *
3354  * Note: Find if given transaction is an active one. This function
3355  * execute a sequential search in the transaction table to find
3356  * out the given transaction. The function bypasses the search if
3357  * the given trid is current transaction.
3358  *
3359  * Note: The assumption of this function is that the transaction table
3360  * is not very big and that most of the time the search is
3361  * avoided. if this assumption becomes false, we may need to
3362  * define a hash table from trid to tdes to speed up the search.
3363  */
3364 bool
3365 logtb_is_active (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid)
3366 {
3367  int i;
3368  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3369  bool active = false;
3370  int tran_index;
3371 
3372  if (!LOG_ISRESTARTED ())
3373  {
3374  return false;
3375  }
3376 
3377  /* Avoid searching as much as possible */
3378  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3379  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3380  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid == trid)
3381  {
3382  active = LOG_ISTRAN_ACTIVE (tdes);
3383  }
3384  else
3385  {
3386  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
3387  /* Search the transaction table for such transaction */
3388  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
3389  {
3390  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
3391  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && tdes->trid == trid)
3392  {
3393  active = LOG_ISTRAN_ACTIVE (tdes);
3394  break;
3395  }
3396  }
3397  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
3398  }
3399 
3400  return active;
3401 }
3402 
3403 /*
3404  * logtb_is_current_active - is current transaction active ?
3405  *
3406  * return:
3407  *
3408  * Note: Find if the current transaction is an active one.
3409  */
3410 bool
3411 logtb_is_current_active (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3412 {
3413  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3414  int tran_index;
3415 
3416  if (VACUUM_IS_THREAD_VACUUM (thread_p))
3417  {
3418  /* Vacuum workers/master are always considered active (since they have no transactions). */
3419  return true;
3420  }
3421 
3422  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3423  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3424 
3425  if (tdes != NULL && LOG_ISTRAN_ACTIVE (tdes))
3426  {
3427  return true;
3428  }
3429  else
3430  {
3431  return false;
3432  }
3433 }
3434 
3435 /*
3436  * logtb_istran_finished - is transaction finished?
3437  *
3438  * return:
3439  *
3440  * trid(in): Transaction identifier
3441  *
3442  * Note: Find if given transaction exists. That is, find if the
3443  * transaction has completely finished its execution.
3444  * Note that this function differs from log_istran_active in
3445  * that a transaction in commit or abort state is not active but
3446  * it is still alive (i.e., has not done completely).
3447  * This function execute a sequential search in the transaction
3448  * table to find out the given transaction. The function bypasses
3449  * the search if the given trid is current transaction.
3450  *
3451  * The assumption of this function is that the transaction table
3452  * is not very big and that most of the time the search is
3453  * avoided. if this assumption becomes false, we may need to
3454  * define a hash table from trid to tdes to speed up the search.
3455  */
3456 bool
3457 logtb_istran_finished (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, TRANID trid)
3458 {
3459  int i;
3460  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3461  bool active = true;
3462  int tran_index;
3463 
3464  /* Avoid searching as much as possible */
3465  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3466  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3467  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid == trid)
3468  {
3469  active = false;
3470  }
3471  else
3472  {
3473  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
3474  /* Search the transaction table for such transaction */
3475  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
3476  {
3477  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
3478  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && tdes->trid == trid)
3479  {
3480  active = false;
3481  break;
3482  }
3483  }
3484  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
3485  }
3486 
3487  return active;
3488 }
3489 
3490 /*
3491  * logtb_has_updated - has transaction updated the database ?
3492  *
3493  * return:
3494  *
3495  */
3496 bool
3497 logtb_has_updated (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3498 {
3499  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
3500  int tran_index;
3501 
3502  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
3503  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
3504  if (tdes != NULL && !LSA_ISNULL (&tdes->tail_lsa))
3505  {
3506  return true;
3507  }
3508  else
3509  {
3510  return false;
3511  }
3512 }
3513 
3514 /*
3515  * logtb_disable_update -
3516  * return: none
3517  */
3518 void
3519 logtb_disable_update (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3520 {
3521  db_Disable_modifications = 1;
3522  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "logtb_disable_update: db_Disable_modifications = %d\n", db_Disable_modifications);
3523 }
3524 
3525 /*
3526  * logtb_enable_update -
3527  * return: none
3528  */
3529 void
3530 logtb_enable_update (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3531 {
3532  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_READ_ONLY_MODE) == false)
3533  {
3534  db_Disable_modifications = 0;
3535  er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE, "logtb_enable_update: db_Disable_modifications = %d\n", db_Disable_modifications);
3536  }
3537 }
3538 
3539 /*
3540  * logtb_set_to_system_tran_index - set to tran index system
3541  *
3542  * return: nothing
3543  *
3544  * Note: The current log_tran_index is set to the system transaction index.
3545  */
3546 void
3547 logtb_set_to_system_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3548 {
3549  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX);
3550 }
3551 
3552 /*
3553  * logtb_tran_free_update_stats () - Free logged list of update statistics.
3554  *
3555  * return : Void.
3556  * log_upd_stats (in) : List of logged update statistics records.
3557  */
3558 static void
3559 logtb_tran_free_update_stats (LOG_TRAN_UPDATE_STATS * log_upd_stats)
3560 {
3561  LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS_CHUNK *cos_chunk = NULL, *next_cos_chunk = NULL;
3562  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK *stats_chunk = NULL, *next_stats_chunk = NULL;
3563 
3564  logtb_tran_clear_update_stats (log_upd_stats);
3565 
3566  /* free count optimization structure */
3567  cos_chunk = log_upd_stats->cos_first_chunk;
3568  if (cos_chunk != NULL)
3569  {
3570  for (; cos_chunk != NULL; cos_chunk = next_cos_chunk)
3571  {
3572  next_cos_chunk = cos_chunk->next_chunk;
3573  free (cos_chunk);
3574  }
3575  log_upd_stats->cos_first_chunk = NULL;
3576  log_upd_stats->cos_current_chunk = NULL;
3577  log_upd_stats->cos_count = 0;
3578  }
3579  if (log_upd_stats->classes_cos_hash != NULL)
3580  {
3581  mht_destroy (log_upd_stats->classes_cos_hash);
3582  log_upd_stats->classes_cos_hash = NULL;
3583  }
3584 
3585  /* free unique statistics structure */
3586  stats_chunk = log_upd_stats->stats_first_chunk;
3587  if (stats_chunk != NULL)
3588  {
3589  for (; stats_chunk != NULL; stats_chunk = next_stats_chunk)
3590  {
3591  next_stats_chunk = stats_chunk->next_chunk;
3592  free (stats_chunk);
3593  }
3594  log_upd_stats->stats_first_chunk = NULL;
3595  log_upd_stats->stats_current_chunk = NULL;
3596  log_upd_stats->stats_count = 0;
3597  }
3598  if (log_upd_stats->unique_stats_hash != NULL)
3599  {
3600  mht_destroy (log_upd_stats->unique_stats_hash);
3601  log_upd_stats->unique_stats_hash = NULL;
3602  }
3603 }
3604 
3605 /*
3606  * logtb_tran_clear_update_stats () - Clear logged update statistics.
3607  * Entries are not actually freed, they are
3608  * appended to a list of free entries ready
3609  * to be reused.
3610  *
3611  * return : Void.
3612  * log_upd_stats (in) : Pointer to update statistics log.
3613  */
3614 static void
3615 logtb_tran_clear_update_stats (LOG_TRAN_UPDATE_STATS * log_upd_stats)
3616 {
3617  /* clear count optimization structure */
3618  log_upd_stats->cos_current_chunk = log_upd_stats->cos_first_chunk;
3619  log_upd_stats->cos_count = 0;
3620  if (log_upd_stats->classes_cos_hash != NULL)
3621  {
3622  mht_clear (log_upd_stats->classes_cos_hash, NULL, NULL);
3623  }
3624 
3625  /* clear unique statistics structure */
3626  log_upd_stats->stats_current_chunk = log_upd_stats->stats_first_chunk;
3627  log_upd_stats->stats_count = 0;
3628  if (log_upd_stats->unique_stats_hash != NULL)
3629  {
3630  mht_clear (log_upd_stats->unique_stats_hash, NULL, NULL);
3631  }
3632 }
3633 
3634 /*
3635  * logtb_tran_btid_hash_func() - Hash function for BTIDs
3636  * return: hash value
3637  * key(in): BTID to hash
3638  * ht_size(in): Size of hash table
3639  */
3640 static unsigned int
3641 logtb_tran_btid_hash_func (const void *key, const unsigned int ht_size)
3642 {
3643  return ((BTID *) key)->vfid.fileid % ht_size;
3644 }
3645 
3646 /*
3647  * logtb_tran_btid_hash_func() - Comparison function for BTIDs (equal or not)
3648  * return: 0 not equal, 1 otherwise
3649  * key1(in): left key
3650  * key2(in): right key
3651  */
3652 static int
3653 logtb_tran_btid_hash_cmp_func (const void *key1, const void *key2)
3654 {
3655  return BTID_IS_EQUAL ((BTID *) key1, (BTID *) key2);
3656 }
3657 
3658 /*
3659  * logtb_tran_create_btid_unique_stats () - allocates memory and initializes
3660  * statistics associated with btid
3661  *
3662  * return : The address of newly created statistics structure or NULL
3663  * in case of error.
3664  * thread_p(in) :
3665  * btid (in) : Id of unique index for which the statistics will be
3666  * created
3667  */
3668 static LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *
3669 logtb_tran_create_btid_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const BTID * btid)
3670 {
3671  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stats = NULL;
3672  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
3673 
3674  if (btid == NULL)
3675  {
3676  assert (false);
3677  return NULL;
3678  }
3679 
3680  if (tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_count % TRAN_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK_SIZE == 0)
3681  {
3682  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK *chunk = NULL;
3683 
3684  if (tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk != NULL
3685  && tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk->next_chunk != NULL)
3686  {
3687  /* reuse the old chunk */
3688  chunk = tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk->next_chunk;
3689  }
3690  else
3691  {
3692  /* if the entire allocated space was exhausted then alloc a new chunk */
3693  int size =
3694  sizeof (LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK) + (TRAN_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK_SIZE -
3695  1) * sizeof (LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS);
3696  chunk = (LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK *) malloc (size);
3697 
3698  if (chunk == NULL)
3699  {
3700  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
3701  return NULL;
3702  }
3703  if (tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_first_chunk == NULL)
3704  {
3705  tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_first_chunk = chunk;
3706  }
3707  else
3708  {
3709  tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk->next_chunk = chunk;
3710  }
3711  chunk->next_chunk = NULL;
3712  }
3713  tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk = chunk;
3714  }
3715 
3716  /* get a new entry */
3717  unique_stats =
3718  &tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_current_chunk->buffer[tdes->log_upd_stats.stats_count++ % TRAN_UNIQUE_STATS_CHUNK_SIZE];
3719 
3720  BTID_COPY (&unique_stats->btid, btid);
3721  unique_stats->deleted = false;
3722 
3723  /* init transaction local statistics */
3724  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_keys = 0;
3725  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_oids = 0;
3726  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_nulls = 0;
3727 
3728  /* init global statistics */
3729  unique_stats->global_stats.num_keys = -1;
3730  unique_stats->global_stats.num_oids = -1;
3731  unique_stats->global_stats.num_nulls = -1;
3732 
3733  /* Store the new entry in hash */
3734  if (mht_put (tdes->log_upd_stats.unique_stats_hash, &unique_stats->btid, unique_stats) == NULL)
3735  {
3736  return NULL;
3737  }
3738 
3739  return unique_stats;
3740 }
3741 
3742 /*
3743  * logtb_tran_create_class_cos () - creates a new count optimization state entry
3744  * for a class
3745  *
3746  * return : return the adddress of newly created entry
3747  * thread_p(in) :
3748  * class_oid (in) : OID of the class for which the entry will be created
3749  */
3750 static LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *
3751 logtb_tran_create_class_cos (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const OID * class_oid)
3752 {
3753  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
3754  LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *entry = NULL;
3755 
3756  if (tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_count % COS_CLASSES_CHUNK_SIZE == 0)
3757  {
3758  LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS_CHUNK *chunk = NULL;
3759  if (tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk != NULL && tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk->next_chunk != NULL)
3760  {
3761  /* reuse the old chunk */
3762  chunk = tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk->next_chunk;
3763  }
3764  else
3765  {
3766  /* if the entire allocated space was exhausted then alloc a new chunk */
3767  int size = sizeof (LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS_CHUNK) + (COS_CLASSES_CHUNK_SIZE - 1) * sizeof (LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS);
3768  chunk = (LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS_CHUNK *) malloc (size);
3769 
3770  if (chunk == NULL)
3771  {
3772  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
3773  return NULL;
3774  }
3775  if (tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_first_chunk == NULL)
3776  {
3777  tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_first_chunk = chunk;
3778  }
3779  else
3780  {
3781  tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk->next_chunk = chunk;
3782  }
3783  chunk->next_chunk = NULL;
3784  }
3785  tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk = chunk;
3786  }
3787 
3788  /* get a new entry */
3789  entry = &tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_current_chunk->buffer[tdes->log_upd_stats.cos_count++ % COS_CLASSES_CHUNK_SIZE];
3790 
3791  /* init newly created entry */
3792  COPY_OID (&entry->class_oid, class_oid);
3793  entry->count_state = COS_NOT_LOADED;
3794 
3795  if (mht_put (tdes->log_upd_stats.classes_cos_hash, &entry->class_oid, entry) == NULL)
3796  {
3797  return NULL;
3798  }
3799 
3800  return entry;
3801 }
3802 
3803 /*
3804  * logtb_tran_find_class_cos () - searches the hash of count optimization states
3805  * for a specific class oid
3806  *
3807  * return : address of found (or newly created) entry or null
3808  * otherwise
3809  * thread_p(in) :
3810  * class_oid (in) : OID of the class for which the entry will be created
3811  * create(in) : true if the caller needs a new entry to be created if not
3812  * found an already existing one
3813  */
3814 LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *
3815 logtb_tran_find_class_cos (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const OID * class_oid, bool create)
3816 {
3817  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
3818  LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *entry = NULL;
3819 
3820  assert (tdes != NULL && class_oid != NULL);
3821 
3822  /* search */
3823  entry = (LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *) mht_get (tdes->log_upd_stats.classes_cos_hash, class_oid);
3824 
3825  if (entry == NULL && create)
3826  {
3827  /* create if not found */
3828  entry = logtb_tran_create_class_cos (thread_p, class_oid);
3829  }
3830 
3831  return entry;
3832 }
3833 
3834 /*
3835  * logtb_tran_find_btid_stats () - searches the hash of statistics for a
3836  * specific index.
3837  *
3838  * return : address of found (or newly created) statistics or null
3839  * otherwise
3840  * thread_p(in) :
3841  * btid (in) : index id to be searched
3842  * create(in) : true if the caller needs a new entry to be created if not
3843  * found an already existing one
3844  */
3845 LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *
3846 logtb_tran_find_btid_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const BTID * btid, bool create)
3847 {
3848  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stats = NULL;
3849  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
3850 
3851  if (btid == NULL)
3852  {
3853  return NULL;
3854  }
3855 
3856  /* search */
3857  unique_stats = (LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *) mht_get (tdes->log_upd_stats.unique_stats_hash, btid);
3858 
3859  if (unique_stats == NULL && create)
3860  {
3861  /* create if not found */
3862  unique_stats = logtb_tran_create_btid_unique_stats (thread_p, btid);
3863  }
3864 
3865  return unique_stats;
3866 }
3867 
3868 /*
3869  * logtb_tran_update_btid_unique_stats () - updates statistics associated with
3870  * the given btid
3871  *
3872  * return : error code or NO_ERROR
3873  * thread_p(in) :
3874  * btid (in) : index id to be searched
3875  * n_keys(in) : number of keys to be added to statistics
3876  * n_oids(in) : number of oids to be added to statistics
3877  * n_nulls(in) : number of nulls to be added to statistics
3878  *
3879  * Note: the statistics are searched and created if they not exist.
3880  */
3881 int
3882 logtb_tran_update_btid_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid, int n_keys, int n_oids, int n_nulls)
3883 {
3884  /* search and create if not found */
3885  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stats = logtb_tran_find_btid_stats (thread_p, btid, true);
3886 
3887  if (unique_stats == NULL)
3888  {
3889  return ER_FAILED;
3890  }
3891 
3892  /* update statistics */
3893  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_keys += n_keys;
3894  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_oids += n_oids;
3895  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_nulls += n_nulls;
3896 
3897  return NO_ERROR;
3898 }
3899 
3900 /*
3901  * logtb_tran_update_unique_stats () - updates statistics associated with
3902  * the given class and btid
3903  *
3904  * return : error code or NO_ERROR
3905  * thread_p(in) :
3906  * btid (in) : B-tree id to be searched
3907  * n_keys(in) : number of keys to be added to statistics
3908  * n_oids(in) : number of oids to be added to statistics
3909  * n_nulls(in) : number of nulls to be added to statistics
3910  * write_to_log : if true then new statistics wil be written to log
3911  *
3912  * Note: the statistics are searched and created if they not exist.
3913  */
3914 int
3915 logtb_tran_update_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid, int n_keys, int n_oids, int n_nulls,
3916  bool write_to_log)
3917 {
3918  int error = NO_ERROR;
3919 
3920  /* update statistics */
3921  error = logtb_tran_update_btid_unique_stats (thread_p, btid, n_keys, n_oids, n_nulls);
3922  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3923  {
3924  return error;
3925  }
3926 
3927  if (write_to_log)
3928  {
3929  /* log statistics */
3930  char undo_rec_buf[3 * OR_INT_SIZE + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE + MAX_ALIGNMENT];
3931  char redo_rec_buf[3 * OR_INT_SIZE + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE + MAX_ALIGNMENT];
3932  RECDES undo_rec, redo_rec;
3933 
3934  undo_rec.area_size = ((3 * OR_INT_SIZE) + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE);
3935  undo_rec.data = PTR_ALIGN (undo_rec_buf, MAX_ALIGNMENT);
3936 
3937  redo_rec.area_size = ((3 * OR_INT_SIZE) + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE);
3938  redo_rec.data = PTR_ALIGN (redo_rec_buf, MAX_ALIGNMENT);
3939 
3940  btree_rv_mvcc_save_increments (btid, -n_keys, -n_oids, -n_nulls, &undo_rec);
3941 
3942  /* todo: remove me. redo has no use */
3943  /*btree_rv_mvcc_save_increments (btid, n_keys, n_oids, n_nulls, &redo_rec);
3944 
3945  log_append_undoredo_data2 (thread_p, RVBT_MVCC_INCREMENTS_UPD, NULL, NULL, -1, undo_rec.length, redo_rec.length,
3946  undo_rec.data, redo_rec.data); */
3947  log_append_undo_data2 (thread_p, RVBT_MVCC_INCREMENTS_UPD, NULL, NULL, NULL_OFFSET, undo_rec.length,
3948  undo_rec.data);
3949  }
3950 
3951  return error;
3952 }
3953 
3954 /*
3955  * logtb_tran_update_delta_hash_func () - updates statistics associated with
3956  * the given btid by local statistics
3957  *
3958  * return : error code or NO_ERROR
3959  * thread_p(in) :
3960  * data(in) : unique statistics
3961  * args(in) : not used
3962  *
3963  * Note: This is a function that is called for each element during the hash
3964  * iteration.
3965  */
3966 static int
3967 logtb_tran_update_delta_hash_func (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, void *data, void *args)
3968 {
3969  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stats = (LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *) data;
3970  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
3971 
3972  if (unique_stats->deleted)
3973  {
3974  /* ignore if deleted */
3975  return NO_ERROR;
3976  }
3977 
3978  error_code =
3979  logtb_update_global_unique_stats_by_delta (thread_p, &unique_stats->btid, unique_stats->tran_stats.num_oids,
3980  unique_stats->tran_stats.num_nulls, unique_stats->tran_stats.num_keys,
3981  true);
3982 
3983  return error_code;
3984 }
3985 
3986 /*
3987  * logtb_tran_update_all_global_unique_stats () - update global statistics
3988  * by local statistics for all
3989  * indexes found in transaction's
3990  * unique statistics hash
3991  *
3992  * return : error code or NO_ERROR
3993  * thread_p(in) :
3994  *
3995  * Note: this function must be called at the end of transaction (commit)
3996  */
3997 static int
3998 logtb_tran_update_all_global_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
3999 {
4000  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4001  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
4002  bool old_check_interrupt;
4003 
4004  if (tdes == NULL)
4005  {
4006  return ER_FAILED;
4007  }
4008 
4009  /* We have to disable interrupt while reflecting unique stats. Please notice that the transaction is still in
4010  * TRAN_ACTIVE state and it may be previously interrupted but user eventually issues commit. The transaction should
4011  * successfully complete commit in spite of interrupt. */
4012  old_check_interrupt = logtb_set_check_interrupt (thread_p, false);
4013 
4014  error_code =
4015  mht_map_no_key (thread_p, tdes->log_upd_stats.unique_stats_hash, logtb_tran_update_delta_hash_func, thread_p);
4016 
4017  (void) logtb_set_check_interrupt (thread_p, old_check_interrupt);
4018 
4019  return error_code;
4020 }
4021 
4022 /*
4023  * logtb_tran_load_global_stats_func () - load global statistics into the
4024  * current transaction for a given class.
4025  *
4026  * return : error code or NO_ERROR
4027  * thread_p(in) :
4028  * data(in) : count optimization state entry
4029  * args(in) : not used
4030  *
4031  * Note: This function is called for each element of the count optimization
4032  * states hash. If the statistics were successfully loaded then set state
4033  * to COS_LOADED. In case of a partitioned class, statistics for each
4034  * partition are loaded.
4035  */
4036 static int
4037 logtb_tran_load_global_stats_func (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, void *data, void *args)
4038 {
4039  int error_code = NO_ERROR, idx;
4040  PRUNING_CONTEXT context;
4041  LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *entry = NULL, *new_entry = NULL;
4042  OR_CLASSREP *classrepr = NULL;
4043  int classrepr_cacheindex = -1;
4044  bool clear_pcontext = false;
4045 
4046  entry = (LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *) data;
4047  if (entry->count_state != COS_TO_LOAD)
4048  {
4049  return NO_ERROR;
4050  }
4051 
4052  /* get class representation to find partition information */
4053  classrepr = heap_classrepr_get (thread_p, &entry->class_oid, NULL, NULL_REPRID, &classrepr_cacheindex);
4054  if (classrepr == NULL)
4055  {
4056  goto cleanup;
4057  }
4058 
4059  if (classrepr->has_partition_info > 0)
4060  {
4061  partition_init_pruning_context (&context);
4062  clear_pcontext = true;
4063 
4064  /* In case of partitioned class load statistics for each partition */
4065  error_code = partition_load_pruning_context (thread_p, &entry->class_oid, DB_PARTITIONED_CLASS, &context);
4066  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
4067  {
4068  goto cleanup;
4069  }
4070  }
4071 
4072  if (classrepr->has_partition_info > 0 && context.count > 0)
4073  {
4074  for (idx = 0; idx < context.count; idx++)
4075  {
4076  if (OID_ISNULL (&context.partitions[idx].class_oid))
4077  {
4078  continue;
4079  }
4080  new_entry = logtb_tran_find_class_cos (thread_p, &context.partitions[idx].class_oid, true);
4081  if (new_entry == NULL)
4082  {
4083  error_code = ER_FAILED;
4084  goto cleanup;
4085  }
4086 
4087  error_code = logtb_create_unique_stats_from_repr (thread_p, &entry->class_oid);
4088  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
4089  {
4090  goto cleanup;
4091  }
4092 
4093  new_entry->count_state = COS_LOADED;
4094  }
4095  }
4096 
4097  error_code = logtb_create_unique_stats_from_repr (thread_p, &entry->class_oid);
4098  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
4099  {
4100  goto cleanup;
4101  }
4102 
4103  entry->count_state = COS_LOADED;
4104 
4105 cleanup:
4106  if (clear_pcontext == true)
4107  {
4108  partition_clear_pruning_context (&context);
4109  }
4110  if (classrepr != NULL)
4111  {
4112  heap_classrepr_free_and_init (classrepr, &classrepr_cacheindex);
4113  }
4114 
4115  return error_code;
4116 }
4117 
4118 /*
4119  * logtb_load_global_statistics_to_tran () - load global statistics into the
4120  * current transaction for all classes
4121  * with COS_TO_LOAD count optimization
4122  * state.
4123  *
4124  * return : error code or NO_ERROR
4125  * thread_p(in) :
4126  *
4127  * Note: The statistics will be loaded only for classes that have COS_TO_LOAD
4128  * count optimization state. This function is used when a snapshot is
4129  * taken.
4130  */
4131 static int
4132 logtb_load_global_statistics_to_tran (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4133 {
4134  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
4135  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4136 
4137  if (tdes == NULL)
4138  {
4139  return ER_FAILED;
4140  }
4141 
4142  error_code =
4143  mht_map_no_key (thread_p, tdes->log_upd_stats.classes_cos_hash, logtb_tran_load_global_stats_func, thread_p);
4144  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
4145  {
4146  return error_code;
4147  }
4148 
4149  return error_code;
4150 }
4151 
4152 /*
4153  * logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot_data - Obtain a new snapshot for current transaction.
4154  *
4155  * return : Error code.
4156  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
4157  *
4158  * Note: Get the snapshot by copying the transactions status from current
4159  * history position. The data from current history position is atomically
4160  * copied. Thus, the version number of current transaction status is saved.
4161  * Then the data is copied. At the end, the actual version number of current
4162  * transaction status is compared with saved version number. If they differ,
4163  * then repeat the algorithm. This may rarely happens - when a lot of
4164  * transactions concurrently commits (about 2000 transactions, currently),
4165  * while current transaction get the snapshot.
4166  */
4167 static int
4168 logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot_data (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4169 {
4170  MVCCID lowest_active_mvccid, bit_area_start_mvccid, highest_completed_mvccid;
4171  int tran_index, error_code = NO_ERROR;
4172  LOG_TDES *tdes;
4173  MVCCID curr_mvccid;
4174  MVCC_SNAPSHOT *snapshot = NULL;
4175  MVCC_INFO *curr_mvcc_info = NULL;
4176  unsigned int bit_area_length, long_tran_mvccids_length = 0;
4177  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = NULL;
4178  volatile MVCCID *p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = NULL;
4179  int index;
4180  unsigned int trans_status_version;
4181  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *trans_status;
4182 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4183  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status;
4184 #else
4185  int r;
4186 #endif
4187  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4188  TSCTIMEVAL tv_diff;
4189  UINT64 snapshot_wait_time;
4190  bool is_perf_tracking = false;
4191  UINT64 snapshot_retry_cnt = 0;
4192 
4193  is_perf_tracking = perfmon_is_perf_tracking ();
4194 
4195  if (is_perf_tracking)
4196  {
4197  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4198  }
4199 
4200  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
4201  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
4202 
4203  p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = LOG_FIND_TRAN_LOWEST_ACTIVE_MVCCID (tran_index);
4204  assert (tdes != NULL && p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid != NULL);
4205 
4206  curr_mvcc_info = &tdes->mvccinfo;
4207  curr_mvccid = curr_mvcc_info->id;
4208  snapshot = &(curr_mvcc_info->snapshot);
4209  error_code = logtb_allocate_snapshot_data (thread_p, snapshot);
4210  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
4211  {
4212  return error_code;
4213  }
4214 
4215  /* Start building the snapshot. See the note. */
4216  mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
4217  if (MVCCID_IS_VALID (*p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid))
4218  {
4219  /* no need to set lowest active MVCCID */
4220  p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = NULL;
4221  }
4222 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4223  current_trans_status = &mvcc_table->current_trans_status;
4224 #endif
4225 
4226 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4227 start_get_mvcc_table:
4228  snapshot_retry_cnt++;
4229 
4230  if (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid)
4231  {
4232  /*
4233  * First, by setting MVCCID_ALL_VISIBLE we will tell to VACUUM that transaction lowest MVCCID will be set soon.
4234  * This is needed since setting p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid is not an atomic operation (global
4235  * lowest_active_mvccid must be obtained first). We want to avoid a possible scenario (even if the chances
4236  * are minimal) like the following one:
4237  * - the snapshot thread reads the initial value of global lowest active MVCCID but the thread is suspended
4238  * (due to thread switching) just before setting p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid
4239  * - the transaction having global lowest active MVCCID commits, so the global value is updated (advanced)
4240  * - the VACCUM thread computes the MVCCID threshold as the updated global lowest active MVCCID
4241  * - the snapshot thread resumes and p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid is set to initial value of global
4242  * lowest active MVCCID
4243  * - the VACUUM thread computes the threshold again and found a value (initial global lowest active MVCCID)
4244  * less than the previously threshold
4245  */
4246  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid, MVCCID_ALL_VISIBLE);
4247  /*
4248  * Is important that between next two code lines to not have delays (to not execute any other code).
4249  * Otherwise, VACUUM may delay, waiting more in logtb_get_oldest_active_mvccid.
4250  */
4251  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&mvcc_table->current_trans_status.lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
4252  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid, lowest_active_mvccid);
4253  }
4254  else
4255  {
4256  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&mvcc_table->current_trans_status.lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
4257  }
4258 
4259  index = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position, 0);
4260  assert (index < TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE && index >= 0);
4261  trans_status = &mvcc_table->trans_status_history[index];
4262  trans_status_version = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&trans_status->version, 0);
4263 
4264  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
4265  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
4266 #else
4267  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4268  lowest_active_mvccid = mvcc_table->current_trans_status.lowest_active_mvccid;
4269  if (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid)
4270  {
4271  *p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
4272  }
4273  trans_status = &mvcc_table->current_trans_status;
4274  bit_area_start_mvccid = trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
4275  bit_area_length = trans_status->bit_area_length;
4276 #endif
4277 
4278  if (bit_area_length > 0)
4279  {
4280  memcpy (snapshot->bit_area, (void *) trans_status->bit_area, MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_BYTES (bit_area_length));
4281  }
4282 
4283  if (trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length > 0)
4284  {
4285  long_tran_mvccids_length = trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length;
4286  memcpy (snapshot->long_tran_mvccids, (void *) trans_status->long_tran_mvccids,
4287  long_tran_mvccids_length * sizeof (MVCCID));
4288  }
4289 
4290  /* load statistics temporary disabled need to be enabled when activate count optimization */
4291 #if 0
4292  /* load global statistics. This must take place here and no where else. */
4293  if (logtb_load_global_statistics_to_tran (thread_p) != NO_ERROR)
4294  {
4295  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_MVCC_CANT_GET_SNAPSHOT, 0);
4296  error_code = ER_MVCC_CANT_GET_SNAPSHOT;
4297  }
4298 #endif
4299 
4300 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4301  if (trans_status_version != ATOMIC_INC_32 (&trans_status->version, 0))
4302  {
4303  /* The transaction status version overwritten, need to read again */
4304  goto start_get_mvcc_table;
4305  }
4306 #else
4307  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4308 #endif
4309 
4310  logtb_get_highest_completed_mvccid (snapshot->bit_area, bit_area_length, bit_area_start_mvccid,
4311  &highest_completed_mvccid);
4312  MVCCID_FORWARD (highest_completed_mvccid);
4313 
4314  /* update lowest active mvccid computed for the most recent snapshot */
4315  curr_mvcc_info->recent_snapshot_lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
4316 
4317  /* update remaining snapshot data */
4318  snapshot->snapshot_fnc = mvcc_satisfies_snapshot;
4319  snapshot->bit_area_start_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid;
4320  snapshot->bit_area_length = bit_area_length;
4321  snapshot->lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
4322  snapshot->highest_completed_mvccid = highest_completed_mvccid;
4323  snapshot->long_tran_mvccids_length = long_tran_mvccids_length;
4324  snapshot->valid = true;
4325 
4326  if (is_perf_tracking)
4327  {
4328  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
4329  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&tv_diff, end_tick, start_tick);
4330  snapshot_wait_time = tv_diff.tv_sec * 1000000LL + tv_diff.tv_usec;
4331  if (snapshot_wait_time > 0)
4332  {
4333  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_LOG_SNAPSHOT_TIME_COUNTERS, snapshot_wait_time);
4334  }
4335  if (snapshot_retry_cnt > 1)
4336  {
4337  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_LOG_SNAPSHOT_RETRY_COUNTERS, snapshot_retry_cnt - 1);
4338  }
4339  }
4340 
4341  return error_code;
4342 }
4343 
4344 /*
4345  * logtb_invalidate_snapshot_data () - Make sure MVCC is invalidated.
4346  *
4347  * return : Void.
4348  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
4349  */
4350 int
4351 logtb_invalidate_snapshot_data (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4352 {
4353  /* Get transaction descriptor */
4354  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4355 
4356  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->isolation >= TRAN_REPEATABLE_READ)
4357  {
4358  /* Nothing to do */
4359  return NO_ERROR;
4360  }
4361 
4362  if (tdes->mvccinfo.snapshot.valid)
4363  {
4364  /* Invalidate snapshot */
4365  tdes->mvccinfo.snapshot.valid = false;
4366  logtb_tran_reset_count_optim_state (thread_p);
4367  }
4368 
4369  return NO_ERROR;
4370 }
4371 
4372 /*
4373  * xlogtb_get_mvcc_snapshot () - Make sure snapshot is generated.
4374  *
4375  * return : Void.
4376  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
4377  */
4378 int
4379 xlogtb_get_mvcc_snapshot (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4380 {
4381  /* Get transaction descriptor */
4382  MVCC_SNAPSHOT *snapshot = logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot (thread_p);
4383  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
4384 
4385  if (snapshot == NULL)
4386  {
4387  ASSERT_ERROR_AND_SET (error_code);
4388  }
4389  return error_code;
4390 }
4391 
4392 /*
4393  * logtb_get_oldest_active_mvccid () - Get oldest MVCCID that was running
4394  * when any active transaction started.
4395  *
4396  * return : MVCCID for oldest active transaction.
4397  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
4398  *
4399  * Note: The returned MVCCID is used as threshold by vacuum. The rows deleted
4400  * by transaction having MVCCIDs >= logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid
4401  * will not be physical removed by vacuum. That's because that rows
4402  * may still be visible to active transactions, even if deleting
4403  * transaction has commit meanwhile. If there is no active
4404  * transaction, this function return highest_completed_mvccid + 1.
4405  */
4406 MVCCID
4407 logtb_get_oldest_active_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4408 {
4409  MVCCID lowest_active_mvccid = 0;
4410  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = NULL;
4411  size_t size;
4412  int i, num_elems_behind, waiting_mvccids_length;
4413  MVCCID *transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = NULL,
4414  local_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid[MVCC_OLDEST_ACTIVE_BUFFER_LENGTH];
4415  int *waiting_mvccids_pos = NULL, pos;
4416  int local_waiting_mvccids_pos[MVCC_OLDEST_ACTIVE_BUFFER_LENGTH];
4417 #if !defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4418  int r;
4419 #endif
4420  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4421  TSCTIMEVAL tv_diff;
4422  UINT64 oldest_time, retry_cnt = 0;
4423  bool is_perf_tracking = false;
4424 
4425  is_perf_tracking = perfmon_is_perf_tracking ();
4426  if (is_perf_tracking)
4427  {
4428  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4429  }
4430 
4431  mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
4432 
4433  if (NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES <= MVCC_OLDEST_ACTIVE_BUFFER_LENGTH)
4434  {
4435  transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = local_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid;
4436  waiting_mvccids_pos = local_waiting_mvccids_pos;
4437  }
4438  else
4439  {
4440  size = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (MVCCID);
4441  transaction_lowest_active_mvccids = (MVCCID *) malloc (size);
4442  if (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids == NULL)
4443  {
4444  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
4445  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
4446  }
4447  size = NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (int);
4448  waiting_mvccids_pos = (int *) malloc (size);
4449  if (waiting_mvccids_pos == NULL)
4450  {
4451  free (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids);
4452  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, size);
4453  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
4454  }
4455  }
4456 
4457  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&mvcc_table->current_trans_status.lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
4458 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4459  /* read transaction_lowest_active_mvccids */
4460  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
4461  {
4462  transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i] = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i], 0LL);
4463  }
4464 #else
4465  /* need atomic read for lowest active mvccid */
4466  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4467  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
4468  {
4469  transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i] = mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i];
4470  }
4471  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4472 #endif
4473 
4474  waiting_mvccids_length = 0;
4475  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
4476  {
4477  if (MVCCID_IS_NORMAL (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i])
4478  && MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i], lowest_active_mvccid))
4479  {
4480  lowest_active_mvccid = transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i];
4481  }
4482  else if (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[i] == MVCCID_ALL_VISIBLE)
4483  {
4484  waiting_mvccids_pos[waiting_mvccids_length++] = i;
4485  }
4486  }
4487 
4488  while (waiting_mvccids_length > 0)
4489  {
4490  /* It happens rare. In such cases we have to wait the snapshot thread to set transaction_lowest_active_mvccids. */
4491  retry_cnt++;
4492 
4493 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
4494  if (retry_cnt % 20 == 0)
4495  {
4496  thread_sleep (10);
4497  }
4498 #endif
4499 
4500  for (i = waiting_mvccids_length - 1; i >= 0; i--)
4501  {
4502  pos = waiting_mvccids_pos[i];
4503  transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[pos] =
4504  ATOMIC_INC_64 (&mvcc_table->transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[pos], 0LL);
4505 
4506  if (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[pos] == MVCCID_ALL_VISIBLE)
4507  {
4508  /* Not set yet, need to wait more. */
4509  continue;
4510  }
4511 
4512  if (MVCCID_IS_NORMAL (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[pos])
4513  && MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[pos], lowest_active_mvccid))
4514  {
4515  /* Update lowest active MVCCID. */
4516  lowest_active_mvccid = transaction_lowest_active_mvccids[pos];
4517  }
4518 
4519  /* Remove current element from waiting array. */
4520  num_elems_behind = (waiting_mvccids_length - 1) - i;
4521  if (num_elems_behind > 0)
4522  {
4523  memmove (&waiting_mvccids_pos[i], &waiting_mvccids_pos[i + 1], num_elems_behind * sizeof (int));
4524  }
4525  waiting_mvccids_length--;
4526  }
4527  }
4528 
4529  if (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids != local_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid)
4530  {
4531  free (transaction_lowest_active_mvccids);
4532  }
4533 
4534  if (waiting_mvccids_pos != local_waiting_mvccids_pos)
4535  {
4536  free (waiting_mvccids_pos);
4537  }
4538  assert (MVCCID_IS_NORMAL (lowest_active_mvccid));
4539 
4540  if (is_perf_tracking)
4541  {
4542  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
4543  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&tv_diff, end_tick, start_tick);
4544  oldest_time = tv_diff.tv_sec * 1000000LL + tv_diff.tv_usec;
4545  if (oldest_time > 0)
4546  {
4547  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_LOG_OLDEST_MVCC_TIME_COUNTERS, oldest_time);
4548  }
4549  if (retry_cnt > 1)
4550  {
4551  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_LOG_OLDEST_MVCC_RETRY_COUNTERS, retry_cnt - 1);
4552  }
4553  }
4554 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
4555  {
4556  /* Safe guard: vacuum_Global_oldest_active_mvccid can never become smaller. */
4557  MVCCID crt_oldest = vacuum_get_global_oldest_active_mvccid ();
4558  assert (!MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (lowest_active_mvccid, crt_oldest));
4559  }
4560 #endif /* !NDEBUG */
4561 
4562  return lowest_active_mvccid;
4563 }
4564 
4565 /*
4566  * logtb_get_new_mvccid - MVCC get new MVCCID
4567  *
4568  * return: error code
4569  *
4570  * thread_p(in):
4571  * curr_mvcc_info(in/out):
4572  * Note: This function get new MVCCID for current transaction. This means
4573  * extending bit area length with 1, reset corresponding bit in bit area,
4574  * and store MVCCID in curr_mvcc_info.
4575  * Also, this function clean the bit area when only committed
4576  * transactions are found or the size of bit area is too large.
4577  */
4578 int
4579 logtb_get_new_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCC_INFO * curr_mvcc_info)
4580 {
4581  MVCCID id;
4582  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
4583  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status = &mvcc_table->current_trans_status;
4584  int r;
4585 #if !defined(NDEBUG) && defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4586  int bit_area_length;
4587 #endif
4588 
4589  assert (curr_mvcc_info != NULL && curr_mvcc_info->id == MVCCID_NULL);
4590 
4591 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4592  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->new_mvccid_lock);
4593 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
4594  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
4595  assert (bit_area_length < MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS && bit_area_length >= 0);
4596 #endif
4597 #else
4598  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4599 #endif
4600  /* generate new MVCCID and increase bit area length */
4601  id = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
4602  MVCCID_FORWARD (log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id);
4603 
4604 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4605  /* Need atomic operation since other transaction can read the values */
4606  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 1);
4607 #else
4608  current_trans_status->bit_area_length++;
4609 #endif
4610 
4611  /* allow to readers / local writers to start */
4612 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4613  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->new_mvccid_lock);
4614 #else
4615  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4616 #endif
4617  /* store MVCCID in MVCCINFO */
4618  curr_mvcc_info->id = id;
4619 
4620  return NO_ERROR;
4621 }
4622 
4623 /*
4624  * logtb_find_current_mvccid - find current transaction MVCC id
4625  *
4626  * return: MVCCID
4627  *
4628  * thread_p(in):
4629  */
4630 MVCCID
4631 logtb_find_current_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4632 {
4633  LOG_TDES *tdes;
4634  MVCCID id = MVCCID_NULL;
4635 
4636  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4637  if (tdes != NULL)
4638  {
4639  if (tdes->mvccinfo.count_sub_ids > 0 && tdes->mvccinfo.is_sub_active)
4640  {
4641  assert (tdes->mvccinfo.sub_ids != NULL);
4642  id = tdes->mvccinfo.sub_ids[tdes->mvccinfo.count_sub_ids - 1];
4643  }
4644  else
4645  {
4646  id = tdes->mvccinfo.id;
4647  }
4648  }
4649 
4650  return id;
4651 }
4652 
4653 /*
4654  * logtb_get_current_mvccid - return current transaction MVCC id. Assign
4655  * a new ID if not previously set.
4656  *
4657  * return: current MVCCID
4658  *
4659  * thread_p(in):
4660  */
4661 MVCCID
4662 logtb_get_current_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4663 {
4664  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4665  MVCC_INFO *curr_mvcc_info = &tdes->mvccinfo;
4666 
4667 #if defined (SA_MODE)
4668  /* We shouldn't be here */
4669  assert (false);
4670 #endif /* SA_MODE */
4671  assert (tdes != NULL && curr_mvcc_info != NULL);
4672 
4673  if (MVCCID_IS_VALID (curr_mvcc_info->id) == false)
4674  {
4675  (void) logtb_get_new_mvccid (thread_p, curr_mvcc_info);
4676  }
4677 
4678  if (tdes->mvccinfo.count_sub_ids > 0 && tdes->mvccinfo.is_sub_active)
4679  {
4680  assert (tdes->mvccinfo.sub_ids != NULL);
4681  return tdes->mvccinfo.sub_ids[tdes->mvccinfo.count_sub_ids - 1];
4682  }
4683 
4684  return curr_mvcc_info->id;
4685 }
4686 
4687 /*
4688  * logtb_is_current_mvccid - check whether given mvccid is current mvccid
4689  *
4690  * return: bool
4691  *
4692  * thread_p(in): thread entry
4693  * mvccid(in): MVCC id
4694  */
4695 bool
4696 logtb_is_current_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCCID mvccid)
4697 {
4698  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4699  MVCC_INFO *curr_mvcc_info;
4700  int i;
4701 
4702  assert (tdes != NULL);
4703 
4704  curr_mvcc_info = &tdes->mvccinfo;
4705  if (curr_mvcc_info->id == mvccid)
4706  {
4707  return true;
4708  }
4709  else if (curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids > 0)
4710  {
4711  /* is the child of current transaction ? */
4712  assert (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids != NULL);
4713 
4714  for (i = 0; i < curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids; i++)
4715  {
4716  if (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids[i] == mvccid)
4717  {
4718  return true;
4719  }
4720  }
4721  }
4722 
4723  return false;
4724 }
4725 
4726 /*
4727  * logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot - get MVCC snapshot
4728  *
4729  * return: MVCC snapshot
4730  *
4731  * thread_p(in): thread entry
4732  */
4733 MVCC_SNAPSHOT *
4734 logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
4735 {
4736  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
4737 
4738  if (tdes->tran_index == LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX || VACUUM_IS_THREAD_VACUUM (thread_p))
4739  {
4740  /* System transactions do not have snapshots */
4741  return NULL;
4742  }
4743 
4744  assert (tdes != NULL);
4745 
4746  if (!tdes->mvccinfo.snapshot.valid)
4747  {
4748  if (logtb_get_mvcc_snapshot_data (thread_p) != NO_ERROR)
4749  {
4750  return NULL;
4751  }
4752  }
4753 
4754  return &tdes->mvccinfo.snapshot;
4755 
4756 }
4757 
4758 /*
4759  * logtb_complete_mvcc () - Called at commit or rollback, completes MVCC info
4760  * for current transaction.
4761  *
4762  * return : Void.
4763  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
4764  * tdes (in) : Transaction descriptor.
4765  * committed (in) : True if transaction was committed false if it was aborted.
4766  */
4767 void
4768 logtb_complete_mvcc (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes, bool committed)
4769 {
4770  MVCC_INFO *curr_mvcc_info = NULL;
4771  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
4772  MVCC_SNAPSHOT *p_mvcc_snapshot = NULL;
4773  MVCCID mvccid, position, curr_mvccid;
4774  volatile MVCCID *p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = NULL;
4775  int tran_index, size;
4776  unsigned int i, bit_pos, count, delete_dwords_count, delete_bytes_count, new_bytes_count, next_history_position;
4777  UINT64 bits, mask;
4778  MVCCID bit_area_start_mvccid;
4779  UINT64 *bit_area, *end_bit_area;
4780  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status = NULL, *next_trans_status_history = NULL;
4781  int trans_status_history_last_position = TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE - 1, bit_area_length;
4782  int bit_area_cleanup_threshold = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS;
4783  int bit_area_long_transaction_threshold = MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS - NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES;
4784  UINT64 *p_area = NULL;
4785  int r;
4786  TSC_TICKS start_tick, end_tick;
4787  TSCTIMEVAL tv_diff;
4788  UINT64 tran_complete_time;
4789  bool is_perf_tracking = false;
4790  MVCCID lowest_active_mvccid, old_lowest_active_mvccid;
4791  int version;
4792 
4793  assert (tdes != NULL);
4794 
4795  is_perf_tracking = perfmon_is_perf_tracking ();
4796  if (is_perf_tracking)
4797  {
4798  tsc_getticks (&start_tick);
4799  }
4800 
4801  curr_mvcc_info = &tdes->mvccinfo;
4802  mvccid = curr_mvcc_info->id;
4803 
4804  tran_index = LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p);
4805  p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = LOG_FIND_TRAN_LOWEST_ACTIVE_MVCCID (tran_index);
4806  assert (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid != NULL);
4807 
4808  if (MVCCID_IS_VALID (mvccid))
4809  {
4810  current_trans_status = &log_Gl.mvcc_table.current_trans_status;
4811 
4812 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4813  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
4814 #else
4815  /* Transaction completed - set corresponding bit to 1 */
4816  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4817  bit_area_start_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
4818  bit_area_length = current_trans_status->bit_area_length;
4819 #endif
4820 
4821  /* check whether is long transaction */
4822  if (MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (mvccid, bit_area_start_mvccid))
4823  {
4824 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4825  /* called rarely - current transaction is a long transaction */
4826  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4827 
4828  next_history_position = (mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position + 1) & trans_status_history_last_position;
4829  next_trans_status_history = &mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position];
4830 
4831  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->version, 1);
4832  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->version, current_trans_status->version);
4833  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
4834 #endif
4835 
4836  complete_long_transactions:
4837 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4838  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
4839 #endif
4840 
4841  /* reflect accumulated statistics to B-trees */
4842  if (committed && logtb_tran_update_all_global_unique_stats (thread_p) != NO_ERROR)
4843  {
4844  assert (false);
4845  }
4846 
4847  /* Safe guard: */
4848  assert (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length > 0);
4849  /* remove MVCCID from mvcc_table->long_tran_mvccids array */
4850  for (i = 0; i < current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length - 1; i++)
4851  {
4852  if (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[i] == mvccid)
4853  {
4854  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length - i - 1);
4855  memmove ((void *) (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids + i),
4856  (void *) (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids + i + 1), size);
4857  break;
4858  }
4859  }
4860  assert ((i < (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length - 1))
4861  || (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[i] == mvccid));
4862  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length--;
4863 
4864  goto end_completed;
4865  }
4866 
4867 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4868  /* Transaction completed - set corresponding bit to 1 */
4869  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
4870 
4871  /* set version to last MVCC table in queue - need to detect snapshots */
4872  next_history_position = (mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position + 1) & trans_status_history_last_position;
4873  next_trans_status_history = &mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position];
4874 
4875  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->version, 1);
4876  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->version, current_trans_status->version);
4877  version = next_trans_status_history->version;
4878  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
4879 #endif
4880 
4881 
4882  /* check again whether is long transaction */
4883  if (MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (mvccid, bit_area_start_mvccid))
4884  {
4885  goto complete_long_transactions;
4886  }
4887 
4888  /* reflect accumulated statistics to B-trees */
4889  if (committed && logtb_tran_update_all_global_unique_stats (thread_p) != NO_ERROR)
4890  {
4891  assert (false);
4892  }
4893 
4894  /* Complete the current transaction */
4895  position = mvccid - bit_area_start_mvccid;
4896  mask = MVCC_BITAREA_MASK (position);
4897  p_area = MVCC_GET_BITAREA_ELEMENT_PTR (current_trans_status->bit_area, position);
4898  (*p_area) |= mask;
4899 
4900 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4901  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
4902 #else
4903  /* Need to guarantee lowest active MVCCID atomicity. logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid will read lowest active
4904  * MVCCID using write mode in this case. */
4905  *p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = MVCCID_NULL;
4906 #endif
4907 
4908  /* check if need cleanup */
4909  if (bit_area_length < bit_area_cleanup_threshold)
4910  {
4911  assert (current_trans_status->bit_area_length <= MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS);
4912  goto end_completed;
4913  }
4914 
4915  bits = *(current_trans_status->bit_area);
4916  if (bits != MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
4917  {
4918  goto check_if_full_bitarea;
4919  }
4920  /*
4921  * We need to cleanup bit area - called not too often. There are at least two
4922  * elements bits and at least the first block contains only committed
4923  * transactions (64 committed transactions).
4924  * Remove bit area blocks that contains only committed transactions.
4925  * When all transactions of an element of bit_area are committed, we are sure
4926  * that no other transaction can change any bit from that element. Also,
4927  * no other transaction can change bit_area pointer,
4928  * long_tran_mvccids pointer, bit_area_start_mvccid.
4929  */
4930  bit_area = current_trans_status->bit_area;
4931  end_bit_area = bit_area + MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS (bit_area_length);
4932  do
4933  {
4934  bit_area++;
4935 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4936  bits = ATOMIC_INC_64 (bit_area, 0LL);
4937 #else
4938  bits = *(bit_area);
4939 #endif
4940  }
4941  while ((bit_area < end_bit_area) && (bits == MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED));
4942 
4943  delete_dwords_count = (int) (bit_area - current_trans_status->bit_area);
4944  delete_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (delete_dwords_count);
4945  new_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES ((int) (end_bit_area - bit_area));
4946 
4947  if (new_bytes_count > 0)
4948  {
4949  memmove ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area, (void *) bit_area, new_bytes_count);
4950  }
4951 
4952  memset (((char *) (current_trans_status->bit_area)) + new_bytes_count, MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE,
4953  delete_bytes_count);
4954  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS (delete_dwords_count);
4955 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4956  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, size);
4957  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, -size);
4958 #else
4959  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid += size;
4960  current_trans_status->bit_area_length -= size;
4961  bit_area_start_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
4962  bit_area_length = current_trans_status->bit_area_length;
4963 #endif
4964 
4965  check_if_full_bitarea:
4966  if (bit_area_length < bit_area_long_transaction_threshold)
4967  {
4968  goto end_completed;
4969  }
4970 
4971  /*
4972  * Search for long transactions. Remove committed transactions and add
4973  * active transactions to long transactions array
4974  */
4975  bit_area = current_trans_status->bit_area;
4976  count = MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS (bit_area_length);
4977  end_bit_area = bit_area + count;
4978  delete_dwords_count = count - MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_AFTER_FULL_CLEANUP;
4979  for (i = 1; i <= delete_dwords_count; i++)
4980  {
4981 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
4982  bits = ATOMIC_INC_64 (bit_area, 0LL);
4983 #else
4984  bits = *bit_area;
4985 #endif
4986  curr_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid + (i - 1) * MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS;
4987  if (bits != MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
4988  {
4989  /* expect most of the transactions already committed */
4990  mask = 1;
4991  for (bit_pos = 0; bit_pos < MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS; bit_pos++, curr_mvccid++)
4992  {
4993  if (!(bits & mask))
4994  {
4995  /* long active transaction founded */
4996  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length++] =
4997  curr_mvccid;
4998  /* set the bit to in order to break faster */
4999  bits |= mask;
5000  if (bits == MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
5001  {
5002  break;
5003  }
5004  }
5005  mask <<= 1;
5006  }
5007  }
5008  bit_area++;
5009  }
5010 
5011  delete_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (delete_dwords_count);
5012  new_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_AFTER_FULL_CLEANUP);
5013 
5014  if (new_bytes_count > 0)
5015  {
5016  memmove ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area, (void *) bit_area, new_bytes_count);
5017  }
5018  memset (((char *) (current_trans_status->bit_area)) + new_bytes_count, MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE,
5019  delete_bytes_count);
5020  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS (delete_dwords_count);
5021 
5022 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
