5023  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, size);
5024  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, -size);
5025 #else
5026  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid += size;
5027  current_trans_status->bit_area_length -= size;
5028  bit_area_start_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
5029  bit_area_length = current_trans_status->bit_area_length;
5030 #endif
5031 
5032  end_completed:
5033 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5034  /* need to copy the current bit area - other threads may read next_trans_status_history, but only the current
5035  * thread can modify it */
5036  if (bit_area_length > 0)
5037  {
5038  count = MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS (bit_area_length);
5039  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
5040  {
5041  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (next_trans_status_history->bit_area + i, current_trans_status->bit_area[i]);
5042  }
5043  }
5044 
5045  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (&next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid, bit_area_start_mvccid);
5046  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->bit_area_length, bit_area_length);
5047 
5048  count = current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length;
5049  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
5050  {
5051  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids + i, current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[i]);
5052  }
5053  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length, count);
5054 
5055  if (committed)
5056  {
5057  /* be sure that transaction modifications can't be vacuumed up to LOG_COMMIT. Otherwise, the following
5058  * scenario will corrupt the database: - transaction set its lowest_active_mvccid to MVCCID_NULL - VACUUM
5059  * clean up transaction modifications - the system crash before LOG_COMMIT of current transaction */
5060  if ((*p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid == MVCCID_NULL)
5061  || MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (*p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid, mvccid))
5062  {
5063  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid, mvccid);
5064  }
5065  }
5066  else
5067  {
5068  /* atomic set transaction lowest active MVCCID */
5069  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid, MVCCID_NULL);
5070  }
5071 
5072  /* prevent code rearrangement */
5073  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position, next_history_position);
5074 
5075  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5076 
5077  /*
5078  * Check whether advancing lowest_active_mvccid is possible. Normally, we have to advance only when
5079  * lowest_active_mvccid == mvccid. However, for safety reason, is better to also check bit_area_start_mvccid.
5080  * If lowest_active_mvccid < bit_area_start_mvccid, it means that something wrong happened (except long
5081  * transaction case) - lowest_active_mvccid was wrongly not updated in a previous commit. So, lowest_active_mvccid
5082  * must be corrected, otherwise VACUUM can't advance.
5083  */
5084  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
5085  if ((lowest_active_mvccid == mvccid)
5086  || MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (lowest_active_mvccid, next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid))
5087  {
5088  logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid (next_trans_status_history->bit_area,
5089  next_trans_status_history->bit_area_length,
5090  next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid,
5091  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids,
5092  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length, &lowest_active_mvccid);
5093  advance_oldest_active_mvccid:
5094  if ((int) next_trans_status_history->version == version)
5095  {
5096  old_lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
5097  if (old_lowest_active_mvccid < lowest_active_mvccid)
5098  {
5099  /* Advance with lowest active MVCCID, to allow VACUUM to advance */
5100  if (!ATOMIC_CAS_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, old_lowest_active_mvccid,
5101  lowest_active_mvccid))
5102  {
5103  goto advance_oldest_active_mvccid;
5104  }
5105  }
5106  }
5107  }
5108 
5109  /* Debug purpose only */
5110  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (&(mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position].lowest_active_mvccid),
5111  lowest_active_mvccid);
5112 #else
5113  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
5114  if ((lowest_active_mvccid == mvccid)
5115  || MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (lowest_active_mvccid, next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid))
5116  {
5117  logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid (next_trans_status_history->bit_area,
5118  next_trans_status_history->bit_area_length,
5119  next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid,
5120  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids,
5121  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length, &lowest_active_mvccid);
5122  current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
5123  }
5124  mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position].lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
5125  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5126 #endif
5127  }
5128  else
5129  {
5130 #if defined(SA_MODE)
5131  if (committed && logtb_tran_update_all_global_unique_stats (thread_p) != NO_ERROR)
5132  {
5133  assert (false);
5134  }
5135 #else /* !SA_MODE */ /* SERVER_MODE */
5136  if (committed)
5137  {
5138  /* There is one unique index that can be modified with no MVCCID being generated: db_serial primary key. This
5139  * could happen in a transaction that only does a create serial and commits. Next code makes sure serial
5140  * index statistics are reflected. */
5141  BTID serial_index_btid = BTID_INITIALIZER;
5142  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *serial_unique_stats = NULL;
5143 
5144  /* Get serial index BTID. */
5145  serial_get_index_btid (&serial_index_btid);
5146  assert (!BTID_IS_NULL (&serial_index_btid));
5147 
5148  /* Get statistics for serial unique index. */
5149  serial_unique_stats = logtb_tran_find_btid_stats (thread_p, &serial_index_btid, false);
5150  if (serial_unique_stats != NULL)
5151  {
5152  /* Reflect serial unique statistics. */
5153  if (logtb_update_global_unique_stats_by_delta (thread_p, &serial_index_btid,
5154  serial_unique_stats->tran_stats.num_oids,
5155  serial_unique_stats->tran_stats.num_nulls,
5156  serial_unique_stats->tran_stats.num_keys,
5157  true) != NO_ERROR)
5158  {
5159  /* No errors are permitted here. */
5160  assert (false);
5161 
5162  /* Fall through to do everything we would do in case of no error. */
5163  }
5164  }
5165  }
5166 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
5167 
5168 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5169  /* atomic set transaction lowest active MVCCID */
5170  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid, MVCCID_NULL);
5171 #else
5172  /* Need to guarantee lowest active MVCCID atomicity. logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid will read lowest active
5173  * MVCCID using write mode in this case */
5174  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5175  *p_transaction_lowest_active_mvccid = MVCCID_NULL;
5176  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5177 #endif
5178  }
5179 
5180  curr_mvcc_info->recent_snapshot_lowest_active_mvccid = MVCCID_NULL;
5181 
5182  p_mvcc_snapshot = &(curr_mvcc_info->snapshot);
5183  if (p_mvcc_snapshot->valid)
5184  {
5185  logtb_tran_reset_count_optim_state (thread_p);
5186  }
5187 
5188  MVCC_CLEAR_MVCC_INFO (curr_mvcc_info);
5189 
5190  logtb_tran_clear_update_stats (&tdes->log_upd_stats);
5191 
5192  if (is_perf_tracking)
5193  {
5194  tsc_getticks (&end_tick);
5195  tsc_elapsed_time_usec (&tv_diff, end_tick, start_tick);
5196  tran_complete_time = tv_diff.tv_sec * 1000000LL + tv_diff.tv_usec;
5197  if (tran_complete_time > 0)
5198  {
5199  perfmon_add_stat (thread_p, PSTAT_LOG_TRAN_COMPLETE_TIME_COUNTERS, tran_complete_time);
5200  }
5201  }
5202 }
5203 
5204 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
5205 /*
5206  * logtb_set_current_tran_index - set index of current transaction
5207  *
5208  * return: tran_index or NULL_TRAN_INDEX
5209  *
5210  * tran_index(in): Transaction index to acquire by current execution
5211  *
5212  * Note: The current execution acquire the given index. If the given
5213  * index is not register, it is not set, an NULL_TRAN_INDEX is
5214  * set instead.
5215  */
5216 int
5217 logtb_set_current_tran_index (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index)
5218 {
5219  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5220  int index; /* The returned index value */
5221 
5222  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
5223  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
5224  {
5225  index = tran_index;
5226  }
5227  else
5228  {
5229  index = NULL_TRAN_INDEX;
5230  }
5231 
5232  if (index == tran_index)
5233  {
5234  LOG_SET_CURRENT_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p, index);
5235  }
5236 
5237  return index;
5238 }
5239 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
5240 
5241 /*
5242  * logtb_set_loose_end_tdes -
5243  *
5244  * return:
5245  *
5246  * tdes(in/out):
5247  *
5248  * Note:
5249  */
5250 static void
5251 logtb_set_loose_end_tdes (LOG_TDES * tdes)
5252 {
5253  if (LOG_ISTRAN_2PC_PREPARE (tdes))
5254  {
5255  tdes->isloose_end = true;
5256  log_Gl.trantable.num_prepared_loose_end_indices++;
5257 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
5258  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_LOG_TRACE_DEBUG))
5259  {
5260  fprintf (stdout,
5261  "\n*** Transaction = %d (index = %d) is prepared to commit as gobal tran = %d\n"
5262  " The coordinator site (maybe the client user = %s) needs to attach\n"
5263  " to this transaction and either commit or abort it. ***\n", tdes->trid, tdes->tran_index,
5264  tdes->gtrid, tdes->client.db_user);
5265  fflush (stdout);
5266  }
5267 #endif
5268  }
5269  else if (LOG_ISTRAN_2PC_IN_SECOND_PHASE (tdes) || tdes->state == TRAN_UNACTIVE_2PC_COLLECTING_PARTICIPANT_VOTES)
5270  {
5271  tdes->isloose_end = true;
5272  log_Gl.trantable.num_coord_loose_end_indices++;
5273 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
5274  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_LOG_TRACE_DEBUG))
5275  {
5276  fprintf (stdout,
5277  "\n*** Transaction = %d (index = %d) needs to complete informing participants\n"
5278  " about its fate = %s and collect participant acknowledgements.\n"
5279  " This transaction has been disassociated from the client user = %s.\n"
5280  " The transaction will be completely finished by the system ***\n", tdes->trid,
5281  tdes->tran_index, ((LOG_ISTRAN_COMMITTED (tdes)) ? "COMMIT" : "ABORT"), tdes->client.db_user);
5282  fflush (stdout);
5283  }
5284 #endif
5285  }
5286 }
5287 
5288 /*
5289  * logtb_set_num_loose_end_trans - set the number of loose end transactions
5290  *
5291  * return: num loose ends
5292  *
5293  * Note: The number of loose ends transactions is set by searching the
5294  * transaction table.
5295  */
5296 int
5297 logtb_set_num_loose_end_trans (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
5298 {
5299  int i;
5300  int r;
5301  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5302 
5303  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER (thread_p);
5304 
5305  log_Gl.trantable.num_coord_loose_end_indices = 0;
5306  log_Gl.trantable.num_prepared_loose_end_indices = 0;
5307 
5308  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
5309  {
5310  if (i != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
5311  {
5312  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
5313  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID)
5314  {
5315  logtb_set_loose_end_tdes (tdes);
5316  }
5317  }
5318  }
5319 
5320  r = (log_Gl.trantable.num_coord_loose_end_indices + log_Gl.trantable.num_prepared_loose_end_indices);
5321 
5322  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
5323 
5324  return r;
5325 }
5326 
5327 /*
5328  * log_find_unilaterally_largest_undo_lsa - find maximum lsa address to undo
5329  *
5330  * return:
5331  *
5332  * Note: Find the maximum log sequence address to undo during the undo
5333  * crash recovery phase.
5334  */
5335 LOG_LSA *
5336 log_find_unilaterally_largest_undo_lsa (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
5337 {
5338  int i;
5339  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5340  LOG_LSA *max = NULL; /* The maximum LSA value */
5341  TRANID trid;
5342  VACUUM_WORKER *worker = NULL;
5343 
5344  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
5345 
5346  /* Check active transactions. */
5347  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
5348  {
5349  if (i != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
5350  {
5351  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
5352  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID
5353  && (tdes->state == TRAN_UNACTIVE_UNILATERALLY_ABORTED || tdes->state == TRAN_UNACTIVE_ABORTED)
5354  && !LSA_ISNULL (&tdes->undo_nxlsa) && (max == NULL || LSA_LT (max, &tdes->undo_nxlsa)))
5355  {
5356  max = &tdes->undo_nxlsa;
5357  }
5358  }
5359  }
5360  /* Check vacuum worker transactions. */
5361  for (trid = LOG_FIRST_VACUUM_WORKER_TRANID; trid <= LOG_LAST_VACUUM_WORKER_TRANID; trid++)
5362  {
5363  worker = vacuum_rv_get_worker_by_trid (thread_p, trid);
5364  if (worker->state != VACUUM_WORKER_STATE_RECOVERY)
5365  {
5366  /* Worker doesn't need any recovery. */
5367  continue;
5368  }
5369  tdes = worker->tdes;
5370  if (max == NULL || LSA_LT (max, &tdes->undo_nxlsa))
5371  {
5372  max = &tdes->undo_nxlsa;
5373  }
5374  }
5375 
5376  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
5377 
5378  return max;
5379 }
5380 
5381 /*
5382  * logtb_find_smallest_lsa - smallest lsa address of all active transactions
5383  *
5384  * return:
5385  *
5386  * lsa(in):
5387  *
5388  */
5389 void
5390 logtb_find_smallest_lsa (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_LSA * lsa)
5391 {
5392  int i;
5393  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5394  LOG_LSA *min_lsa = NULL; /* The smallest lsa value */
5395 
5396  LSA_SET_NULL (lsa);
5397 
5398  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
5399 
5400  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
5401  {
5402  if (i != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
5403  {
5404  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
5405  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && !LSA_ISNULL (&tdes->head_lsa)
5406  && (min_lsa == NULL || LSA_LT (&tdes->head_lsa, min_lsa)))
5407  {
5408  min_lsa = &tdes->head_lsa;
5409  }
5410  }
5411  }
5412 
5413  if (min_lsa != NULL)
5414  {
5415  LSA_COPY (lsa, min_lsa);
5416  }
5417 
5418  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
5419 }
5420 
5421 /*
5422  * logtb_tran_prepare_count_optim_classes - prepare classes for count
5423  * optimization (for unique statistics
5424  * loading)
5425  *
5426  * return: error code
5427  *
5428  * thread_p(in): thread entry
5429  * classes(in): classes names list
5430  * flags(in): flags associated with class names
5431  * n_classes(in): number of classes names
5432  *
5433  * Note: This function is called at prefetch request. It receives a list of
5434  * classes and for each class the COS_TO_LOAD flag will be set if the
5435  * statistics were not already loaded. The statistics will be loaded at
5436  * snapshot.
5437  */
5438 int
5439 logtb_tran_prepare_count_optim_classes (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char **classes, LC_PREFETCH_FLAGS * flags,
5440  int n_classes)
5441 {
5442  int idx;
5443  OID class_oid;
5444  LC_FIND_CLASSNAME find;
5445  LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *class_cos = NULL;
5446 
5447  for (idx = n_classes - 1; idx >= 0; idx--)
5448  {
5449  if (!(flags[idx] & LC_PREF_FLAG_COUNT_OPTIM))
5450  {
5451  continue;
5452  }
5453 
5454  /* get class OID from class name */
5455  find = xlocator_find_class_oid (thread_p, classes[idx], &class_oid, NULL_LOCK);
5456  switch (find)
5457  {
5458  case LC_CLASSNAME_ERROR:
5459  return ER_FAILED;
5460 
5461  case LC_CLASSNAME_EXIST:
5462  if (OID_ISNULL (&class_oid))
5463  {
5464  /* The class OID could not be retrieved. Return error. */
5465  return ER_FAILED;
5466  }
5467  else
5468  {
5469  /* search for class statistics (create if not exist). */
5470  class_cos = logtb_tran_find_class_cos (thread_p, &class_oid, true);
5471  if (class_cos == NULL)
5472  {
5473  /* something wrong happened. Just return error */
5474  return ER_FAILED;
5475  }
5476 
5477  /* Mark class for unique statistics loading. The statistics will be loaded when snapshot will be taken */
5478  if (class_cos->count_state != COS_LOADED)
5479  {
5480  class_cos->count_state = COS_TO_LOAD;
5481  }
5482  }
5483  break;
5484 
5485  default:
5486  break;
5487  }
5488  }
5489 
5490  return NO_ERROR;
5491 }
5492 
5493 /*
5494  * logtb_tran_reset_cos_func - working function for
5495  * logtb_tran_reset_count_optim_state
5496  *
5497  * return:
5498  * data(in): count optimization state entry.
5499  * args(in): not used.
5500  *
5501  * thread_p(in): thread entry
5502  */
5503 static int
5504 logtb_tran_reset_cos_func (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, void *data, void *args)
5505 {
5506  ((LOG_TRAN_CLASS_COS *) data)->count_state = COS_NOT_LOADED;
5507 
5508  return NO_ERROR;
5509 }
5510 
5511 /*
5512  * logtb_tran_reset_count_optim_state - reset count optimization state for all
5513  * class statistics instances
5514  *
5515  * return:
5516  *
5517  * thread_p(in): thread entry
5518  */
5519 void
5520 logtb_tran_reset_count_optim_state (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
5521 {
5522  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (LOG_FIND_THREAD_TRAN_INDEX (thread_p));
5523 
5524  mht_map_no_key (thread_p, tdes->log_upd_stats.classes_cos_hash, logtb_tran_reset_cos_func, NULL);
5525 }
5526 
5527 /*
5528  * logtb_create_unique_stats_from_repr - create unique statistics instances
5529  * for all unique indexes of a class
5530  *
5531  * return: error code
5532  *
5533  * thread_p(in) : thread entry
5534  * class_oid(in) : class for which the unique statistics will be created
5535  */
5536 static int
5537 logtb_create_unique_stats_from_repr (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, OID * class_oid)
5538 {
5539  OR_CLASSREP *classrepr = NULL;
5540  int error_code = NO_ERROR, idx, classrepr_cacheindex = -1;
5541  LOG_TRAN_BTID_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stats = NULL;
5542 
5543  /* get class representation to find the total number of indexes */
5544  classrepr = heap_classrepr_get (thread_p, class_oid, NULL, NULL_REPRID, &classrepr_cacheindex);
5545  if (classrepr == NULL)
5546  {
5547  goto exit_on_error;
5548  }
5549 
5550  for (idx = classrepr->n_indexes - 1; idx >= 0; idx--)
5551  {
5552  if (btree_is_unique_type (classrepr->indexes[idx].type))
5553  {
5554  unique_stats = logtb_tran_find_btid_stats (thread_p, &classrepr->indexes[idx].btid, true);
5555  if (unique_stats == NULL)
5556  {
5557  error_code = ER_FAILED;
5558  goto exit_on_error;
5559  }
5560  error_code =
5561  logtb_get_global_unique_stats (thread_p, &unique_stats->btid, &unique_stats->global_stats.num_oids,
5562  &unique_stats->global_stats.num_nulls, &unique_stats->global_stats.num_keys);
5563  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
5564  {
5565  goto exit_on_error;
5566  }
5567  }
5568  }
5569 
5570  /* free class representation */
5571  heap_classrepr_free_and_init (classrepr, &classrepr_cacheindex);
5572 
5573  return NO_ERROR;
5574 
5575 exit_on_error:
5576  if (classrepr != NULL)
5577  {
5578  heap_classrepr_free_and_init (classrepr, &classrepr_cacheindex);
5579  }
5580 
5581  return (error_code == NO_ERROR && (error_code = er_errid ()) == NO_ERROR) ? ER_FAILED : error_code;
5582 }
5583 
5584 #if defined(ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
5585 /*
5586  * logtb_find_largest_lsa - largest lsa address of all active transactions
5587  *
5588  * return: LOG_LSA *
5589  *
5590  * Note: Find the largest LSA address of all active transactions.
5591  */
5592 LOG_LSA *
5593 logtb_find_largest_lsa (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
5594 {
5595  int i;
5596  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5597  LOG_LSA *max_lsa = NULL; /* The largest lsa value */
5598 
5599  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
5600  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
5601  {
5602  if (i != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
5603  {
5604  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
5605  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && !LSA_ISNULL (&tdes->tail_lsa)
5606  && (max_lsa == NULL || LSA_GT (&tdes->tail_lsa, max_lsa)))
5607  {
5608  max_lsa = &tdes->tail_lsa;
5609  }
5610  }
5611  }
5612  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
5613 
5614  return max_lsa;
5615 }
5616 #endif /* ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION */
5617 
5618 /*
5619  * logtb_find_smallest_and_largest_active_pages - smallest and larger active pages
5620  *
5621  * return: nothing...
5622  *
5623  * smallest(in/out): smallest active log page
5624  * largest(in/out): largest active log page
5625  *
5626  * Note: Find the smallest and larger active pages.
5627  */
5628 void
5629 logtb_find_smallest_and_largest_active_pages (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_PAGEID * smallest, LOG_PAGEID * largest)
5630 {
5631  int i;
5632  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5633 
5634  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
5635 
5636  *smallest = *largest = NULL_PAGEID;
5637 
5638  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
5639  {
5640  if (i != LOG_SYSTEM_TRAN_INDEX)
5641  {
5642  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
5643  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->trid != NULL_TRANID && !LSA_ISNULL (&tdes->head_lsa))
5644  {
5645  if (*smallest == NULL_PAGEID || tdes->head_lsa.pageid < *smallest)
5646  {
5647  *smallest = tdes->head_lsa.pageid;
5648  }
5649  if (*largest == NULL_PAGEID || tdes->tail_lsa.pageid > *largest)
5650  {
5651  *largest = tdes->tail_lsa.pageid;
5652  }
5653  if (*largest == NULL_PAGEID || tdes->posp_nxlsa.pageid > *largest)
5654  {
5655  *largest = tdes->posp_nxlsa.pageid;
5656  }
5657  }
5658  }
5659  }
5660 
5661  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
5662 }
5663 
5664 /*
5665  * logtb_has_deadlock_priority -
5666  *
5667  * return: whether this transaction has deadlock priority
5668  */
5669 bool
5670 logtb_has_deadlock_priority (int tran_index)
5671 {
5672  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
5673 
5674  tdes = LOG_FIND_TDES (tran_index);
5675  if (tdes)
5676  {
5677  return tdes->has_deadlock_priority;
5678  }
5679 
5680  return false;
5681 }
5682 
5683 /*
5684  *logtb_get_new_subtransaction_mvccid - assign a new sub-transaction MVCCID
5685  *
5686  * return: error code
5687  *
5688  * thread_p(in): Thread entry
5689  * curr_mvcc_info(in): current MVCC info
5690  *
5691  * Note: If transaction MVCCID is NULL then a new transaction MVCCID is
5692  * allocated first.
5693  */
5694 int
5695 logtb_get_new_subtransaction_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCC_INFO * curr_mvcc_info)
5696 {
5697  MVCCID id = MVCCID_NULL, mvcc_subid;
5698  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table;
5699  int r;
5700  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status = &log_Gl.mvcc_table.current_trans_status;
5701 #if !defined(NDEBUG) && defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5702  int bit_area_length;
5703 #endif
5704 
5705  assert (curr_mvcc_info != NULL);
5706 
5707  mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
5708 
5709 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5710  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->new_mvccid_lock);
5711 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
5712  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
5713  assert (bit_area_length < MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS && bit_area_length >= 0);
5714 #endif
5715 #else
5716  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5717 #endif
5718 
5719  /* generate new MVCCID and increase bit area length */
5720  if (!MVCCID_IS_VALID (curr_mvcc_info->id))
5721  {
5722 #if !defined(NDEBUG) && defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5723  assert (bit_area_length < (MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS - 1));
5724 #endif
5725 
5726  id = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
5727  MVCCID_FORWARD (log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id);
5728 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5729  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 1);
5730 #else
5731  current_trans_status->bit_area_length++;
5732 #endif
5733  }
5734 
5735  mvcc_subid = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
5736  MVCCID_FORWARD (log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id);
5737 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5738  /* Need atomic operation since other transaction can read the values */
5739  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 1);
5740 #else
5741  current_trans_status->bit_area_length++;
5742 #endif
5743 
5744 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5745  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->new_mvccid_lock);
5746 #else
5747  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5748 #endif
5749 
5750  /* store MVCCID in MVCCINFO */
5751  if (MVCCID_IS_VALID (id))
5752  {
5753  curr_mvcc_info->id = id;
5754  }
5755 
5756  return logtb_assign_subtransaction_mvccid (thread_p, curr_mvcc_info, mvcc_subid);
5757 }
5758 
5759 /*
5760  * logtb_assign_subtransaction_mvccid () - Assign sub-transaction MVCCID.
5761  *
5762  * return : Error code.
5763  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
5764  * curr_mvcc_info (in) : Current transaction MVCC information.
5765  * mvcc_subid (in) : Sub-transaction MVCCID.
5766  */
5767 static int
5768 logtb_assign_subtransaction_mvccid (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, MVCC_INFO * curr_mvcc_info, MVCCID mvcc_subid)
5769 {
5770  assert (curr_mvcc_info != NULL);
5771  assert (MVCCID_IS_VALID (curr_mvcc_info->id));
5772 
5773  if (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids == NULL)
5774  {
5775  curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids = (MVCCID *) malloc (OR_MVCCID_SIZE * 10);
5776  if (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids == NULL)
5777  {
5778  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (MVCCID) * 10);
5779  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
5780  }
5781  curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids = 0;
5782  curr_mvcc_info->max_sub_ids = 10;
5783  }
5784  else if (curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids >= curr_mvcc_info->max_sub_ids)
5785  {
5786  curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids =
5787  (MVCCID *) realloc (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids, OR_MVCCID_SIZE * (curr_mvcc_info->max_sub_ids + 10));
5788  if (curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids == NULL)
5789  {
5790  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1,
5791  (size_t) (OR_MVCCID_SIZE * (curr_mvcc_info->max_sub_ids + 10)));
5792  return ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
5793  }
5794  curr_mvcc_info->max_sub_ids += 10;
5795  }
5796 
5797  curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids[curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids] = mvcc_subid;
5798  curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids++;
5799  curr_mvcc_info->is_sub_active = true;
5800 
5801  return NO_ERROR;
5802 }
5803 
5804 /*
5805  * logtb_complete_sub_mvcc () - Called at end of sub-transaction
5806  *
5807  * return : Void.
5808  * thread_p (in) : Thread entry.
5809  * tdes (in) : Transaction descriptor.
5810  */
5811 void
5812 logtb_complete_sub_mvcc (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, LOG_TDES * tdes)
5813 {
5814  MVCC_INFO *curr_mvcc_info = NULL;
5815  MVCCID mvcc_sub_id, curr_mvccid;
5816  MVCCTABLE *mvcc_table = &log_Gl.mvcc_table;
5817  MVCCID position;
5818  UINT64 *bit_area = NULL, *end_bit_area;
5819  UINT64 bit_area_start_mvccid = MVCCID_NULL;
5820  int trans_status_history_last_position = TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE - 1, bit_area_length, size;
5821  int bit_area_cleanup_threshold = 4 * MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS;
5822  unsigned int count, i, next_history_position, delete_dwords_count, delete_bytes_count, new_bytes_count, bit_pos;
5823  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *current_trans_status, *next_trans_status_history = NULL;
5824  UINT64 bits;
5825  int bit_area_long_transaction_threshold = MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS - NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES;
5826  MVCCID *p_area = NULL;
5827  UINT64 mask;
5828  MVCCID lowest_active_mvccid, old_lowest_active_mvccid;
5829  int r, version;
5830 
5831  assert (tdes != NULL);
5832 
5833  curr_mvcc_info = &tdes->mvccinfo;
5834  if (curr_mvcc_info == NULL)
5835  {
5836  return;
5837  }
5838 
5839  mvcc_sub_id = curr_mvcc_info->sub_ids[curr_mvcc_info->count_sub_ids - 1];
5840 
5841  current_trans_status = &log_Gl.mvcc_table.current_trans_status;
5842 
5843 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5844  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
5845 #else
5846  /* Transaction completed - set corresponding bit to 1 */
5847  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5848  bit_area_start_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
5849  bit_area_length = current_trans_status->bit_area_length;
5850 #endif
5851 
5852  if (MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (mvcc_sub_id, bit_area_start_mvccid))
5853  {
5854 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5855  /* called rarely - current transaction is a long transaction */
5856  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5857 
5858  next_history_position = (mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position + 1) & trans_status_history_last_position;
5859  next_trans_status_history = &mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position];
5860 
5861  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->version, 1);
5862  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->version, current_trans_status->version);
5863  version = next_trans_status_history->version;
5864  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
5865 #endif
5866 
5867  complete_long_transactions:
5868 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5869  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
5870 #endif
5871 
5872  /* Safe guard: */
5873  assert (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length > 0);
5874  /* remove MVCCID from mvcc_table->long_tran_mvccids array */
5875  for (i = 0; i < current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length - 1; i++)
5876  {
5877  if (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[i] == mvcc_sub_id)
5878  {
5879  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length - i - 1);
5880  memmove ((void *) (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids + i),
5881  (void *) (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids + i + 1), size);
5882  break;
5883  }
5884  }
5885  assert ((i < current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length)
5886  || (current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[i] == mvcc_sub_id));
5887  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length--;
5888  goto end_completed;
5889  }
5890 
5891 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5892  r = pthread_mutex_lock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
5893 
5894  next_history_position = (mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position + 1) & trans_status_history_last_position;
5895  next_trans_status_history = &mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position];
5896 
5897  ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->version, 1);
5898  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->version, current_trans_status->version);
5899 
5900  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, 0LL);
5901 #endif
5902 
5903  /* check again whether is long transaction */
5904  if (MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (mvcc_sub_id, current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid))
5905  {
5906  goto complete_long_transactions;
5907  }
5908 
5909  /* complete the current sub transaction */
5910  position = mvcc_sub_id - current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
5911  mask = MVCC_BITAREA_MASK (position);
5912  p_area = MVCC_GET_BITAREA_ELEMENT_PTR (current_trans_status->bit_area, position);
5913  (*p_area) |= mask;
5914 
5915 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5916  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, 0);
5917 #endif
5918 
5919  /* check if need cleanup */
5920  if (bit_area_length < bit_area_cleanup_threshold)
5921  {
5922  assert (current_trans_status->bit_area_length <= MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_BITS);
5923  goto end_completed;
5924  }
5925 
5926  bits = *(current_trans_status->bit_area);
5927  if (bits != MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
5928  {
5929  goto check_if_full_bitarea;
5930  }
5931  /*
5932  * We need to cleanup bit area - called not too often. There are at least two
5933  * elements bits and at least the first block contains only committed
5934  * transactions (64 committed transactions).
5935  * Remove bit area blocks that contains only committed transactions.
5936  * When all transactions of an element of bit_area are committed, we are sure
5937  * that no other transaction can change any bit from that element. Also,
5938  * no other transaction can change bit_area pointer,
5939  * long_tran_mvccids pointer, bit_area_length or bit_area_start_mvccid.
5940  */
5941  bit_area = current_trans_status->bit_area;
5942  end_bit_area = bit_area + MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS (bit_area_length);
5943  do
5944  {
5945  bit_area++;
5946 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5947  bits = ATOMIC_INC_64 (bit_area, 0LL);
5948 #else
5949  bits = *(bit_area);
5950 #endif
5951  }
5952  while ((bit_area < end_bit_area) && (bits == MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED));
5953 
5954  delete_dwords_count = (int) (bit_area - current_trans_status->bit_area);
5955  delete_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (delete_dwords_count);
5956  new_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES ((int) (end_bit_area - bit_area));
5957 
5958  if (new_bytes_count > 0)
5959  {
5960  memmove ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area, (void *) bit_area, new_bytes_count);
5961  }
5962  memset (((char *) (current_trans_status->bit_area)) + new_bytes_count, MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE, delete_bytes_count);
5963  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS (delete_dwords_count);
5964 
5965 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5966  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, size);
5967  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, -size);
5968 #else
5969  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid += size;
5970  current_trans_status->bit_area_length -= size;
5971  bit_area_start_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
5972  bit_area_length = current_trans_status->bit_area_length;
5973 #endif
5974 
5975 check_if_full_bitarea:
5976  if (bit_area_length < bit_area_long_transaction_threshold)
5977  {
5978  goto end_completed;
5979  }
5980 
5981  /*
5982  * Search for long transactions. Remove committed transactions and add
5983  * active transactions to long transactions array
5984  */
5985  bit_area = current_trans_status->bit_area;
5986  count = MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS (bit_area_length);
5987  end_bit_area = bit_area + count;
5988  delete_dwords_count = count - MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_AFTER_FULL_CLEANUP;
5989  for (i = 1; i <= delete_dwords_count; i++)
5990  {
5991 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
5992  bits = ATOMIC_INC_64 (bit_area, 0LL);
5993 #else
5994  bits = *bit_area;
5995 #endif
5996  curr_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid + (i - 1) * MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS;
5997  if (bits != MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
5998  {
5999  /* expect most of the transactions already committed */
6000  mask = 1;
6001  for (bit_pos = 0; bit_pos < MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS; bit_pos++, curr_mvccid++)
6002  {
6003  if (!(bits & mask))
6004  {
6005  /* long active transaction founded */
6006  current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length++] =
6007  curr_mvccid;
6008  /* set the bit to in order to break faster */
6009  bits |= mask;
6010  if (bits == MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
6011  {
6012  break;
6013  }
6014  }
6015  mask <<= 1;
6016  }
6017  }
6018  bit_area++;
6019  }
6020 
6021  delete_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (delete_dwords_count);
6022  new_bytes_count = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BYTES (MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_AFTER_FULL_CLEANUP);
6023 
6024  if (new_bytes_count > 0)
6025  {
6026  memmove ((void *) current_trans_status->bit_area, (void *) bit_area, new_bytes_count);
6027  }
6028 
6029  memset (((char *) (current_trans_status->bit_area)) + new_bytes_count, MVCC_BITAREA_BIT_ACTIVE, delete_bytes_count);
6030  size = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS (delete_dwords_count);
6031 
6032 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
6033  bit_area_start_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid, size);
6034  bit_area_length = ATOMIC_INC_32 (&current_trans_status->bit_area_length, -size);
6035 #else
6036  current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid += size;
6037  current_trans_status->bit_area_length -= size;
6038  bit_area_start_mvccid = current_trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid;
6039  bit_area_length = current_trans_status->bit_area_length;
6040 #endif
6041 
6042 end_completed:
6043 #if defined(HAVE_ATOMIC_BUILTINS)
6044  /* need to copy the current bit area - other threads may read next_trans_status_history, but only the current thread
6045  * can modify it */
6046 
6047  if (bit_area_length > 0)
6048  {
6049  count = MVCC_BITAREA_BITS_TO_ELEMENTS (bit_area_length);
6050  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
6051  {
6052  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (next_trans_status_history->bit_area + i, current_trans_status->bit_area[i]);
6053  }
6054  }
6055 
6056  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (&next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid, bit_area_start_mvccid);
6057  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->bit_area_length, bit_area_length);
6058 
6059  count = current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids_length;
6060  for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
6061  {
6062  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids + i, current_trans_status->long_tran_mvccids[i]);
6063  }
6064  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length, count);
6065 
6066  /* prevent code rearrangement */
6067  ATOMIC_TAS_32 (&mvcc_table->trans_status_history_position, next_history_position);
6068 
6069  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
6070 
6071  /* Check whether advancing lowest_active_mvccid is possible */
6072  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
6073  if ((lowest_active_mvccid == mvcc_sub_id)
6074  || MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (lowest_active_mvccid, next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid))
6075  {
6076  logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid (next_trans_status_history->bit_area, next_trans_status_history->bit_area_length,
6077  next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid,
6078  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids,
6079  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length, &lowest_active_mvccid);
6080  advance_oldest_active_mvccid:
6081  if ((int) next_trans_status_history->version == version)
6082  {
6083  old_lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
6084  if (old_lowest_active_mvccid < lowest_active_mvccid)
6085  {
6086  /* Advance with lowest active MVCCID, to allow VACUUM to advance */
6087  if (!ATOMIC_CAS_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, old_lowest_active_mvccid,
6088  lowest_active_mvccid))
6089  {
6090  goto advance_oldest_active_mvccid;
6091  }
6092  }
6093  }
6094  }
6095 
6096  /* Debug purpose only */
6097  ATOMIC_TAS_64 (&(mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position].lowest_active_mvccid), lowest_active_mvccid);
6098 #else
6099  lowest_active_mvccid = ATOMIC_INC_64 (&current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid, 0LL);
6100  if ((lowest_active_mvccid == mvcc_sub_id)
6101  || MVCC_ID_PRECEDES (lowest_active_mvccid, next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid))
6102  {
6103  logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid (next_trans_status_history->bit_area, next_trans_status_history->bit_area_length,
6104  next_trans_status_history->bit_area_start_mvccid,
6105  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids,
6106  next_trans_status_history->long_tran_mvccids_length, &lowest_active_mvccid);
6107  current_trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
6108  }
6109  mvcc_table->trans_status_history[next_history_position].lowest_active_mvccid = lowest_active_mvccid;
6110  pthread_mutex_unlock (&mvcc_table->active_trans_mutex);
6111 #endif
6112 
6113  curr_mvcc_info->is_sub_active = false;
6114  if (tdes->mvccinfo.snapshot.valid)
6115  {
6116  /* adjust snapshot to reflect committed sub-transaction, since the parent transaction didn't finished yet */
6117  MVCC_SNAPSHOT *snapshot = &tdes->mvccinfo.snapshot;
6118  if (mvcc_sub_id >= snapshot->highest_completed_mvccid)
6119  {
6120  snapshot->highest_completed_mvccid = mvcc_sub_id;
6121  MVCCID_FORWARD (snapshot->highest_completed_mvccid);
6122  }
6123 
6124  if ((mvcc_sub_id >= snapshot->bit_area_start_mvccid)
6125  && ((mvcc_sub_id - snapshot->bit_area_start_mvccid) <
6126  MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS (MVCC_BITAREA_MAXIMUM_ELEMENTS)))
6127  {
6128  position = mvcc_sub_id - snapshot->bit_area_start_mvccid;
6129  mask = MVCC_BITAREA_MASK (position);
6130  p_area = MVCC_GET_BITAREA_ELEMENT_PTR (snapshot->bit_area, position);
6131  (*p_area) |= mask;
6132 
6133  if (snapshot->bit_area_length <= (int) (position))
6134  {
6135  snapshot->bit_area_length = (int) (position + 1);
6136  }
6137  }
6138  }
6139 }
6140 
6141 /*
6142  * logtb_get_highest_completed_mvccid - get highest completed MVCCID
6143  *
6144  * return: error code
6145  *
6146  * bit_area(in): bit area
6147  * bit_area_length(in): bit area length
6148  * bit_area_start_mvccid(in): bit area start MVCCID
6149  * long_tran_mvccids(in): long time MVCCID array
6150  * long_tran_mvccids_length(in): long time MVCCID array length
6151  * highest_completed_position(out): highest completed position
6152  *
6153  * Note: This function get the position in bit area of the highest completed
6154  * MVCCID. If bit_area_length is 0 or all bits in bit area are 0
6155  * the highest completed MVCCID is set to bit_area_start_mvccid - 1
6156  */
6157 void
6158 logtb_get_highest_completed_mvccid (UINT64 * bit_area, int bit_area_length, MVCCID bit_area_start_mvccid,
6159  MVCCID * highest_completed_mvccid)
6160 {
6161  UINT64 *highest_completed_bit_area = NULL;
6162  int bit_pos, count_bits;
6163  UINT64 bits;
6164  int highest_bit_pos, end_position;
6165 
6166  assert (bit_area != NULL && highest_completed_mvccid != NULL && bit_area_start_mvccid >= MVCCID_FIRST
6167  && bit_area_length >= 0);
6168 
6169  if (bit_area_length == 0)
6170  {
6171  *highest_completed_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid - 1;
6172 
6173  return;
6174  }
6175 
6176  /* compute highest highest_bit_pos and highest_completed_bit_area */
6177  highest_bit_pos = -1;
6178  end_position = bit_area_length - 1;
6179  highest_completed_bit_area = MVCC_GET_BITAREA_ELEMENT_PTR (bit_area, end_position);
6180  while (highest_completed_bit_area >= bit_area)
6181  {
6182  bits = *highest_completed_bit_area;
6183  if (bits != 0)
6184  {
6185  /* find most significant bit 1 position */
6186  for (bit_pos = 0, count_bits = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS / 2; count_bits > 0; count_bits >>= 1)
6187  {
6188  if (bits >= (1ULL << count_bits))
6189  {
6190  bit_pos += count_bits;
6191  bits >>= count_bits;
6192  }
6193  }
6194 
6195  assert (bit_pos >= 0 && bit_pos < MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS);
6196  highest_bit_pos = bit_pos;
6197  break;
6198  }
6199 
6200  --highest_completed_bit_area;
6201  }
6202 
6203  /* compute highest_completed */
6204  if (highest_bit_pos == -1)
6205  {
6206  *highest_completed_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid - 1;
6207  }
6208  else
6209  {
6210  count_bits = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS ((int) (highest_completed_bit_area - bit_area));
6211  *highest_completed_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid + count_bits + highest_bit_pos;
6212  }
6213 }
6214 
6215 /*
6216  * logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid - get lowest active MVCID
6217  *
6218  * return: error code
6219  *
6220  * bit_area(in): bit area
6221  * bit_area_length(in): bit area length
6222  * bit_area_start_mvccid(in): bit area start MVCCID
6223  * long_tran_mvccids(in): long time MVCCID array
6224  * long_tran_mvccids_length(in): long time MVCCID array length
6225  * lowest_active_mvccid(out): lowest active MVCCID
6226  *
6227  * Note: This function get the lowest active MVCCID in bit area.
6228  * If have long transactions (long_tran_mvccids not null),
6229  * long_tran_mvccids[0] is the lowest active MVCCID. If bit_area_length is 0
6230  * bit_area_start_mvccid is the lowest active MVCCID. If all bits area are
6231  * 1, the lowest active MVCCID is bit_area_start_mvccid + bit_area_length.
6232  */
6233 void
6234 logtb_get_lowest_active_mvccid (UINT64 * bit_area, int bit_area_length, MVCCID bit_area_start_mvccid,
6235  MVCCID * long_tran_mvccids, unsigned int long_tran_mvccids_length,
6236  MVCCID * lowest_active_mvccid)
6237 {
6238  int bit_pos, count_bits;
6239  UINT64 bits, mask;
6240  UINT64 *lowest_active_bit_area = NULL, *end_bit_area;
6241  int lowest_bit_pos, end_position;
6242 
6243  assert (bit_area != NULL && bit_area_length >= 0 && lowest_active_mvccid != NULL);
6244 
6245  if (long_tran_mvccids != NULL && long_tran_mvccids_length > 0)
6246  {
6247  /* long time transactions are ordered */
6248  *lowest_active_mvccid = *long_tran_mvccids;
6249  return;
6250  }
6251 
6252  if (bit_area_length == 0)
6253  {
6254  *lowest_active_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid;
6255  return;
6256  }
6257 
6258  /* find the lowest bit 0 */
6259  lowest_bit_pos = -1;
6260  end_position = bit_area_length - 1;
6261  lowest_active_bit_area = bit_area;
6262  end_bit_area = MVCC_GET_BITAREA_ELEMENT_PTR (bit_area, end_position);
6263  while (lowest_active_bit_area <= end_bit_area)
6264  {
6265  bits = *lowest_active_bit_area;
6266  if (bits != MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_ALL_COMMITTED)
6267  {
6268  /* find least significant bit 0 position */
6269  for (bit_pos = 0, count_bits = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENT_BITS / 2; count_bits > 0; count_bits >>= 1)
6270  {
6271  mask = (1ULL << count_bits) - 1;
6272  if ((bits & mask) == mask)
6273  {
6274  bit_pos += count_bits;
6275  bits >>= count_bits;
6276  }
6277  }
6278  lowest_bit_pos = bit_pos;
6279  break;
6280  }
6281  lowest_active_bit_area++;
6282  }
6283  /* compute lowest_active_mvccid */
6284  if (lowest_bit_pos == -1)
6285  {
6286  /* didn't fount 0 bit */
6287  *lowest_active_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid + bit_area_length;
6288  }
6289  else
6290  {
6291  count_bits = MVCC_BITAREA_ELEMENTS_TO_BITS ((int) (lowest_active_bit_area - bit_area));
6292  *lowest_active_mvccid = bit_area_start_mvccid + count_bits + lowest_bit_pos;
6293  }
6294 }
6295 
6296 /*
6297  * logtb_global_unique_stat_alloc () - allocate a new structure of unique
6298  * statistics for a btree
6299  * returns: new pointer or NULL on error
6300  */
6301 static void *
6302 logtb_global_unique_stat_alloc (void)
6303 {
6304  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stat;
6305 
6306  unique_stat = (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *) malloc (sizeof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS));
6307  if (unique_stat == NULL)
6308  {
6309  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS));
6310  return NULL;
6311  }
6312 
6313  pthread_mutex_init (&unique_stat->mutex, NULL);
6314  return (void *) unique_stat;
6315 }
6316 
6317 /*
6318  * logtb_global_unique_stat_free () - free a global unique statistics of a btree
6319  * returns: error code or NO_ERROR
6320  * unique_stat(in): global unique statistics entry to free
6321  * (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS)
6322  */
6323 static int
6324 logtb_global_unique_stat_free (void *unique_stat)
6325 {
6326  if (unique_stat != NULL)
6327  {
6328  pthread_mutex_destroy (&((GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *) unique_stat)->mutex);
6329  free (unique_stat);
6330  return NO_ERROR;
6331  }
6332  else
6333  {
6334  return ER_FAILED;
6335  }
6336 }
6337 
6338 /*
6339  * logtb_global_unique_stat_init () - initialize global unique statistics element
6340  * returns: error code or NO_ERROR
6341  * unique_stat(in): global unique statistics element
6342  */
6343 static int
6344 logtb_global_unique_stat_init (void *unique_stat)
6345 {
6346  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *unique_stat_p = (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *) unique_stat;
6347 
6348  if (unique_stat == NULL)
6349  {
6350  return ER_FAILED;
6351  }
6352 
6353  /* initialize fields */
6354  BTID_SET_NULL (&unique_stat_p->btid);
6355  unique_stat_p->unique_stats.num_nulls = 0;
6356  unique_stat_p->unique_stats.num_keys = 0;
6357  unique_stat_p->unique_stats.num_oids = 0;
6358  LSA_SET_NULL (&unique_stat_p->last_log_lsa);
6359 
6360  return NO_ERROR;
6361 }
6362 
6363 /*
6364  * logtb_global_unique_stat_key_copy () - copy a global unique statistics key
6365  * returns: error code or NO_ERROR
6366  * src(in): source
6367  * dest(in): destination
6368  */
6369 static int
6370 logtb_global_unique_stat_key_copy (void *src, void *dest)
6371 {
6372  if (src == NULL || dest == NULL)
6373  {
6374  return ER_FAILED;
6375  }
6376 
6377  BTID_COPY ((BTID *) dest, (BTID *) src);
6378 
6379  /* all ok */
6380  return NO_ERROR;
6381 }
6382 
6383 /*
6384  * logtb_initialize_global_unique_stats_table () - Creates and initializes
6385  * global structure for global
6386  * unique statistics
6387  * return: error code
6388  * thread_p (in) :
6389  */
6390 int
6391 logtb_initialize_global_unique_stats_table (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
6392 {
6393  int ret = NO_ERROR;
6394  LF_ENTRY_DESCRIPTOR *edesc = &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_descriptor;
6395 
6396  if (log_Gl.unique_stats_table.initialized)
6397  {
6398  return NO_ERROR;
6399  }
6400  edesc->of_local_next = offsetof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS, stack);
6401  edesc->of_next = offsetof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS, next);
6402  edesc->of_del_tran_id = offsetof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS, del_id);
6403  edesc->of_key = offsetof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS, btid);
6404  edesc->of_mutex = offsetof (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS, mutex);
6405  edesc->using_mutex = LF_EM_USING_MUTEX;
6406  edesc->f_alloc = logtb_global_unique_stat_alloc;
6407  edesc->f_free = logtb_global_unique_stat_free;
6408  edesc->f_init = logtb_global_unique_stat_init;
6409  edesc->f_uninit = NULL;
6410  edesc->f_key_copy = logtb_global_unique_stat_key_copy;
6411  edesc->f_key_cmp = btree_compare_btids;
6412  edesc->f_hash = btree_hash_btid;
6413  edesc->f_duplicate = NULL;
6414 
6415  /* initialize freelist */
6416  ret = lf_freelist_init (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_freelist, 1, 100, edesc, &global_unique_stats_Ts);
6417  if (ret != NO_ERROR)
6418  {
6419  return ret;
6420  }
6421 
6422  /* initialize hash table */
6423  ret =
6424  lf_hash_init (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_freelist,
6425  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS_HASH_SIZE, edesc);
6426  if (ret != NO_ERROR)
6427  {
6428  lf_hash_destroy (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash);
6429  return ret;
6430  }
6431 
6432  LSA_SET_NULL (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.curr_rcv_rec_lsa);
6433  log_Gl.unique_stats_table.initialized = true;
6434 
6435  return ret;
6436 }
6437 
6438 /*
6439  * logtb_finalize_global_unique_stats_table () - Finalize global structure for
6440  * global unique statistics
6441  * return: error code
6442  * thread_p (in) :
6443  */
6444 void
6445 logtb_finalize_global_unique_stats_table (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
6446 {
6447  if (log_Gl.unique_stats_table.initialized)
6448  {
6449  /* destroy hash and freelist */
6450  lf_hash_destroy (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash);
6451  lf_freelist_destroy (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_freelist);
6452 
6453  log_Gl.unique_stats_table.initialized = false;
6454  }
6455 }
6456 
6457 /*
6458  * logtb_get_global_unique_stats_entry () - returns the entry into the global
6459  * unique statistics associated with
6460  * the given btid
6461  * return: the entry associated with btid or NULL in case of error
6462  * thread_p (in) :
6463  * btid (in) : the btree id for which the entry will be returned
6464  * load_at_creation (in) : if true and there is no entry in hash for btid then
6465  * load statistics from btree header into hash
6466  *
6467  * NOTE: The statistics are searched in the global hash. If they are found
6468  * then the found entry is returned. Otherwise a new entry will be
6469  * created and inserted into hash. If load_at_creation is true then the
6470  * statistics will be loaded from btree header.
6471  *
6472  * NOTE: !!! DO NOT CALL THIS FUNCTION IF YOU HAVE A LATCH ON THE BTREE
6473  * HEADER. THIS CAN CAUSE A DEADLOCK BETWEEN THE LATCH AND THE MUTEX !!!
6474  */
6475 static GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *
6476 logtb_get_global_unique_stats_entry (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid, bool load_at_creation)
6477 {
6478  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
6479  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS);
6480  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *stats = NULL;
6481  int num_oids, num_nulls, num_keys;
6482 
6483  assert (btid != NULL);
6484 
6485 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
6486  {
6487  VPID root_vpid;
6488  root_vpid.pageid = btid->root_pageid;
6489  root_vpid.volid = btid->vfid.volid;
6490  assert (!pgbuf_is_page_fixed_by_thread (thread_p, &root_vpid));
6491  }
6492 #endif
6493 
6494  error_code = lf_hash_find (t_entry, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash, btid, (void **) &stats);
6495  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
6496  {
6497  return NULL;
6498  }
6499  if (stats == NULL)
6500  {
6501  if (load_at_creation)
6502  {
6503  error_code = btree_get_unique_statistics (thread_p, btid, &num_oids, &num_nulls, &num_keys);
6504  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
6505  {
6506  return NULL;
6507  }
6508  }
6509  error_code =
6510  lf_hash_find_or_insert (t_entry, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash, btid, (void **) &stats, NULL);
6511  if (error_code != NO_ERROR || stats == NULL)
6512  {
6513  return NULL;
6514  }
6515  if (load_at_creation)
6516  {
6517  stats->unique_stats.num_oids = num_oids;
6518  stats->unique_stats.num_nulls = num_nulls;
6519  stats->unique_stats.num_keys = num_keys;
6520  }
6521  }
6522 
6523  return stats;
6524 }
6525 
6526 /*
6527  * logtb_get_global_unique_stats () - returns the global unique statistics for
6528  * the given btid
6529  * return: error code
6530  * thread_p (in) :
6531  * btid (in) : the btree id for which the statistics will be returned
6532  * num_oids (in) : address of an integer that will receive the global number
6533  * of oids for the given btid
6534  * num_nulls (in) : address of an integer that will receive the global number
6535  * of nulls for the given btid
6536  * num_keys (in) : address of an integer that will receive the global number
6537  * of keys for the given btid
6538  */
6539 int
6540 logtb_get_global_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid, int *num_oids, int *num_nulls, int *num_keys)
6541 {
6542  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
6543  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *stats = NULL;
6544 
6545  assert (btid != NULL);
6546 
6547  stats = logtb_get_global_unique_stats_entry (thread_p, btid, true);
6548  if (stats == NULL)
6549  {
6550  return ER_FAILED;
6551  }
6552 
6553  *num_oids = stats->unique_stats.num_oids;
6554  *num_nulls = stats->unique_stats.num_nulls;
6555  *num_keys = stats->unique_stats.num_keys;
6556 
6557  pthread_mutex_unlock (&stats->mutex);
6558 
6559  return error_code;
6560 }
6561 
6562 /*
6563  * logtb_rv_update_global_unique_stats_by_abs () - updates the global unique
6564  * statistics associated with
6565  * the given btid by absolute
6566  * values. used for recovery.
6567  * return: error code
6568  * thread_p (in) :
6569  * btid (in) : the btree id for which the statistics will be updated
6570  * num_oids (in) : the new number of oids
6571  * num_nulls (in) : the new number of nulls
6572  * num_keys (in) : the new number of keys
6573  */
6574 int
6575 logtb_rv_update_global_unique_stats_by_abs (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid, int num_oids, int num_nulls,
6576  int num_keys)
6577 {
6578  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
6579  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *stats = NULL;
6580 
6581  /* Because we update the statistics with absolute values (this means that we override old values) we don't need to
6582  * load from btree header old values and, therefore, we give a 'false' value to 'load_at_creation' parameter */
6583  stats = logtb_get_global_unique_stats_entry (thread_p, btid, false);
6584  if (stats == NULL)
6585  {
6586  return ER_FAILED;
6587  }
6588 
6589  if (!LSA_ISNULL (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.curr_rcv_rec_lsa))
6590  {
6591  /* Here we assume that we are at recovery stage */
6592  LSA_COPY (&stats->last_log_lsa, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.curr_rcv_rec_lsa);
6593  }
6594 
6595  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_LOG_UNIQUE_STATS))
6596  {
6597  _er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
6598  "Update stats for index (%d, %d|%d) to nulls=%d, oids=%d, keys=%d. LSA=%lld|%d.\n",
6599  btid->root_pageid, btid->vfid.volid, btid->vfid.fileid, num_nulls, num_oids, num_keys,
6600  (long long int) stats->last_log_lsa.pageid, (int) stats->last_log_lsa.offset);
6601  }
6602 
6603  stats->unique_stats.num_oids = num_oids;
6604  stats->unique_stats.num_nulls = num_nulls;
6605  stats->unique_stats.num_keys = num_keys;
6606 
6607  pthread_mutex_unlock (&stats->mutex);
6608 
6609  return error_code;
6610 }
6611 
6612 /*
6613  * logtb_update_global_unique_stats_by_delta () - updates the global unique
6614  * statistics associated with the
6615  * given btid by delta values
6616  * return: error code
6617  * thread_p (in) :
6618  * btid (in) : the btree id for which the statistics will be updated
6619  * oid_delta (in) : the delta of oids that will be added
6620  * null_delta (in) : the delta of nulls that will be added
6621  * key_delta (in) : the delta of keys that will be added
6622  * log (in) : true if we need to log the changes
6623  */
6624 int
6625 logtb_update_global_unique_stats_by_delta (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid, int oid_delta, int null_delta,
6626  int key_delta, bool log)
6627 {
6628  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
6629  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *stats = NULL;
6630  LOG_TDES *tdes = LOG_FIND_CURRENT_TDES (thread_p);
6631  int num_oids, num_nulls, num_keys;
6632 
6633  if (oid_delta == 0 && key_delta == 0 && null_delta == 0)
6634  {
6635  return NO_ERROR;
6636  }
6637 
6638  stats = logtb_get_global_unique_stats_entry (thread_p, btid, true);
6639  if (stats == NULL)
6640  {
6641  return ER_FAILED;
6642  }
6643 
6644  num_oids = stats->unique_stats.num_oids + oid_delta;
6645  num_nulls = stats->unique_stats.num_nulls + null_delta;
6646  num_keys = stats->unique_stats.num_keys + key_delta;
6647 
6648  if (log)
6649  {
6650  RECDES undo_rec, redo_rec;
6651  char undo_rec_buf[(3 * OR_INT_SIZE) + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE + BTREE_MAX_ALIGN], *datap = NULL;
6652  char redo_rec_buf[(3 * OR_INT_SIZE) + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE + BTREE_MAX_ALIGN];
6653 
6654  /* although we don't change the btree header, we still need to log here the new values of statistics so that they
6655  * can be recovered at recover stage. For undo purposes we log the increments. */
6656  undo_rec.data = NULL;
6657  undo_rec.area_size = 3 * OR_INT_SIZE + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE;
6658  undo_rec.data = PTR_ALIGN (undo_rec_buf, BTREE_MAX_ALIGN);
6659 
6660  undo_rec.length = 0;
6661  datap = (char *) undo_rec.data;
6662  OR_PUT_BTID (datap, btid);
6663  datap += OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE;
6664  OR_PUT_INT (datap, null_delta);
6665  datap += OR_INT_SIZE;
6666  OR_PUT_INT (datap, oid_delta);
6667  datap += OR_INT_SIZE;
6668  OR_PUT_INT (datap, key_delta);
6669  datap += OR_INT_SIZE;
6670  undo_rec.length = CAST_BUFLEN (datap - undo_rec.data);
6671 
6672  redo_rec.data = NULL;
6673  redo_rec.area_size = 3 * OR_INT_SIZE + OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE;
6674  redo_rec.data = PTR_ALIGN (redo_rec_buf, BTREE_MAX_ALIGN);
6675 
6676  redo_rec.length = 0;
6677  datap = (char *) redo_rec.data;
6678  OR_PUT_BTID (datap, btid);
6679  datap += OR_BTID_ALIGNED_SIZE;
6680  OR_PUT_INT (datap, num_nulls);
6681  datap += OR_INT_SIZE;
6682  OR_PUT_INT (datap, num_oids);
6683  datap += OR_INT_SIZE;
6684  OR_PUT_INT (datap, num_keys);
6685  datap += OR_INT_SIZE;
6686  redo_rec.length = CAST_BUFLEN (datap - redo_rec.data);
6687 
6688  log_append_undoredo_data2 (thread_p, RVBT_LOG_GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS_COMMIT, NULL, NULL, HEADER, undo_rec.length,
6689  redo_rec.length, undo_rec.data, redo_rec.data);
6690  LSA_COPY (&stats->last_log_lsa, &tdes->tail_lsa);
6691  }
6692  else if (!LSA_ISNULL (&log_Gl.unique_stats_table.curr_rcv_rec_lsa))
6693  {
6694  /* Here we assume that we are at recovery stage */
6695  LSA_COPY (&stats->last_log_lsa, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.curr_rcv_rec_lsa);
6696  }
6697 
6698  if (prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_LOG_UNIQUE_STATS))
6699  {
6700  _er_log_debug (ARG_FILE_LINE,
6701  "Update stats for index (%d, %d|%d) by nulls=%d, "
6702  "oids=%d, keys=%d to nulls=%d, oids=%d, keys=%d. LSA=%lld|%d.\n", btid->root_pageid,
6703  btid->vfid.volid, btid->vfid.fileid, null_delta, oid_delta, key_delta, num_nulls, num_oids,
6704  num_keys, (long long int) stats->last_log_lsa.pageid, (int) stats->last_log_lsa.offset);
6705  }
6706 
6707  stats->unique_stats.num_oids = num_oids;
6708  stats->unique_stats.num_nulls = num_nulls;
6709  stats->unique_stats.num_keys = num_keys;
6710 
6711  pthread_mutex_unlock (&stats->mutex);
6712 
6713  return error_code;
6714 }
6715 
6716 /*
6717  * logtb_delete_global_unique_stats () - deletes the entry associated with
6718  * the given btid from global unique
6719  * statistics hash
6720  * return: error code
6721  * thread_p (in) :
6722  * btid (in) : the btree id for which the statistics entry will be deleted
6723  */
6724 int
6725 logtb_delete_global_unique_stats (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, BTID * btid)
6726 {
6727  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS);
6728  int error = NO_ERROR;
6729 
6730  assert (!BTID_IS_NULL (btid));
6731 
6732 #if !defined(NDEBUG)
6733  {
6734  VPID root_vpid;
6735  root_vpid.pageid = btid->root_pageid;
6736  root_vpid.volid = btid->vfid.volid;
6737  assert (!pgbuf_is_page_fixed_by_thread (thread_p, &root_vpid));
6738  }
6739 #endif
6740 
6741  error = lf_hash_delete (t_entry, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash, btid, NULL);
6742  if (error != NO_ERROR)
6743  {
6744  return error;
6745  }
6746 
6747  return NO_ERROR;
6748 }
6749 
6750 /*
6751  * logtb_reflect_global_unique_stats_to_btree () - reflects the global
6752  * statistics into the btree
6753  * header
6754  * return: error code
6755  * thread_p (in) :
6756  */
6757 int
6758 logtb_reflect_global_unique_stats_to_btree (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p)
6759 {
6760  int error = NO_ERROR;
6761  LF_HASH_TABLE_ITERATOR it;
6762  LF_TRAN_ENTRY *t_entry = thread_get_tran_entry (thread_p, THREAD_TS_GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS);
6763  GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *stats = NULL;
6764 
6765  if (!log_Gl.unique_stats_table.initialized)
6766  {
6767  return NO_ERROR;
6768  }
6769 
6770  // reflecting stats should not be interrupted
6771  bool save_check_interrupt = logtb_set_check_interrupt (thread_p, false);
6772 
6773  lf_hash_create_iterator (&it, t_entry, &log_Gl.unique_stats_table.unique_stats_hash);
6774  for (stats = (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *) lf_hash_iterate (&it); stats != NULL;
6775  stats = (GLOBAL_UNIQUE_STATS *) lf_hash_iterate (&it))
6776  {
6777  /* reflect only if some changes were logged */
6778  if (!LSA_ISNULL (&stats->last_log_lsa))
6779  {
6780  error = btree_reflect_global_unique_statistics (thread_p, stats, false);
6781  if (error != NO_ERROR)
6782  {
6783  ASSERT_ERROR ();
6784 
6785  // must unlock entry
6786  pthread_mutex_unlock (&stats->mutex);
6787 
6788  // finish transaction
6789  lf_tran_end_with_mb (t_entry);
6790  break;
6791  }
6792  LSA_SET_NULL (&stats->last_log_lsa);
6793  }
6794  }
6795 
6796  (void) logtb_set_check_interrupt (thread_p, save_check_interrupt);
6797 
6798  return error;
6799 }
6800 
6801 /*
6802  * logtb_reset_bit_area_start_mvccid () - Reset bit area start MVCCID
6803  *
6804  * return : Void.
6805  */
6806 void
6807 logtb_reset_bit_area_start_mvccid (void)
6808 {
6809  int history_position;
6810  MVCC_TRANS_STATUS *trans_status;
6811 
6812  trans_status = &log_Gl.mvcc_table.current_trans_status;
6813  assert (trans_status->bit_area_length == 0 && trans_status->bit_area[0] == 0);
6814  trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
6815  trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
6816 
6817  history_position = (log_Gl.mvcc_table).trans_status_history_position;
6818  assert ((history_position >= 0) && (history_position < TRANS_STATUS_HISTORY_MAX_SIZE));
6819  trans_status = log_Gl.mvcc_table.trans_status_history + history_position;
6820  assert (trans_status->bit_area_length == 0);
6821  trans_status->bit_area_start_mvccid = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
6822  trans_status->lowest_active_mvccid = log_Gl.hdr.mvcc_next_id;
6823 }
6824 
6825 /*
6826  * logtb_does_active_user_exist - check whether the specified user is active user
6827  * or not. active user means it is in trantable now.
6828  *
6829  * return: true for existed
6830  * thread_p(in):
6831  * user_name(in): the specified user name
6832  *
6833  */
6834 bool
6835 xlogtb_does_active_user_exist (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, const char *user_name)
6836 {
6837  int i;
6838  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
6839  bool existed = false;
6840 
6841  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
6842 
6843  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
6844  {
6845  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
6846  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->client.is_user_active && strcmp (tdes->client.db_user, user_name) == 0)
6847  {
6848  existed = true;
6849  break;
6850  }
6851  }
6852  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
6853 
6854  return existed;
6855 }
6856 
6857 #if !defined (NDEBUG) && !defined (WINDOWS)
6858 int
6859 logtb_collect_local_clients (int **local_clients_pids)
6860 {
6861  LOG_TDES *tdes; /* Transaction descriptor */
6862  int i, num_client;
6863  int *table;
6864 
6865  *local_clients_pids = NULL;
6866 
6867  table = (int *) malloc (NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (int));
6868  if (table == NULL)
6869  {
6870  return ER_FAILED;
6871  }
6872 
6873  memset (table, 0, NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES * sizeof (int));
6874 
6875  for (i = 0, num_client = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
6876  {
6877  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
6878  if (tdes != NULL && tdes->client.process_id > 0 && tdes->client.host_name != NULL
6879  && (strcmp (tdes->client.host_name, boot_Host_name) == 0
6880  || strcmp (tdes->client.host_name, "localhost") == 0))
6881  {
6882  table[num_client++] = tdes->client.process_id;
6883  }
6884  }
6885 
6886  *local_clients_pids = table;
6887  return num_client;
6888 }
6889 #endif /* !defined (NDEBUG) && !defined (WINDOWS) */
6890 
6891 /*
6892  * logtb_descriptors_start_scan () - start scan function for tran descriptors
6893  * return: NO_ERROR, or ER_code
6894  *
6895  * thread_p(in):
6896  * type(in):
6897  * arg_values(in):
6898  * arg_cnt(in):
6899  * ptr(in/out):
6900  */
6901 int
6902 logtb_descriptors_start_scan (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int type, DB_VALUE ** arg_values, int arg_cnt, void **ptr)
6903 {
6904  SHOWSTMT_ARRAY_CONTEXT *ctx = NULL;
6905  int i, idx, msecs, error = NO_ERROR;
6906  char buf[512];
6907  const char *str;
6908  time_t tval;
6909  INT64 i64val;
6910  XASL_ID xasl_val;
6911  DB_DATETIME time_val;
6912  void *ptr_val;
6913  LOG_TDES *tdes;
6914  DB_VALUE *vals = NULL;
6915  const int num_cols = 46;
6916 
6917  *ptr = NULL;
6918 
6919  ctx = showstmt_alloc_array_context (thread_p, NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES, num_cols);
6920  if (ctx == NULL)
6921  {
6922  error = er_errid ();
6923  return error;
6924  }
6925 
6926  TR_TABLE_CS_ENTER_READ_MODE (thread_p);
6927 
6928  for (i = 0; i < NUM_TOTAL_TRAN_INDICES; i++)
6929  {
6930  tdes = log_Gl.trantable.all_tdes[i];
6931  if (tdes == NULL || tdes->trid == NULL_TRANID)
6932  {
6933  /* The index is not assigned or is system transaction (no-client) */
6934  continue;
6935  }
6936 
6937  idx = 0;
6938  vals = showstmt_alloc_tuple_in_context (thread_p, ctx);
6939  if (vals == NULL)
6940  {
6941  error = er_errid ();
6942  goto exit_on_error;
6943  }
6944 
6945  /* Tran_index */
6946  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->tran_index);
6947  idx++;
6948 
6949  /* Tran_id */
6950  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->trid);
6951  idx++;
6952 
6953  /* Is_loose_end */
6954  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->isloose_end);
6955  idx++;
6956 
6957  /* State */
6958  db_make_string_by_const_str (&vals[idx], log_state_short_string (tdes->state));
6959  idx++;
6960 
6961  /* isolation */
6962  db_make_string_by_const_str (&vals[idx], log_isolation_string (tdes->isolation));
6963  idx++;
6964 
6965  /* Wait_msecs */
6966  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->wait_msecs);
6967  idx++;
6968 
6969  /* Head_lsa */
6970  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->head_lsa);
6971  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
6972  idx++;
6973  if (error != NO_ERROR)
6974  {
6975  goto exit_on_error;
6976  }
6977 
6978  /* Tail_lsa */
6979  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->tail_lsa);
6980  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
6981  idx++;
6982  if (error != NO_ERROR)
6983  {
6984  goto exit_on_error;
6985  }
6986 
6987  /* Undo_next_lsa */
6988  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->undo_nxlsa);
6989  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
6990  idx++;
6991  if (error != NO_ERROR)
6992  {
6993  goto exit_on_error;
6994  }
6995 
6996  /* Postpone_next_lsa */
6997  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->posp_nxlsa);
6998  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
6999  idx++;
7000  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7001  {
7002  goto exit_on_error;
7003  }
7004 
7005  /* Savepoint_lsa */
7006  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->savept_lsa);
7007  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7008  idx++;
7009  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7010  {
7011  goto exit_on_error;
7012  }
7013 
7014  /* Topop_lsa */
7015  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->topop_lsa);
7016  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7017  idx++;
7018  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7019  {
7020  goto exit_on_error;
7021  }
7022 
7023  /* Tail_top_result_lsa */
7024  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->tail_topresult_lsa);
7025  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7026  idx++;
7027  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7028  {
7029  goto exit_on_error;
7030  }
7031 
7032  /* Client_id */
7033  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->client_id);
7034  idx++;
7035 
7036  /* Client_type */
7037  str = boot_client_type_to_string ((BOOT_CLIENT_TYPE) tdes->client.client_type);
7038  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], str);
7039  idx++;
7040  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7041  {
7042  goto exit_on_error;
7043  }
7044 
7045  /* Client_info */
7046  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], tdes->client.client_info);
7047  idx++;
7048  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7049  {
7050  goto exit_on_error;
7051  }
7052 
7053  /* Client_db_user */
7054  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], tdes->client.db_user);
7055  idx++;
7056  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7057  {
7058  goto exit_on_error;
7059  }
7060 
7061  /* Client_program */
7062  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], tdes->client.program_name);
7063  idx++;
7064  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7065  {
7066  goto exit_on_error;
7067  }
7068 
7069  /* Client_login_user */
7070  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], tdes->client.login_name);
7071  idx++;
7072  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7073  {
7074  goto exit_on_error;
7075  }
7076 
7077  /* Client_host */
7078  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], tdes->client.host_name);
7079  idx++;
7080  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7081  {
7082  goto exit_on_error;
7083  }
7084 
7085  /* Client_pid */
7086  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->client.process_id);
7087  idx++;
7088 
7089  /* Topop_depth */
7090  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->topops.last + 1);
7091  idx++;
7092 
7093  /* Num_unique_btrees */
7094  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->num_unique_btrees);
7095  idx++;
7096 
7097  /* Max_unique_btrees */
7098  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->max_unique_btrees);
7099  idx++;
7100 
7101  /* Interrupt */
7102  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->interrupt);
7103  idx++;
7104 
7105  /* Num_transient_classnames */
7106  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->num_transient_classnames);
7107  idx++;
7108 
7109  /* Repl_max_records */
7110  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->num_repl_records);
7111  idx++;
7112 
7113  /* Repl_records */
7114  ptr_val = tdes->repl_records;
7115  if (ptr_val == NULL)
7116  {
7117  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7118  }
7119  else
7120  {
7121  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf), "0x%08" PRIx64, (UINT64) ptr_val);
7122  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7123  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7124  {
7125  goto exit_on_error;
7126  }
7127  }
7128  idx++;
7129 
7130  /* Repl_current_index */
7131  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->cur_repl_record);
7132  idx++;
7133 
7134  /* Repl_append_index */
7135  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->append_repl_recidx);
7136  idx++;
7137 
7138  /* Repl_flush_marked_index */
7139  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->fl_mark_repl_recidx);
7140  idx++;
7141 
7142  /* Repl_insert_lsa */
7143  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->repl_insert_lsa);
7144  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7145  idx++;
7146  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7147  {
7148  goto exit_on_error;
7149  }
7150 
7151  /* Repl_update_lsa */
7152  lsa_to_string (buf, sizeof (buf), &tdes->repl_update_lsa);
7153  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7154  idx++;
7155  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7156  {
7157  goto exit_on_error;
7158  }
7159 
7160  /* First_save_entry */
7161  ptr_val = tdes->first_save_entry;
7162  if (ptr_val == NULL)
7163  {
7164  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7165  }
7166  else
7167  {
7168  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf), "0x%08" PRIx64, (UINT64) ptr_val);
7169  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7170  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7171  {
7172  goto exit_on_error;
7173  }
7174  }
7175  idx++;
7176 
7177  /* Tran_unique_stats */
7178  ptr_val = tdes->tran_unique_stats;
7179  if (ptr_val == NULL)
7180  {
7181  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7182  }
7183  else
7184  {
7185  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf), "0x%08" PRIx64, (UINT64) ptr_val);
7186  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7187  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7188  {
7189  goto exit_on_error;
7190  }
7191  }
7192  idx++;
7193 
7194  /* Modified_class_list */
7195  ptr_val = tdes->modified_class_list;
7196  if (ptr_val == NULL)
7197  {
7198  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7199  }
7200  else
7201  {
7202  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf), "0x%08" PRIx64, (UINT64) ptr_val);
7203  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7204  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7205  {
7206  goto exit_on_error;
7207  }
7208  }
7209  idx++;
7210 
7211  /* Num_temp_files */
7212  db_make_int (&vals[idx], file_get_tran_num_temp_files (thread_p));
7213  idx++;
7214 
7215  /* Waiting_for_res */
7216  ptr_val = tdes->waiting_for_res;
7217  if (ptr_val == NULL)
7218  {
7219  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7220  }
7221  else
7222  {
7223  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf), "0x%08" PRIx64, (UINT64) ptr_val);
7224  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7225  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7226  {
7227  goto exit_on_error;
7228  }
7229  }
7230  idx++;
7231 
7232  /* Has_deadlock_priority */
7233  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->has_deadlock_priority);
7234  idx++;
7235 
7236  /* Suppress_replication */
7237  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->suppress_replication);
7238  idx++;
7239 
7240  /* Query_timeout */
7241  i64val = tdes->query_timeout;
7242  if (i64val <= 0)
7243  {
7244  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7245  }
7246  else
7247  {
7248  tval = i64val / 1000;
7249  msecs = i64val % 1000;
7250  db_localdatetime_msec (&tval, msecs, &time_val);
7251  db_make_datetime (&vals[idx], &time_val);
7252  }
7253  idx++;
7254 
7255  /* Query_start_time */
7256  i64val = tdes->query_start_time;
7257  if (i64val <= 0)
7258  {
7259  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7260  }
7261  else
7262  {
7263  tval = i64val / 1000;
7264  msecs = i64val % 1000;
7265  db_localdatetime_msec (&tval, msecs, &time_val);
7266  db_make_datetime (&vals[idx], &time_val);
7267  }
7268  idx++;
7269 
7270  /* Tran_start_time */
7271  i64val = tdes->tran_start_time;
7272  if (i64val <= 0)
7273  {
7274  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7275  }
7276  else
7277  {
7278  tval = i64val / 1000;
7279  msecs = i64val % 1000;
7280  db_localdatetime_msec (&tval, msecs, &time_val);
7281  db_make_datetime (&vals[idx], &time_val);
7282  }
7283  idx++;
7284 
7285  /* Xasl_id */
7286  XASL_ID_COPY (&xasl_val, &tdes->xasl_id);
7287  if (XASL_ID_IS_NULL (&xasl_val))
7288  {
7289  db_make_null (&vals[idx]);
7290  }
7291  else
7292  {
7293  snprintf (buf, sizeof (buf), "sha1 = %08x | %08x | %08x | %08x | %08x, time_stored = %d sec %d usec",
7294  SHA1_AS_ARGS (&xasl_val.sha1), CACHE_TIME_AS_ARGS (&xasl_val.time_stored));
7295  error = db_make_string_copy (&vals[idx], buf);
7296  if (error != NO_ERROR)
7297  {
7298  goto exit_on_error;
7299  }
7300  }
7301  idx++;
7302 
7303  /* Disable_modifications */
7304  db_make_int (&vals[idx], tdes->disable_modifications);
7305  idx++;
7306 
7307  /* Abort_reason */
7308  str = tran_abort_reason_to_string (tdes->tran_abort_reason);
7309  db_make_string_by_const_str (&vals[idx], str);
7310  idx++;
7311 
7312  assert (idx == num_cols);
7313  }
7314 
7315 
7316  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
7317 
7318  *ptr = ctx;
7319  return NO_ERROR;
7320 
7321 exit_on_error:
7322  TR_TABLE_CS_EXIT (thread_p);
7323 
7324  if (ctx != NULL)
7325  {
7326  showstmt_free_array_context (thread_p, ctx);
7327  }
7328 
7329  return error;
7330 }
7331 
7332 /*
7333  * tran_abort_reason_to_string() - return the string alias of enum value
7334  *
7335  * return: constant string
7336  *
7337  * val(in): the enum value
7338  */
7339 const char *
7340 tran_abort_reason_to_string (TRAN_ABORT_REASON val)
7341 {
7342  switch (val)
7343  {
7344  case TRAN_NORMAL:
7345  return "NORMAL";
7346  case TRAN_ABORT_DUE_DEADLOCK:
7347  return "ABORT_DUE_DEADLOCK";
7348  case TRAN_ABORT_DUE_ROLLBACK_ON_ESCALATION:
7349  return "ABORT_DUE_ROLLBACK_ON_ESCALATION";
7350  }
7351  return "UNKNOWN";
7352 }
7353 
7354 /*
7355  * logtb_check_class_for_rr_isolation_err () - Check if the class have to be checked against serializable conflicts
7356  *
7357  * return : true if the class is not root/trigger/user class, otherwise false
7358  * class_oid (in) : Class object identifier.
7359  *
7360  * Note: Do not check system classes that are not part of catalog for rr isolation level error. Isolation consistency
7361  * is secured using locks anyway. These classes are in a way related to table schema's and can be accessed
7362  * before the actual classes. db_user instances are fetched to check authorizations, while db_root and db_trigger
7363  * are accessed when triggers are modified.
7364  * The RR isolation has to check if an instance that we want to lock was modified by concurrent transaction.
7365  * If the instance was modified, then this means we have an isolation conflict. The check must verify last
7366  * instance version visibility over transaction snapshot. The version is visible if and only if it was not
7367  * modified by concurrent transaction. To check visibility, we must first generate a transaction snapshot.
7368  * Since instances from these classes are accessed before locking tables, the snapshot is generated before
7369  * transaction is blocked on table lock. The results will then seem to be inconsistent with most cases when table
7370  * locks are acquired before snapshot.
7371  */
7372 bool
7373 logtb_check_class_for_rr_isolation_err (const OID * class_oid)
7374 {
7375  assert (class_oid != NULL && !OID_ISNULL (class_oid));
7376 
7377  if (!oid_check_cached_class_oid (OID_CACHE_DB_ROOT_CLASS_ID, class_oid)
7378  && !oid_check_cached_class_oid (OID_CACHE_USER_CLASS_ID, class_oid)
7379  && !oid_check_cached_class_oid (OID_CACHE_TRIGGER_CLASS_ID, class_oid))
7380  {
7381  return true;
7382  }
7383 
7384  return false;
7385 }
7386 
7387 void
7388 logtb_slam_transaction (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_index)
7389 {
7390  logtb_set_tran_index_interrupt (thread_p, tran_index, true);
7391  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_CSS_CONN_SHUTDOWN, 0);
7392 #if defined (SERVER_MODE)
7393  css_shutdown_conn_by_tran_index (tran_index);
7394 #endif // SERVER_MODE
7395 }
7396 
7397 /*
7398  * logtb_check_kill_tran_auth () - User who is not DBA can kill only own transaction
7399  * return: NO_ERROR or error code
7400  * thread_p(in):
7401  * tran_id(in):
7402  * has_authorization(out):
7403  */
7404 static int
7405 logtb_check_kill_tran_auth (THREAD_ENTRY * thread_p, int tran_id, bool * has_authorization)
7406 {
7407  char *tran_client_name;
7408  char *current_client_name;
7409 
7410  assert (has_authorization);
7411 
7412  *has_authorization = false;
7413 
7414  if (logtb_am_i_dba_client (thread_p) == true)
7415  {
7416  *has_authorization = true;
7417  return NO_ERROR;
7418  }
7419 
7420  tran_client_name = logtb_find_client_name (tran_id);
7421  current_client_name = logtb_find_current_client_name (thread_p);
7422 
7423  if (tran_client_name == NULL || current_client_name == NULL)
7424  {
